original: 'on te gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or both?üîΩ

original: yang ci ste gang gi tshe tshig res 'ga' bden pa'i don can dmigs pa de nyid dngos po mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par yongs su shes par rjes su dpag par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: yang ci ste gang gi tshe tshig res 'ga' bden pa'i don can dmigs pa de nyid dngos po mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par yongs su shes par rjes su dpag par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: But if you think that sometimes words have a true meaning, then you should infer that the reality of all things is unmistaken.

original: rgyal ba sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyal ba sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: rgyal ba dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul can thams cad ni rtsis la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig la la lar mi slu ba'i tshig mthong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul can thams cad ni rtsis la sogs pa'i phyogs gcig la la lar mi slu ba'i tshig mthong ba kho na ste /
translated: All objects of the Victorious One, the Buddha, and so on, are words that are seen to be nondeceptive in some respect, such as calculation and so on.

original: mang du smra ba la bden pa'i don can 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mang du smra ba la bden pa'i don can 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that among many words there is not even one that has a true meaning.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skyes bu mang du smra ba la //üîΩbden don can gcig med pa min //
analyzed: skyes bu mang du smra ba la // bden don can gcig med pa min //
translated: Among the many words of a person

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: there is not one that lacks a true meaning.

original: de lta yin dang rgyu mtshungs pa nyid @263b kyis khyad par nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgyu mtshungs pa nyid @263b kyis khyad par nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, then because of the similarity of causes, one could not ascertain the difference between the Omniscient One and others, and everyone would be omniscient. But that is illogical,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ston pa'i phyir zhes sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ston pa'i phyir zhes sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as was explained earlier, it would be teaching a meaning that is mutually contradictory.

original: ci ste yang gang gi tshig tshad ma thams cad kyis rnam par dpyad pa na ma nos par mi nus pa de nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gang gi tshig tshad ma thams cad kyis rnam par dpyad pa na ma nos par mi nus pa de nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the one who cannot be refuted by any valid cognition when it analyzes is omniscient,

original: rang gi phyogs la dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúYou who delight in your own position,‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na bde bar gshegs pa ni don thams cad kyi de kho na nyid dngos su mkhyen pa can yin te /
analyzed: dper na bde bar gshegs pa ni don thams cad kyi de kho na nyid dngos su mkhyen pa can yin te /
translated: For example, the TathƒÅgata is one who directly knows the thatness of all objects.

original: ma thos pa dang rjes su mi dpogs pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i don ston pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma thos pa dang rjes su mi dpogs pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i don ston pa po yin pa'i phyir dper na chu la sogs pa mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: He is one who teaches unmistaken objects that are not heard of or inferred, just as water and so on are realized by direct perception.

original: de ston pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang zhig bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams kyis bde bar gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir nye bar blang ba 'di nyid nam mkha'i gos can rnams kyis rgyal ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyidüîΩdu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: de ston pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gang zhig bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams kyis bde bar gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir nye bar blang ba 'di nyid nam mkha'i gos can rnams kyis rgyal ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
translated: The reason is ‚Äújust like the Teacher,‚Äù because the heirs of the sugatas, in order to prove that the sugata is omniscient, have taken up this treatise, and the sky-clad ones, in order to prove that the conqueror is omniscient, have taken up this treatise.

original: de lta bas na the tshom za ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na the tshom za ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, doubt remains.

original: de bzhin du rgyal ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i gos can rnams kyis sgrub par byed pa bkod pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i gos can rnams kyis sgrub par byed pa bkod pa la /
translated: In the same way, in order to prove that the conqueror is omniscient, the sky-clad ones have taken up this treatise.

original: sh'akya'i bu rnams kyis kyang 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu rnams kyis kyang 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: The sons of the ≈öƒÅkyas also take up this treatise, saying, ‚ÄúThis is not omniscient,

original: de nye bar bstan pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa la sogs pa rnams mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar len par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nye bar bstan pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa la sogs pa rnams mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes nye bar len par byed pa yin no //
translated: because the momentariness of things that it teaches is not correct.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang ji ltar gzugs nye ma thag tu gzugs brnyan 'char ba de ltar 'di dag gi sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i de ma thag tu phan tshun dgrar gyur pa'i sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa rnams nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ji ltar gzugs nye ma thag tu gzugs brnyan 'char ba de ltar 'di dag gi sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa'i de ma thag tu phan tshun dgrar gyur pa'i sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa rnams nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, then just as a reflection arises immediately after a form, so too, immediately after the proof and the refutation, the mutually opposing proof and refutation would remain.

original: de ji ltar gzugs brnyan 'char ba nyid kyis zin pa'i mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa 'di rnams kyis 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par bya ba yi /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzugs brnyan 'char ba nyid kyis zin pa'i mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa 'di rnams kyis 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par bya ba yi /
translated: Since these proofs and refutations are non-abiding, like the arising of a reflection, how can one ascertain omniscience through them?

original: 'di snyam du gang zhig don dam par sus kyang dbyung ba bya bar mi nus pa kho na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du shes par bya'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang zhig don dam par sus kyang dbyung ba bya bar mi nus pa kho na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du shes par bya'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúThat which cannot be established by anyone at all ultimately should be known as omniscience,‚Äù

original: de ltar @264a * //
analyzed: de ltar @264a * //
translated: then in response to that, it is said:

original: kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscience‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag nyid khyad par du 'phags par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid khyad par du 'phags par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the superiority of oneself,

original: ji ltar ne'u le zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar ne'u le zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúJust as a mongoose‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang rigs pa 'ga' zhig po 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa 'ga' zhig po 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning that refutes this?

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúWhatever is a knowable object . . .‚Äù

original: shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs thun mong ba nyid du shin tu grags pa yin zhing gnod byed du 'gyur pa de ni gtan du mi srid pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pas khas blang bar mi bya
analyzed: shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs thun mong ba nyid du shin tu grags pa yin zhing gnod byed du 'gyur pa de ni gtan du mi srid pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pas khas blang bar mi bya
translated: The reasonings such as ‚Äúbeing a knowable object‚Äù are well known to be common to both the similar and dissimilar classes. It is utterly impossible for them to become reasons that refute the probandum. Therefore, those who are logical should not accept them.

original: ste / 'di ltar bde bar gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ste / 'di ltar bde bar gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: For it is possible to state the following: ‚ÄúThe Sugata is not omniscient,

original: shes bya nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / dngos po nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang / smra ba nyid dang / skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i phyir lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bya nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / dngos po nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang / smra ba nyid dang / skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i phyir lam po che'i mi bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: because he is a knowable object, a cognizable object, an existent thing, an existent, a speaker, a human being, and so on, just like a person standing at the crossroads.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are these reasons inconclusive.

original: de ltar dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, because of thoroughly knowing all things, he is asserted to be omniscient.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa de yang nam zhig dbang po'i shes pas sam /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa de yang nam zhig dbang po'i shes pas sam /
translated: Moreover, when does he thoroughly know all things?

original: yid kyi shes pas yin grang re zhig dbang po'i shes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi shes pas yin grang re zhig dbang po'i shes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Is it by means of a sense consciousness or by means of a mental consciousness?

original: de ni so sor nges pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir don ma lus pa'i yul can du rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni so sor nges pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir don ma lus pa'i yul can du rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: First, he does not know all things by means of a sense consciousness because it is illogical that it has all things as its object because it has a specific object.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa so sor nges pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu dbang po rnams kyis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa so sor nges pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu dbang po rnams kyis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: Thus the eye consciousness and so on are generated by the specific causes that are the sense faculties that ascertain the nature of the apprehension of their specific objects.

original: de lta yin dang 'jig rten rang gi yul gyi mtshams las ma 'das pa nyid du shin tu grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'jig rten rang gi yul gyi mtshams las ma 'das pa nyid du shin tu grags pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, it would be well known that the world does not transcend its own domain.

original: 'di dag gis don ma lus pa 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis don ma lus pa 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is illogical that they apprehend all objects.

original: de lta ma yin na dbang po du ma don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbang po du ma don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that many sense faculties would be useless.

original: de lta yin dang shes pa gcig gis tha dad pa'i dbang po gzung bar bya ba yin na yang gzugs dang ro la sogs pa chos thams cad shes so zhes de ltar sangs rgyas pa dag gis brtags pa yin te /üîΩgcig gis thams cad shes pa ste /
analyzed: de lta yin dang shes pa gcig gis tha dad pa'i dbang po gzung bar bya ba yin na yang gzugs dang ro la sogs pa chos thams cad shes so zhes de ltar sangs rgyas pa dag gis brtags pa yin te / gcig gis thams cad shes pa ste /
translated: If that were so, then even though the object of the many sense faculties is grasped by a single consciousness, the Buddhists would have to imagine that all phenomena, such as form, taste, and so on, are known by that single consciousness.üîΩThey say that one knows all and one sees all.

original: gcig gis @264b thams cad mthong ba yin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis @264b thams cad mthong ba yin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They say that one consciousness knows all objects and one eye sees all forms.

original: sangs rgyas pa smra ba po de ni mig gis te byed par 'gyur ba de'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i shes pas ro la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur la 'di la brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa smra ba po de ni mig gis te byed par 'gyur ba de'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i shes pas ro la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur la 'di la brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The Buddhist who says this would have to say that the consciousness that engages through the eye, the instrument, comprehends all phenomena such as taste and so on. But this is not possible.

original: gal te shes pa gcig gis cig car don ma lus pa 'dzin par ma gyur mod //
analyzed: gal te shes pa gcig gis cig car don ma lus pa 'dzin par ma gyur mod //
translated: Even if a single consciousness does not simultaneously apprehend all objects,

original: du mas ni 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: du mas ni 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: many consciousnesses would apprehend them.

original: 'di ltar cig car rnam par shes pa du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar cig car rnam par shes pa du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for many consciousnesses to occur simultaneously.

original: srid du chug na yang dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srid du chug na yang dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were possible, it is not the case that all things are apprehended,

original: thams cad kyi gzhan gyi sems dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ring ba dang / phra ba dang / chod pa la sogs pa'i yul du ma gyur pa'i don ni des gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzhan gyi sems dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ring ba dang / phra ba dang / chod pa la sogs pa'i yul du ma gyur pa'i don ni des gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the minds of others are not objects of the sense faculties, and because it is impossible to apprehend an object that is not present, such as something distant, subtle, or obstructed.

original: gal te 'di snyam du da ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rigs mi mthun pa'i don 'dzin par ma mthong ba de lta na yang dus gzhan du res 'ga' 'ga' zhig rigs mi mthun pa'i don bzung bar gyur to zhes bya bar srid pa
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du da ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rigs mi mthun pa'i don 'dzin par ma mthong ba de lta na yang dus gzhan du res 'ga' 'ga' zhig rigs mi mthun pa'i don bzung bar gyur to zhes bya bar srid pa
translated: If you think that although you do not see consciousnesses such as eye consciousness apprehending objects of dissimilar type at present, it is possible that at other times some consciousnesses of dissimilar type apprehend objects,

original: yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang gi rigs can tshad ma yis //
analyzed: gang gi rigs can tshad ma yis //
translated: The consciousness of dissimilar type

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: that you assert is not tenable.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin so sor nges pa ni rgyu dang 'brel ba'i don gyis glo bur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin so sor nges pa ni rgyu dang 'brel ba'i don gyis glo bur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The individual natures of things are not adventitious in the sense of being related to causes,

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad tham cad kyi rang bzhin nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad tham cad kyi rang bzhin nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because otherwise it would follow that everything would have every nature.

original: de lta yin dang rgyu dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid thob pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni ji ltar rnam pa gzhan nyid du srid /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgyu dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid thob pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni ji ltar rnam pa gzhan nyid du srid /
translated: If that were so, how could that kind of nature related to a cause possibly be another kind?

original: du ba'i rgyu dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i du ba ni gzhan las 'byung ba srid pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: du ba'i rgyu dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i du ba ni gzhan las 'byung ba srid pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is not possible for smoke that exists as the nature related to the cause of smoke to arise from another.

original: yid kyi shes pas shes bya'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi shes pas shes bya'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the object-side of the object of knowledge is the mental consciousness,

original: 'di ltar gal te yang de thams cad kyi yul can yin pa de lta na yang de la rang dbang du don 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yang de thams cad kyi yul can yin pa de lta na yang de la rang dbang du don 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because even if it is the domain of all of them, it does not have the function of apprehending objects independently,

original: 'on pa dang long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on pa dang long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise it would follow that the deaf and the blind and so on would not exist.

original: gzhan yang yin na dbang po'i shes pas yongs su bzung ba'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang yin na dbang po'i shes pas yongs su bzung ba'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, if it were so, then because the object of the sense consciousness is the object that is grasped by the sense faculty,

original: ring ba dang / phra ba dang / chod pa dang / @265a * //
analyzed: ring ba dang / phra ba dang / chod pa dang / @265a * //
translated: it would be able to perceive distant, subtle, and obscured objects,

original: gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the minds of others, and so on.

original: don dbang po'i shes pa'i yul du ma byas pa yang des yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dbang po'i shes pa'i yul du ma byas pa yang des yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would also be able to perceive objects that are not the objects of the sense consciousness.

original: 'di snyam du goms pa las shes rab la sogs pa skyes bu re re la gong nas gong du tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du goms pa las shes rab la sogs pa skyes bu re re la gong nas gong du tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you think that because we see that wisdom and so on arise in each person in a way that is different from the previous one,

original: shin tu rab kyi mthar thug par yang srid pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: shin tu rab kyi mthar thug par yang srid pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: it is possible that they can reach the highest degree of perfection,

original: 'dir gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we reply that this is not so.üîΩThe root text says, ‚ÄúNo one ever sees anything that is beyond the senses.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig goms pa na yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig goms pa na yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: No one ever sees an object that is beyond the senses, even when they are cultivated.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu shin tu shes rab can yang zhib mo'i blos rtogs par bya ba yin pas phra ba'i don dmigs par nus kyang rang gi rigs te mi'i rigs su 'byung ba lha'i mig ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin las ma
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu shin tu shes rab can yang zhib mo'i blos rtogs par bya ba yin pas phra ba'i don dmigs par nus kyang rang gi rigs te mi'i rigs su 'byung ba lha'i mig ma yin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin las ma
translated: Thus, even a person of extremely sharp intelligence must understand this by means of subtle thought. Therefore, although he is able to focus on subtle objects, he does not transcend the nature of his own class, that is, the human class, which is characterized by the absence of the divine eye, etc.

original: 'das par 'jug pa na goms pa las skyes bu phul du byung bar mthong gi /
analyzed: 'das par 'jug pa na goms pa las skyes bu phul du byung bar mthong gi /
translated: When he engages in this, he is seen to be a superior person, born from cultivation.

original: lha'i mig la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha'i mig la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is not seen to possess the divine eye, etc.

original: de ltar yin dang des mi las rnam par 'das pa'i lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pas sems can bde 'gror 'gro ba yang mthong zhing ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang mthong ngo zhes sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis smras par grags pa gang yin pa de mi mthong
analyzed: de ltar yin dang des mi las rnam par 'das pa'i lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pas sems can bde 'gror 'gro ba yang mthong zhing ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang mthong ngo zhes sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis smras par grags pa gang yin pa de mi mthong
translated: Thus, the Buddhists are renowned for saying that ‚Äúhe sees by means of the divine eye that is superior to the human eye, that sentient beings go to happy realms and that they go to miserable realms.‚Äù

original: ngo snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that he thinks that he does not see this.

original: blo thams cad goms pa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyad par du 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: blo thams cad goms pa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyad par du 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: It may be that all cognitions are distinguished by their habituation, etc.

original: de lta na yang 'di dag rang gi yul gyi mtshams las ma 'das pa yin pa na khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag rang gi yul gyi mtshams las ma 'das pa yin pa na khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But even so, they do not go beyond the limits of their objects, and so they are distinguished.

original: rna bas rtogs byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rna bas rtogs byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this extensively, he says, ‚ÄúThe ear cognizes sound, etc.‚Äù

original: ring ba dang phra ba dag la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ring ba dang phra ba dag la dmigs pa ste /
translated: They focus on the distant and the subtle.

original: shes pa de dag gis zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsum pa'o //üîΩla lam / ring dang phra tshogs dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: shes pa de dag gis zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsum pa'o // la lam / ring dang phra tshogs dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those cognitions‚Äù refers to the third, which has that kind of nature.

original: zhes 'don pa der ni gtan tshigs kyang lnga par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'don pa der ni gtan tshigs kyang lnga par bya'o //
translated: In the line, ‚ÄúBecause they focus on the distant and the subtle,‚Äù the reason is to be supplied as the fifth.

original: mig gis kyang sgra la sogs pa mthong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: mig gis kyang sgra la sogs pa mthong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The eye does not see sound, etc.

original: de tsam gyis dbang po'i blo rnams rang gi yul gyi mtshams las mi 'da' bar bstan to //
analyzed: de tsam gyis dbang po'i blo rnams rang gi yul gyi mtshams las mi 'da' bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the cognitions of the senses do not go beyond the limits of their objects.

original: @265b da ni yid kyi shes pa yang shes par bya ba'i yul las 'das pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa mthong ngo zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: @265b da ni yid kyi shes pa yang shes par bya ba'i yul las 'das pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa mthong ngo zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Now, it is shown that the mental consciousness is seen to be superior by the fact that it is beyond the object of consciousness.üîΩTo explain this, he says,

original: de ltar bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, the treatise on astrology, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩby'a ka ra na'i skra shes na //
analyzed: 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir / by'a ka ra na'i skra shes na //
translated: To clarify this, he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the treatise on astrology, etc.‚Äù

original: skar ma'i bstan bcos shes pa'i phyir rgyu skar shes pa'o //
analyzed: skar ma'i bstan bcos shes pa'i phyir rgyu skar shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the treatise on astrology is the knowledge of the stars.

original: rig byed dang ston 'byung la sogs pa shes pa la ste /
analyzed: rig byed dang ston 'byung la sogs pa shes pa la ste /
translated: The knowledge of the Vedas, the appearance of teachers, etc.

original: de dag gi khyad par du 'phags pa de gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par du 'phags pa de gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The superiority of that is the superiority of the mental consciousness.

original: sngon med pa'i sgras chos dang chos ma yin pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i sgras chos dang chos ma yin pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúnever before‚Äù refers to Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: gzhan yang rang gi yul gyi mtshams las ma 'das par yang khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ba ni shin tu rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang cung zad tsam gyi yul gyi mtshams su snang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi yul gyi mtshams las ma 'das par yang khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ba ni shin tu rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang cung zad tsam gyi yul gyi mtshams su snang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that one who does not go beyond the limit of one‚Äôs own domain becomes especially exalted, but rather, one who goes to the very limit of the domain of the slightest thing is exalted.

original: par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: mkha' la khru bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad de 'di ltar gal te bad kan shas che ba'i lus can kha cig khru gang tsam gyi nam mkha' la mchong bar nus pa phyis goms pas rim gyis lus yang ba thob pa can nam mkha' khru bcu'i
analyzed: mkha' la khru bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad de 'di ltar gal te bad kan shas che ba'i lus can kha cig khru gang tsam gyi nam mkha' la mchong bar nus pa phyis goms pas rim gyis lus yang ba thob pa can nam mkha' khru bcu'i
translated: ‚ÄúIn the sky, ten cubits‚Äù and so on. Thus, if some embodied beings who have an excess of phlegm are able to jump into the sky the size of one cubit, and later, through practice, gradually attain a light body, they will be able to jump into the sky up to ten cubits.

original: bar du mchong bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang de dag dpag tshad gcig tu ni 'bad pa byas kyang nam mkha' la mchong bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar du mchong bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang de dag dpag tshad gcig tu ni 'bad pa byas kyang nam mkha' la mchong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But even then, they will not be able to jump into the sky for one yojana, even if they try.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that reason‚Äù and so on concludes.

original: yul du byung ste khyad par 'phags pa'i shes pa ste ring tu song bas zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yul du byung ste khyad par 'phags pa'i shes pa ste ring tu song bas zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i gsum pa'o //
translated: The cognition that arises from the object is distinguished by the word ‚Äúfar-reaching‚Äù which is the third verbal action.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make this clear, he says:

original: khang mig gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khang mig gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In one room, etc.

original: 'jig rten ni 'jig rten gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par de ji ltar bha ra ta'i 'jig rten la bha ra ta'i 'jig rten gyi dbyibs zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'jig rten gyi dbyibs kyi khyad par de ji ltar bha ra ta'i 'jig rten la bha ra ta'i 'jig rten gyi dbyibs zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: The world is the particular shape of the world, just as the shape of the world Bharata is called the world Bharata.

original: 'di la gzhan dag gis kyang kho bo cag lag nas 'dren pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrta dang cho lo'i dor shes pa'i //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan dag gis kyang kho bo cag lag nas 'dren pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / rta dang cho lo'i dor shes pa'i //
translated: In order to show that others also lead us by the hand, he says:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The knowledge of horses and dice, etc.

original: bzhon pa zhes bya ba ni shing rta'o //
analyzed: bzhon pa zhes bya ba ni shing rta'o //
translated: A vehicle is a chariot.

original: 'di ltar thos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar thos te /
translated: Thus it was heard:

original: rkang zhes bya ba ni rgyal po byung bar gyur to //üîΩdes cho lo'i dor @266a * //
analyzed: rkang zhes bya ba ni rgyal po byung bar gyur to // des cho lo'i dor @266a * //
translated: A king appeared.üîΩHe did not know the method of playing dice.

original: thabs mi shes pas rgyal srid mtha' dag cho lo'i skugs la shor bar gyur la /
analyzed: thabs mi shes pas rgyal srid mtha' dag cho lo'i skugs la shor bar gyur la /
translated: The entire kingdom was lost to the dice.

original: de'i btsun mo 'dul byed ma zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i btsun mo 'dul byed ma zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te /
translated: His queen was called Vinayavati.

original: de rgyal srid ma lus pa shor bas 'dul byed ma 'ba' zhig dang lhan cig nags su song ngo //
analyzed: de rgyal srid ma lus pa shor bas 'dul byed ma 'ba' zhig dang lhan cig nags su song ngo //
translated: He lost his entire kingdom. He went to the forest with Vinayavati alone.

original: der song nas kyang de'i gnam bskos kyi dbang gis btsun mo de dang bral bar gyur te /
analyzed: der song nas kyang de'i gnam bskos kyi dbang gis btsun mo de dang bral bar gyur te /
translated: After going there, he was separated from that queen by the power of fate.

original: des sdug pa dang bral ba'i mya ngan shin tu che ba skyes nas mchi ma'i sprin 'thibs pa'i gdong gis bsams pa'i rgya mtshor zhugs pa na lus shin tu rid par gyur te /
analyzed: des sdug pa dang bral ba'i mya ngan shin tu che ba skyes nas mchi ma'i sprin 'thibs pa'i gdong gis bsams pa'i rgya mtshor zhugs pa na lus shin tu rid par gyur te /
translated: He experienced a great grief from being separated from his beloved. With his face covered by a cloud of tears, he entered the ocean of thought. His body became very emaciated.

original: de der 'khyams pa las re zhig na rgyal po dus 'dab kyi g-yog tu gnas te ngo mi shes par gnas par gyur to //üîΩbtsun mo de yang re zhig na stes te pha'i khyim du phyin te /
analyzed: de der 'khyams pa las re zhig na rgyal po dus 'dab kyi g-yog tu gnas te ngo mi shes par gnas par gyur to // btsun mo de yang re zhig na stes te pha'i khyim du phyin te /
translated: He wandered there. At one time, he lived as a servant of King Duddhaka. He lived there unrecognized.üîΩThat queen also, at one time, by chance, went to her father's house.

original: de'i pha yang de'i khyo der 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir 'dul byed mas khyim thab 'dam par byed do zhes grags so //
analyzed: de'i pha yang de'i khyo der 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir 'dul byed mas khyim thab 'dam par byed do zhes grags so //
translated: Her father also was known to be arranging a marriage for her husband to come there.

original: ji ltar 'dul byed ma khyim 'dam mo zhes bya ba rgyal po dus 'dab kyis thos la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul byed ma khyim 'dam mo zhes bya ba rgyal po dus 'dab kyis thos la /
translated: Just as the king Dusprasaha heard the expression mud of the house of a woman,

original: de thos nas kha lo sgyur ba rkang dang der 'gro ba brtsams so //
analyzed: de thos nas kha lo sgyur ba rkang dang der 'gro ba brtsams so //
translated: and after hearing it, he ordered his charioteer to go there.

original: dus 'dab kyis ni cho lo'i don shes kyi brda brtag pa ni mi shes so //
analyzed: dus 'dab kyis ni cho lo'i don shes kyi brda brtag pa ni mi shes so //
translated: Dusprasaha knew the meaning of the word, but did not know the conventional sign.

original: rkang gis ni brda brtag pa shes kyi cho lo'i don ni mi shes so //
analyzed: rkang gis ni brda brtag pa shes kyi cho lo'i don ni mi shes so //
translated: The charioteer knew the conventional sign, but did not know the meaning of the word.

original: dus 'dab kyis 'di ji ltar brda brtags pa yin no snyam du shes te de shes na des rkang la brda brtag pa slobs shig ces smras so //
analyzed: dus 'dab kyis 'di ji ltar brda brtags pa yin no snyam du shes te de shes na des rkang la brda brtag pa slobs shig ces smras so //
translated: Dusprasaha thought, How is this a conventional sign? and knowing it, he said to the charioteer, Learn the conventional sign!

original: rkang gis kyang gal te kho bo la cho lo'i dor thabs slob pa de lta na bslab par bgyi'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: rkang gis kyang gal te kho bo la cho lo'i dor thabs slob pa de lta na bslab par bgyi'o zhes smras so //
translated: The charioteer said, If you teach me the method of the word, then I will learn.

original: de nas dus 'dab kyis /
analyzed: de nas dus 'dab kyis /
translated: Then Dusprasaha said:

original: kun gyis thams cad mi shes la //
analyzed: kun gyis thams cad mi shes la //
translated: No one knows everything,üîΩand no one knows nothing.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smras so //
translated: And so on.

original: de nas rgyal po rkang gis cho lo'i dor thabs dus 'dab la bslabs nas slar yang rgyal srid de las rgyal te slar khugs so zhes gtam du grags so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rkang gis cho lo'i dor thabs dus 'dab la bslabs nas slar yang rgyal srid de las rgyal te slar khugs so zhes gtam du grags so //
translated: Then the king, having trained in the art of walking on his hands during the night, again won the kingdom and regained his position. This is the well-known story.

original: gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa yin na gdon mi za bar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po shes par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa yin na gdon mi za bar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po shes par bya dgos so //
translated: Moreover, if he is omniscient, he must certainly know past and future things.

original: de ltar ma yin te da ltar byung ba tsam zhig shes na phyogs gcig shes par 'gyur gyi thams cad shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te da ltar byung ba tsam zhig shes na phyogs gcig shes par 'gyur gyi thams cad shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If he does not know them, he knows only the present, and so he knows only one part of things, not all of them.

original: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa srid pa yang ma yin no zhes @266b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa srid pa yang ma yin no zhes @266b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is impossible to know the future, etc.,

original: ma 'ongs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe future, etc., are not directly perceived,‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum ni dbang po'i nus pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa yang dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni dbang po'i nus pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa yang dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception does not occur in regard to the future because it arises through the power of the potentiality of the sense faculties, and because the future does not exist.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it inference, because there is no logical mark.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i rtags yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i rtags yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: There is no logical mark that is related to a future entity in any place,

original: ma 'ongs pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the future does not exist.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dpe gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dpe gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes examples.

original: ma 'ongs pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste 'das pa yang smos par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste 'das pa yang smos par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The mention of the future is illustrative; the past should also be mentioned.

original: gang gi phyir de la yang dngos po med pa nyid kyis mngon sum gyi byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang dngos po med pa nyid kyis mngon sum gyi byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is a nonentity, there is no direct perception of it.

original: de lta bas na gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshogs kyis khyab par bsgrub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshogs kyis khyab par bsgrub po //
translated: Therefore, the collection of reasons such as ‚Äúbeing an object of knowledge‚Äù proves its pervasion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas sngar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs 'di'i khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas sngar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs 'di'i khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the pervasion of this previously stated reason ‚Äúbecause it is an entity that is the object of a valid cognition of nonexistence‚Äù is shown.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs rnams kyi khyab pa bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs rnams kyi khyab pa bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, having thus taught the pervasion of the reasons, in order to conclude,

original: de phyir dbang 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de phyir dbang 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, beyond the scope of the senses,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du tshig brtags pas thams cad mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshig brtags pas thams cad mthong ba yin te /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúEverything is seen by means of imagined words.

original: 'di ltar gser thub dang 'od srungs la sogs pas byas pa'i tshig las sh'akya thub pas mthong ba de las kyang gzhan gyis yin no snyam du sems na /üîΩ'di la gang zhig 'di mi bzod //
analyzed: 'di ltar gser thub dang 'od srungs la sogs pas byas pa'i tshig las sh'akya thub pas mthong ba de las kyang gzhan gyis yin no snyam du sems na / 'di la gang zhig 'di mi bzod //
translated: Thus, the vision of ≈öƒÅkyamuni is also something else, something created by words such as ‚ÄòKanakamuni‚Äô and ‚ÄòKƒÅ≈õyapa‚Äô and so on,‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIf someone cannot accept this,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshig ni brtags pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: tshig ni brtags pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWords are imagined.

original: gang gis mthong ba nges mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba nges mthong ngo //
translated: By whom is it seen? It is definitely seen.‚Äù

original: zhes de ma thag tu smras pa 'di mi bzod pa ni 'di snyam du sems te sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i tshig gis thams cad mthong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skyes bu gzhan gyis byas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes de ma thag tu smras pa 'di mi bzod pa ni 'di snyam du sems te sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i tshig gis thams cad mthong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skyes bu gzhan gyis byas pa ste /
translated: He cannot accept this statement immediately above, ‚ÄúEverything is seen by means of imagined words.‚Äù He thinks, ‚ÄúEverything is not seen by means of imagined words such as ‚ÄòBuddhist‚Äô and so on. Rather, it is created by other persons.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste dper na gser thub dang 'od srungs la sogs pas byas pa'i lung gis sh'akya thub pas so snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na gser thub dang 'od srungs la sogs pas byas pa'i lung gis sh'akya thub pas so snyam mo //
translated: For example, the Buddha ≈öƒÅkyamuni thought that the scriptures composed by the Buddhas Vipa≈õyin, ≈öikhin, and so on were the word of the Buddha.

original: de skad du smra ba 'di ni de'i tshig tshad ma ma yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba 'di ni de'i tshig tshad ma ma yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: We would say that the statement of that person is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i ste skyes bu gzhan de'i tshig ni de'i tshig ste mthong par mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i tshig de @267a * //
analyzed: de'i ste skyes bu gzhan de'i tshig ni de'i tshig ste mthong par mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i tshig de @267a * //
translated: The word of that person is the word of another person, the word of the person who is the object of desire to see.

original: dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to the cause, the word of the person who is the object of desire to see.üîΩWe would say that the person who composes the scripture is not a valid cognition.

original: lung byed pa'i skyes bu yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes skabs dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lung byed pa'i skyes bu yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes skabs dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the context.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: sngar bshad pa ste shes bya nyid dang gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ste shes bya nyid dang gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis so //
translated: By the previously explained reasons, such as being an object of knowledge and being an object of comprehension.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi rgyud pa thog ma med la /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi rgyud pa thog ma med la /
translated: But the continuum of the Buddha is beginningless.

original: des byas pa'i grub mtha' yang thog ma med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: des byas pa'i grub mtha' yang thog ma med pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is not the philosophy composed by him also beginningless?

original: de lta yin dang rig byed dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud pa dang rig byed bzhin du 'di dag thog ma med pa'i phyir skyon med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rig byed dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i rgyud pa dang rig byed bzhin du 'di dag thog ma med pa'i phyir skyon med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then just like the Vedic person and the Vedas, these would be beginningless, and so there would be no fault.

original: byed pa po dang byas pa'i tshig //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byas pa'i tshig //
translated: The words ‚Äúauthor‚Äù and ‚Äútext‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: are used in this way.

original: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: gzhan la ltos phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they depend on others,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar zas gtsang gi sras dang des byas pa'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du gser thub dang 'od srungs la sogs pa gzhan dag dang des byas pa'i tshig kyang ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zas gtsang gi sras dang des byas pa'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du gser thub dang 'od srungs la sogs pa gzhan dag dang des byas pa'i tshig kyang ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the words of the son of ≈öuddhodana are not valid, so too the words of others such as Vi·π£·πáu and Kapila are not valid.

original: de lta yin dang 'dra ba'i gang zag rnams dang de'i tshig rnams thog ma med pa nyid du brtags na yang tshad ma ma yin pa de las khyad par du 'phags pa ste ring bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'dra ba'i gang zag rnams dang de'i tshig rnams thog ma med pa nyid du brtags na yang tshad ma ma yin pa de las khyad par du 'phags pa ste ring bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, then even if one imagines that the words of those who are similar to the Buddha and the words of those who are similar to the Buddha are beginningless, they would not be superior to those that are not valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i go 'phang nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i go 'phang nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they remain in the state of non-valid cognition.

original: de la gal te thog ma med pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rig byed 'don pa dang 'dra bar brjod pa de lta na yang thog ma med pa nyid las tshad ma med pa nyid du grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te thog ma med pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rig byed 'don pa dang 'dra bar brjod pa de lta na yang thog ma med pa nyid las tshad ma med pa nyid du grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that the Buddha and so on are like the reciters of the Vedas merely because they are beginningless, then even so, non-valid cognition is not established as beginningless.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa gnyi ga thog ma med pa nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa gnyi ga thog ma med pa nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not contradictory for both valid cognition and non-valid cognition to be beginningless.

original: rig byed 'don pa dang sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams go rims bzhin du tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du thog ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: rig byed 'don pa dang sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams go rims bzhin du tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du thog ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: The reciters of the Vedas and the Buddhists would be valid cognition and non-valid cognition respectively, only if they were beginningless.

original: gnyi ga thog ma med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga thog ma med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: But because both are beginningless, it is not established that they are valid cognition. This is the summarized meaning.

original: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this very point through an example, he says:

original: gang dag tshad ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag tshad ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who say that the Vedas are valid cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma dang nger snang ba dag gi yon tan dang skyon zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang nger snang ba dag gi yon tan dang skyon zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe qualities and faults of valid cognition and the Vedas‚Äù should be connected.

original: da ni dngos po'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i @267b ngo bo ma grub pa nyid spang ba'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa na rig byed de las khyad par du ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni dngos po'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i @267b ngo bo ma grub pa nyid spang ba'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa na rig byed de las khyad par du ston pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to prove that omniscience does not exist by refuting the fact that the object of valid knowledge is not established, he teaches the difference between the Vedas and omniscience.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who say that the Buddha‚Äù and so on.

original: mtshungs par brjod pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid du gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa'i phyir rig byed rtag pa'i sgo nas sam thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig gi sgo nas kyang rung ste dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir 'gal ba
analyzed: mtshungs par brjod pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid du gnyi ga yang mtshungs pa'i phyir rig byed rtag pa'i sgo nas sam thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig gi sgo nas kyang rung ste dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir 'gal ba
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar expression‚Äù means that because both are similar in being the cause of correct conception, there is no contradiction in the Vedas being permanent or in omniscience being the cause of the expression of words, because they realize objects that are beyond the senses.üîΩThose who say this

original: med do zhes gang dag de ltar brjod pa la /
analyzed: med do zhes gang dag de ltar brjod pa la /
translated: Those who say that it does not existüîΩ

original: de skad grub pa de dag la rig byed kyi khyad par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de skad grub pa de dag la rig byed kyi khyad par smra ba yin te /
translated: Those who claim that the omniscient one is established by the five means of valid knowledge are proponents of a specific Vedic scripture.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / sgra dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang / don gyis go ba dag gi nang nas tshad ma gcig gis kyang 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / sgra dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang / don gyis go ba dag gi nang nas tshad ma gcig gis kyang 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, seeing is not established by any of the five means of valid knowledge‚Äîdirect perception, inference, scripture, analogy, or implied meaning.

original: de ji ltar dngos po med pa'i tshad mas zin pa'i yul can gyi med pa de yang tshad mar gyur ba'i rig byed gnag rdzi'i chung ma'i bar la sogs pa la grags pa mtshungs par 'gyur snyam du bsams na /üîΩda ni re zhig mig la sogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma lngas grub pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos po med pa'i tshad mas zin pa'i yul can gyi med pa de yang tshad mar gyur ba'i rig byed gnag rdzi'i chung ma'i bar la sogs pa la grags pa mtshungs par 'gyur snyam du bsams na / da ni re zhig mig la sogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma lngas grub pa sel bar byed do //
translated: If one thinks that the object of a non-thing is apprehended by a valid means of knowledge, then that non-existence would be a valid means of knowledge, and it would be the same as the valid means of knowledge renowned to cowherds and their wives.üîΩNow, in order to dispel the establishment of the omniscient one by the five means of valid knowledge such as direct perception, he says, ‚ÄúThe eye and so on do not see,‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig kho bo cag la sogs pa tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis mngon sum gyi thams cad mkhyen pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig kho bo cag la sogs pa tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis mngon sum gyi thams cad mkhyen pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: We who are proponents of the middle way do not see the omniscient one by the five means of valid knowledge such as direct perception.

original: 'di ltar tshu rol mthong ba'i mngon sum ni rnam pa gsum ste dbang po dang / yid dang / sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshu rol mthong ba'i mngon sum ni rnam pa gsum ste dbang po dang / yid dang / sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rang rig pa'o //
translated: Thus, direct perception is threefold: of the senses, of the mind, and of self-awareness of all mental processes and mental factors.

original: gsum po 'di thams cad kyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di thams cad kyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: None of these three is capable of realizing the Omniscient One,

original: de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not their object.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni so sor nges pa'i gzugs la sogs pa lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni so sor nges pa'i gzugs la sogs pa lnga pa yin te /
translated: The object of the sense consciousnesses is the five objects such as form, which are individually determined.

original: de ltar na des gzhan gyi rgyud la 'du ba'i blo'i chos yul du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na des gzhan gyi rgyud la 'du ba'i blo'i chos yul du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, they do not take as their object the phenomena of the mind that occur in another‚Äôs continuum.

original: yid kyis kyang ma ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyis kyang ma ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the mind,

original: de'i ni dbang po'i shes pa'i sa yongs su gzung ba'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul 'dzin pa nyid kyis dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du so sor nges pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ni dbang po'i shes pa'i sa yongs su gzung ba'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul 'dzin pa nyid kyis dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du so sor nges pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like the sense consciousnesses, it has as its object the individually determined objects such as form, since it apprehends the object that is immediately subsequent to the object that is grasped by the sense consciousnesses.

original: rang rigs pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rigs pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it self-awareness,üîΩbecause it is not the object of the mind that is its effect.

original: de'i yul ni rang gi @268a * //
analyzed: de'i yul ni rang gi @268a * //
translated: The object of that is one's own vidya.üîΩ

original: rgyud la yod pa'i /
analyzed: rgyud la yod pa'i /
translated: Its object is the present mind and mental factors that exist in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: da lta ba'i sems dang sems las byung bas yin pas de gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa dang / rang gi rgyud la yod pa yang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi chos rig par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: da lta ba'i sems dang sems las byung bas yin pas de gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa dang / rang gi rgyud la yod pa yang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi chos rig par byed mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot cognize the mind and mental factors that exist in the continuum of another or that exist in one‚Äôs own continuum but are future, etc.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir des 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i bsam pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir des 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i bsam pa mi 'jug go //
translated: The consciousness of a yogi is not considered to be either a subject or an object because it is the object of attainment.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it inference,

original: de ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis rtags rnam pa gsum la brten par 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis rtags rnam pa gsum la brten par 'dod de /
translated: because the Sugata has asserted that inference is based on three types of logical mark.

original: de la 'dir bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir re zhig mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir re zhig mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, since it is from the perspective of establishing the probandum, it is not from the perspective of nonapprehension.

original: 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the result,üîΩbecause it is not a result that is produced by a cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ni bskal ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa dang lhan cig tu rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ni bskal ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa dang lhan cig tu rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of cause and effect is established by perception and non-apprehension, the existence of cause and effect is not established by intrinsic reality, even in conjunction with omniscience.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang thams cad mthong ba yod par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang thams cad mthong ba yod par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: And a reason based on intrinsic reality does not prove the existence of something that is not seen,

original: de mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not a perception cannot be apprehended as a nature that is not different from it.

original: de lta bas na mthong ba dang gags pa'i rtags su gyur pa gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyogs gcig gi phyogs kyi chos de ni nges par dpyad na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong ba dang gags pa'i rtags su gyur pa gang zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyogs gcig gi phyogs kyi chos de ni nges par dpyad na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is a sign of seeing and not seeing, which is the property of one part of the subject, when analyzed is not found to exist.

original: gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa yod par bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs thams cad skyon gyi rigs gsum las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen pa yod par bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs thams cad skyon gyi rigs gsum las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Moreover, in proving the existence of the Omniscient One, no reason can escape from three types of faults.

original: ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba dang / ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: They are nonestablished, contradictory, and indefinite.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs su ston pa ni dngos po'i chos zhes brjod dam dngos po med pa'i chos sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs su ston pa ni dngos po'i chos zhes brjod dam dngos po med pa'i chos sam /
translated: In this way, the one who teaches the reason is called a ‚Äúphenomenon of entity‚Äù or a ‚Äúphenomenon of nonentity‚Äù or a ‚Äúphenomenon of both.‚Äù

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i chos zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i chos zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types.

original: de la chos can thams cad mkhyen pa la dngos po'i chos phyir rgol ba la grub pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la chos can thams cad mkhyen pa la dngos po'i chos phyir rgol ba la grub pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, it is not possible for an opponent to establish a phenomenon of entity in the subject, the Omniscient One.

original: chos can de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir ram grub na yang rtsod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir ram grub na yang rtsod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that very subject is what is to be proven, it is not established. If it were established, it would follow that there would be no dispute.

original: gang zhig de la dngos po'i chos 'dod pa'i rgol ba de ji ltar dngos po nyid du mi @268b 'dod do /
analyzed: gang zhig de la dngos po'i chos 'dod pa'i rgol ba de ji ltar dngos po nyid du mi @268b 'dod do /
translated: How could an opponent who asserts a phenomenon of entity in that subject not assert it as an entity?

original: rten med pa'i chos tsam bzung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa'i chos tsam bzung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to apprehend a mere phenomenon that lacks a basis.

original: dngos po med pa'i chos kyang thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs su rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos kyang thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs su rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, a non-entity phenomenon is not suitable as a reason to establish omniscience,

original: de ni dngos po las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is contradictory, since it is the opposite of an entity.

original: gnyi ga'i chos kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i chos kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it both,

original: de ni ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ni ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because that is indeterminate.

original: 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i chos ni dngos po'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pas thob par bya ba dngos po la ma 'khrul ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs nyid du
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i chos ni dngos po'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par bcad pas thob par bya ba dngos po la ma 'khrul ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs nyid du
translated: Thus, an entity and a non-entity phenomenon are called non-entities because they are obtained by the exclusion of the discordant class in order to establish an entity phenomenon.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: How could they be a reason that is non-erroneous with respect to an entity?

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpog par byed pa rtags su gyur ba phyogs rnam pa gsum char med pa yang med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpog par byed pa rtags su gyur ba phyogs rnam pa gsum char med pa yang med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the evidence that is the means of inferring does not exist in any of the three modes, omniscience is not established by inference.

original: sgra las byung bas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nges pa yod pa ma yin na zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: sgra las byung bas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nges pa yod pa ma yin na zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show that omniscience is not ascertained by testimony:

original: kun mkhyen sgrub byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun mkhyen sgrub byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe means of establishing omniscience‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra las bskal ba'i don la shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa ni sgra las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las bskal ba'i don la shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa ni sgra las byung ba'o //
translated: The cognition that arises from the meaning of a scripture is testimony.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two types:

original: rtag pa'i sgra las byung ba dang / skyes bus byas pa'i sgra'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i sgra las byung ba dang / skyes bus byas pa'i sgra'i rgyu can no //
translated: that which arises from eternal sound and that which arises from the sound produced by a person.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa ston par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i lung rtag pa med pa'i phyir re zhig dang po ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa ston par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i lung rtag pa med pa'i phyir re zhig dang po ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no eternal scripture that teaches omniscience, the first is not possible.

original: gang yang gsang ba la sogs par bden pa'i ngag can bden pa'i kun du rtog pa can bden pa'i 'dod pa can gang yin pa de btsal bar bya zhing de shes par 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'don pa de yang drang
analyzed: gang yang gsang ba la sogs par bden pa'i ngag can bden pa'i kun du rtog pa can bden pa'i 'dod pa can gang yin pa de btsal bar bya zhing de shes par 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'don pa de yang drang
translated: And also, ‚ÄúOne should seek out those who speak the truth, who have true thoughts, who have true desires, in secret and elsewhere, and one should wish to know them.‚Äù

original: pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Such statements should be understood as having a different meaning.

original: gang yang skyes bus byas pa'i tshig bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ni zhes mthong ba de yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi bden pa des de yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang skyes bus byas pa'i tshig bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ni zhes mthong ba de yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi bden pa des de yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: And also, ‚ÄúThe words of a person, ‚ÄòThe Blessed One, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha said this,‚Äô are not valid, so how could one believe it on the basis of that which is untrue?‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gang ci yang rung ba'i tshig las kho bo cag gis thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang ci yang rung ba'i tshig las kho bo cag gis thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúWe do not understand omniscience from any words at all.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: nga ni thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: nga ni thams cad mkhyen cing thams cad gzigs pa ste /
translated: I am omniscient and see everything.

original: @269a * // de bzhin gshegs pas mi mkhyen pa cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis te /üîΩde bas na de'i tshig nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: @269a * // de bzhin gshegs pas mi mkhyen pa cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis te / de bas na de'i tshig nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says,

original: ci ste de yi tshig nyid kyis //
analyzed: ci ste de yi tshig nyid kyis //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it is established by his words,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: then why is it not the caseüîΩthat his omniscience is established by his words?üîΩ‚Äù

original: de lta yin na phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, there would be the error of mutual dependence.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is taught by the omniscient one,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du 'di thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa yin no zhes de ltar ma rtogs pa de srid du de'i tshig tshad ma nyid du nges par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du 'di thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa yin no zhes de ltar ma rtogs pa de srid du de'i tshig tshad ma nyid du nges par mi 'gyur la /
translated: As long as one does not understand that ‚ÄúThis is taught by the omniscient one,‚Äù one will not ascertain that his words are a valid means of knowledge.

original: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges pa yang tshig de nyid las yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges pa yang tshig de nyid las yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: And because the ascertainment of his omniscience comes from those words, the mutual dependence is clear.

original: rtsa ba gzhan grub ma rtogs par //
analyzed: rtsa ba gzhan grub ma rtogs par //
translated: If you do not understand the other-approved root,üîΩthen you will not understand the other-approved commentary.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that there is no other definitive cause.

original: ci ste yang de nyid nyan thos sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i tshig las thams cad mkhyen pa nges par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste yang de nyid nyan thos sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i tshig las thams cad mkhyen pa nges par byed de /
translated: But if you think that the omniscience of the Buddha is established by the words of the ≈õrƒÅvakas such as ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: gang gi phyir des sh'akya'i rigs kyi rgyal po 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes smos pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des sh'akya'i rigs kyi rgyal po 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes smos pa yin no snyam na /
translated: because he said, ‚ÄúThis king of the ≈öƒÅkya clan is omniscient,‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: then here we say:üîΩThe omniscience of the one who is not omniscient

original: kun mkhyen ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: kun mkhyen ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: is not established by the words of those who are not omniscient.

original: gang gis sangs rgyas pa rnams rang gi tshig kho nas thams cad mkhyen pa ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas pa rnams rang gi tshig kho nas thams cad mkhyen pa ston par byed kyi /
translated: By his own words alone, the Buddhists show that he is omniscient.

original: gzhan gyi tshig las ston par byed pa tshad ma'i dngos por ma grub pa'i gzhan gyis tshig ni rang gi tshig las khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rmongs pa las ma rtogs pa'i rgyu cung zad ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig las ston par byed pa tshad ma'i dngos por ma grub pa'i gzhan gyis tshig ni rang gi tshig las khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rmongs pa las ma rtogs pa'i rgyu cung zad ma mthong ngo //
translated: The words of others are not established as valid cognition. The words of others are not different from his own words in the least. Therefore, we do not see the slightest cause for not understanding due to confusion.

original: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa byung zhing 'byung bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa byung zhing 'byung bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: But if you say that immeasurable Tathagatas have appeared and will appear,

original: de lta yin dang gcig de las gzhan pa'i tshig las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par byed la gzhan las gzhan gyi tshig las so zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gcig de las gzhan pa'i tshig las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par byed la gzhan las gzhan gyi tshig las so zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: and that in that case, one should ascertain omniscience from the words of one of them, and another from the words of another,

original: 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: then we reply:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gcig bsgrub phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa gcig bsgrub pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rgyud pa'i rjes su 'brang ba na skyes bu'i tshe mtha' dag zad na yang tshu rol mthong ba la thams cad mkhyen pa'i nges pa @269b skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gcig bsgrub phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / thams cad mkhyen pa gcig bsgrub pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rgyud pa'i rjes su 'brang ba na skyes bu'i tshe mtha' dag zad na yang tshu rol mthong ba la thams cad mkhyen pa'i nges pa @269b skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du
translated: In order to establish one omniscient being,üîΩyou would have to follow the lineage of omniscient beings,

original: brtag par bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtag par bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and even if the entire life of a person were exhausted, it would be impossible to generate the ascertainment of omniscience in one who sees only a limited range. Therefore, it follows, absurdly, that omniscience would have to be imagined.

original: gzhan yang gang dag la thams cad mkhyen pa mi nye ba ni rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba re zhig lta zhog /'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa rigs pa ma yin pas de'i dus na nye ba de yang shes par mi nus pa kho na'o zhes
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag la thams cad mkhyen pa mi nye ba ni rtogs par mi nus so zhes bya ba re zhig lta zhog /'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa rigs pa ma yin pas de'i dus na nye ba de yang shes par mi nus pa kho na'o zhes
translated: But even at that time, it is not possible to know that which is near, because omniscience is not tenable.

original: bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'di ni kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is called ‚Äúomniscience,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa ni de'i shes pa'o //üîΩde nyid kyi shes bya ste yul yongs su gcad par bya ba shes pa gang la yod pa de ni de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: de'i ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa ni de'i shes pa'o // de nyid kyi shes bya ste yul yongs su gcad par bya ba shes pa gang la yod pa de ni de lta bu yin la /
translated: The consciousness of that is the consciousness of that omniscience.üîΩThat which has the object of that, the object of knowledge, the object of elimination, is like that.

original: de ni de yang yin la shes pa yang yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de yang yin la shes pa yang yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called ‚Äúthat consciousness.‚Äù

original: des stong pa ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: des stong pa ni bral ba'o //
translated: It is empty of that, i.e., free from that.

original: yang na shes pa de'i shes bya gang yin pa de de'i shes pa ste des stong pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na shes pa de'i shes bya gang yin pa de de'i shes pa ste des stong pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, the object of knowledge of that consciousness is the object of that consciousness. It is empty of that, i.e., omniscience. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar lus tsam mthong ba las thams cad mkhyen pa'i zhes bya ba de ltar ni nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus tsam mthong ba las thams cad mkhyen pa'i zhes bya ba de ltar ni nges par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, one cannot definitely ascertain that the one who sees the body is the one who knows all.

original: nges pa 'di ni khyad par can gyi shes pa dang 'brel ba 'dzin pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa 'di ni khyad par can gyi shes pa dang 'brel ba 'dzin pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This ascertainment is related to a special cognition, because it does not occur without the apprehension of the object.

original: khyad par can gyi shes pa de yang dngos po mtha' dag gi yul can yin la /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi shes pa de yang dngos po mtha' dag gi yul can yin la /
translated: And that special cognition has as its object all things.

original: dngos po mtha' dag gi yul can de yang de'i nges pa gzung bar bya ba'i yul 'dzin pa med pa nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag gi yul can de yang de'i nges pa gzung bar bya ba'i yul 'dzin pa med pa nges par mi nus te /
translated: And that which has as its object all things cannot ascertain the object to be apprehended without apprehending the object.

original: gang gi phyir dbyig pa ma bzung bar dbyig pa can gyi blor 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbyig pa ma bzung bar dbyig pa can gyi blor 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
