translated: Because without apprehending the stick, the cognition of the one who has the stick does not occur.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi 'dzin pa'i khyad par ma 'dzin na 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi 'dzin pa'i khyad par ma 'dzin na 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: One does not apprehend that which is to be apprehended without apprehending the special object.

original: dper na dbyig pa 'dzin pa'i khyad par can dbyig pa can 'dzin pa ni dbyig pa'i dngos po ma bzung na mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbyig pa 'dzin pa'i khyad par can dbyig pa can 'dzin pa ni dbyig pa'i dngos po ma bzung na mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the special apprehension of the one who has the stick is not the apprehension of the stick without apprehending the stick itself.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams la yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa'i zhes bya khyad par can shes bya'i dngos pos khyad par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams la yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa'i zhes bya khyad par can shes bya'i dngos pos khyad par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: And for those who have only partial knowledge, there is no special knowledge called ‚Äúthe knowledge of the Omniscient One‚Äù that apprehends the special object of knowledge. This is a non-observation of a wider sphere.

original: khyad par 'dzin pas khyad par can yin pa la khyab pa'i phyir de yang 'di la med do //
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin pas khyad par can yin pa la khyab pa'i phyir de yang 'di la med do //
translated: Because the apprehension of a special object of knowledge is pervaded by the existence of a special subject, and that does not exist in this case.

original: de lta yin dang da lta nye ba'i thams cad rig pa ma yin pa gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa ma nges pa de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig thams cad yod na @270a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang da lta nye ba'i thams cad rig pa ma yin pa gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa ma nges pa de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig thams cad yod na @270a * //
translated: If that were so, then the present non-omniscient person would not ascertain the omniscient person. If all the words of the omniscient person existed for him,

original: yang ma nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang ma nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: then he would not be non-ascertaining, because there would be no valid cognition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nges par byed pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyu tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nges par byed pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyu tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no valid cognition as the fundamental cause for ascertaining the omniscient person.

original: de las gzhan gyi tshig bzhin zhes bya ba ni lam po che'i skyes bu'i tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi tshig bzhin zhes bya ba ni lam po che'i skyes bu'i tshig bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the words of another‚Äù means like the words of a person on the road.

original: ci ste slob ma'i skye bo'i tshogs mtha' dag gi sems kyi spyod pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma yongs su shes pa'i phyir kun brjod pa la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul gyis gdul bya'i skye bo'i yi rangs par byed pa na 'di bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen
analyzed: ci ste slob ma'i skye bo'i tshogs mtha' dag gi sems kyi spyod pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma yongs su shes pa'i phyir kun brjod pa la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul gyis gdul bya'i skye bo'i yi rangs par byed pa na 'di bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen
translated: But if you assert that when he delights disciples by means of the miracles of reading the minds of all disciples and so on, he is effortlessly understood by them to be omniscient,

original: pa nyid du 'bad pa med par de dag gis rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya par 'dod na /
analyzed: pa nyid du 'bad pa med par de dag gis rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya par 'dod na /
translated: then we reply that it is not so, because he is not omniscient.

original: 'dir smras pa ni slob ma kun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩgal te 'di'i dus na nye ba'i skye bo cung zad tsam gyis yongs su shes pa'i don rnams mkhyen pa de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ni slob ma kun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gal te 'di'i dus na nye ba'i skye bo cung zad tsam gyis yongs su shes pa'i don rnams mkhyen pa de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúall disciples‚Äù refers to all disciples of the Buddha.üîΩIf he knows the objects of knowledge that are known by a few of his disciples, he is not omniscient,

original: de'i dus su nye bar mi gnas pa'i 'jig rten pa gzhan gyis yongs su shes pa'i don mi mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus su nye bar mi gnas pa'i 'jig rten pa gzhan gyis yongs su shes pa'i don mi mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not know the objects of knowledge that are known by other worldly beings who are not present at that time.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa'i thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa'i thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is not omniscience that knows one part of all objects of knowledge.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i dus na gnas pa'i skye bo ma lus pa'i don yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i don la mi slu ba yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de'i dus na gnas pa'i skye bo ma lus pa'i don yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i don la mi slu ba yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be too much.

original: thag ring bar gnas pa dang don du mi gnyer ba rnams la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di snyam du gang gi tshe skye bo thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du cig car phyin te /
analyzed: thag ring bar gnas pa dang don du mi gnyer ba rnams la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir ro // 'di snyam du gang gi tshe skye bo thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du cig car phyin te /
translated: It is not possible for the knowledge of all things to be undeceiving with regard to the object of the knowledge of all things that exists at that time, because it is not undeceiving with regard to those who are far away and those who do not seek it.

original: gang dang gang dris pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de dang de kho na lung ston pas das na skye bo thams cad kyis shes pa'i shes bya la mi slu ba yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gang dang gang dris pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de dang de kho na lung ston pas das na skye bo thams cad kyis shes pa'i shes bya la mi slu ba yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that when all beings simultaneously approach the Tathagata and ask whatever questions they want, at that time the Bhagavan answers those questions, and thus at that time the knowledge of all things is undeceiving with regard to the objects of knowledge of all beings,

original: 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: then we reply:üîΩThe knowledge of all things

original: dus gsum 'jig rten gsum gnas pa'i //
analyzed: dus gsum 'jig rten gsum gnas pa'i //
translated: of the three times and three worlds

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod pa'i mi rnams dang 'ga' zhig tu phrad pa srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod pa'i mi rnams dang 'ga' zhig tu phrad pa srid pa ma yin la /
translated: It is impossible for him to meet with any human being who exists in the past, future, or present.

original: mtho ris dang sa 'og dang sa stengs kyi bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gsum na gnas pa rnams dang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris dang sa 'og dang sa stengs kyi bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gsum na gnas pa rnams dang yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does he meet with those who dwell in the three worlds, which are the upper, lower, and middle realms.

original: yang na 'jig rten gsum ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum @270b gyi bdag nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gsum ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum @270b gyi bdag nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the three worlds should be understood as the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: gal te 'di snyam du de'i 'jig rten mtha' dag gis yongs su shes pa'i don shes pa'i nus pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du de'i 'jig rten mtha' dag gis yongs su shes pa'i don shes pa'i nus pa med par gyur na /
translated: If you think that the world does not have the ability to understand the meaning of the statement that the world does not understand him,

original: de'i tshe skye bo cung zad tsam gyis yongs su shes pa'i don la mi slu ba yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye bo cung zad tsam gyis yongs su shes pa'i don la mi slu ba yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could it be nondeceptive with regard to the meaning that a small part of the world understands?

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not.

original: des na de'i dngos po mtha' dag yongs su shes pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid do snyam du kho bo cag sems pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na de'i dngos po mtha' dag yongs su shes pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid do snyam du kho bo cag sems pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, we think that he does have the ability to understand the entire thing.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: 'di ltar cung zad shes pas kyang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar cung zad shes pas kyang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even if one knows a little,üîΩOne cannot know all phenomena and non-phenomena.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don cung zad yongs su shes pa tsam gyis de chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa yongs su shes par 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don cung zad yongs su shes pa tsam gyis de chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa yongs su shes par 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot establish that one knows all phenomena and non-phenomena by merely knowing a little of the meaning that is beyond the senses.

original: gzhan slu ba shes pa la sogs pa dang sgyu ma dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis ma nges pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas ji ltar zos pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan slu ba shes pa la sogs pa dang sgyu ma dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis ma nges pa yin te / 'di ltar sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas ji ltar zos pa ste /
translated: This is not definite for those who know how to deceive others, and those who are skilled in magic and illusions.

original: bza' ba dang tshod ma la sogs pa dang / ji ltar bsam pa ste yid kyi dngos po dang / chad pa na gnas pa'i rdzas la mi slu bar byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bza' ba dang tshod ma la sogs pa dang / ji ltar bsam pa ste yid kyi dngos po dang / chad pa na gnas pa'i rdzas la mi slu bar byed pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, through the application of mantras, medicine, and so on, one can make food, vegetables, and so on, and the things of the mind, one‚Äôs thoughts, and the substances that are the basis of the illusion, undeceiving.

original: de tsam gyis ni chos la sogs pa shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni chos la sogs pa shes pa ma yin no //
translated: But this does not mean that one knows all phenomena and non-phenomena.

original: de bzhin du mig 'phrul la mkhas pa la la dag ngo mtshar ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal yas khang dang / lha'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu la sogs pa nam mkha' la ston par byed de de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig 'phrul la mkhas pa la la dag ngo mtshar ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal yas khang dang / lha'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu la sogs pa nam mkha' la ston par byed de de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, some magicians display in the sky a wondrous garden, a celestial palace, a host of gods, a divine prince, and so on.

original: 'on te de lta bu byed na'ang gna' rabs la sogs pa las tshangs pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te de lta bu byed na'ang gna' rabs la sogs pa las tshangs pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if they do so, then in the ancient texts, etc., BrahmƒÅ and so on are not taught to be omniscient.

original: 'di ltar der tshangs pa'i shes pa ni thogs pa med pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar der tshangs pa'i shes pa ni thogs pa med pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: For it is said that the knowledge of BrahmƒÅ is unobstructed and free from attachment.

original: des ni ji ltar lung las thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: des ni ji ltar lung las thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it that omniscience is not established from the scriptures?

original: 'di la smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: 'di ltar byung ba brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byung ba brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, it is said that the scriptures are unreliable.‚Äù

original: ji ltar sngags dag la drang don du bstan pa de bzhin du de lta bu byung ba la sogs pa la yang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid drang don du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngags dag la drang don du bstan pa de bzhin du de lta bu byung ba la sogs pa la yang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid drang don du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Just as the mantras are taught to be interpretable in meaning, so too should one understand the omniscience of Brahma, etc. to be interpretable in meaning.

original: don gzhan gyi sgra don gzhan brjod pas na drang don zhes bya'o //üîΩrnam pa @271a * //
analyzed: don gzhan gyi sgra don gzhan brjod pas na drang don zhes bya'o // rnam pa @271a * //
translated: It is called ‚Äúinterpretable‚Äù because it expresses one meaning by means of another meaning.üîΩIn one aspect,

original: gcig tu ni chos dang don /
analyzed: gcig tu ni chos dang don /
translated: it is the Dharma and the meaning,

original: 'dod pa dang thar pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang thar pa ste /
translated: the desire and the liberation,

original: skabs su bab pa dag la shes pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa dag la shes pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is unobstructed knowledge with regard to the present occasion.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa de shes pa thogs pa med pa nyid du bstan gyi /
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa de shes pa thogs pa med pa nyid du bstan gyi /
translated: Brahma, etc. are taught to have unobstructed knowledge,

original: don thams cad la thogs pa med pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don thams cad la thogs pa med pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with regard to all meanings.

original: gal te chos la sogs pa la dngos po gzhan la shes pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos la sogs pa la dngos po gzhan la shes pa thogs pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not the case that knowledge is unobstructed with regard to other things such as the Dharma,

original: de ji ltar thogs pa med pa zhes bya zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / gang phyir thogs pa med tsam gyis //
analyzed: de ji ltar thogs pa med pa zhes bya zhe na / de'i phyir / gang phyir thogs pa med tsam gyis //
translated: how can it be called ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù?üîΩTherefore he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: because it is merely unobstructed, etc.

original: de ltar na gal te rang gi don la thogs pa med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa zhes brjod pa de'i tshe skyes bu thams cad kyi shes pa rang gi don la thogs pa med pa'i phyir gang gi de nyid la shes pa thogs pa med pa zhes
analyzed: de ltar na gal te rang gi don la thogs pa med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa zhes brjod pa de'i tshe skyes bu thams cad kyi shes pa rang gi don la thogs pa med pa'i phyir gang gi de nyid la shes pa thogs pa med pa zhes
translated: If it is said that it is unobstructed because it is unimpeded with regard to its object, then the consciousness of all beings would be unobstructed because it is unimpeded with regard to its object.

original: brjod kyi / gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa tshangs pa la sogs pa las te khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: brjod kyi / gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa tshangs pa la sogs pa las te khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between that and the consciousness of Brahma and so on?

original: 'di la gnas pa ni shes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa ni shes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThis is because it is based on this‚Äù and so on.

original: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i chos la sogs pa la tshangs pa'i shes pa de nyid thogs pa med par 'jug gi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di bshad pa'i don du 'di bstan te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i chos la sogs pa la tshangs pa'i shes pa de nyid thogs pa med par 'jug gi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di bshad pa'i don du 'di bstan te /
translated: This is taught to explain the difference that the consciousness of Brahma is unobstructed with regard to phenomena and so on that are required for the purpose of beings, but others are not.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa la rang gi don la thogs pa med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i shes pa zhes brjod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa la rang gi don la thogs pa med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i shes pa zhes brjod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said that the consciousness of Brahma and so on is unobstructed because it is unimpeded with regard to its object, but others are not.

original: ji snyed thabs las byung ba'i shes //
analyzed: ji snyed thabs las byung ba'i shes //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the means is the knowledge of all things.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i chos la sogs pa'i thabs las byung ba'i shes pa thabs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i chos la sogs pa'i thabs las byung ba'i shes pa thabs las byung ba'o //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the means is the knowledge that arises from the means of Dharma, etc. , which are necessary for the goal of man.

original: ji snyed ces bya ba ni ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: ji snyed ces bya ba ni ma lus pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of all things is the knowledge of all things without exception.

original: 'di yang thabs las byung ba'i shes pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang thabs las byung ba'i shes pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: This is also a particular kind of knowledge that arises from the means.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan 'chad pa yin no //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù introduces another interpretation.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu la'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù refers to the person.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni bdag gi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni bdag gi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the knowledge whose object is the self.

original: 'on te dbang phyug gi yon tan ye shes la sogs pa mi zad pa bcu 'don pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug gi yon tan ye shes la sogs pa mi zad pa bcu 'don pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the ten imperishable things, knowledge, etc., the qualities of God?

original: de ji ltar 'di mi zad pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'di mi zad pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be that he is not omniscient because he possesses imperishable knowledge?

original: gang yang ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúKnowledge is not omniscience, etc. ‚Äù

original: ye shes @271b ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes @271b ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the understanding of reality.

original: chags bral ni yul la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral ni yul la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: Detachment is the turning away from objects.

original: dbang phyug ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Sovereignty is of eight kinds:

original: phra ba dang / yang ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / bdag por gyur ba dang / dbang du gyur ba dang / dga' mgur gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba dang / yang ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / bdag por gyur ba dang / dbang du gyur ba dang / dga' mgur gnas pa'o //
translated: subtlety, lightness, worship, going everywhere, being endowed with what one desires, being a master, being powerful, and living as one wishes.

original: ye shes la sogs pa bcu po 'di dag mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes la sogs pa bcu po 'di dag mi zad pa ste /
translated: These ten, beginning with knowledge, are inexhaustible.

original: mi 'jig pa gang la yod pa de ni mi zad pa bcu can no //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa gang la yod pa de ni mi zad pa bcu can no //
translated: He who has them is one who has the ten inexhaustibles.

original: de la phra ba ni rdul phra rab tu gyur nas 'byung po thams cad kyis mi mthong ba na 'jig rten thams cad du spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la phra ba ni rdul phra rab tu gyur nas 'byung po thams cad kyis mi mthong ba na 'jig rten thams cad du spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, subtlety is when one becomes an atom and is not seen by any creature, yet one acts in all worlds.

original: yang ba ni yang ba'i phyir rlung bzhin du spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang ba ni yang ba'i phyir rlung bzhin du spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Lightness is when one acts like the wind because of being light.

original: mchod par bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad du mchod cing phyag 'tshal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad du mchod cing phyag 'tshal zhes brjod do //
translated: Worship is when one is worshipped and revered in all worlds.üîΩBeing a master is when one is a master of all things.

original: chen po pas kyang ches chen por gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chen po pas kyang ches chen por gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Being powerful is when one is powerful over all things.

original: gang yang phyin pa ste gang du yid kyis bsams pa de dang der phyin pa'o //üîΩ'dod dgur ldan pa ni 'dod pa mang por gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang phyin pa ste gang du yid kyis bsams pa de dang der phyin pa'o // 'dod dgur ldan pa ni 'dod pa mang por gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: He goes anywhere, to wherever he mentally considers.

original: yul longs spyod par nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul longs spyod par nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He has the power to do what he wants, which means that he has the power to enjoy objects.

original: bdag por gyur ba ni 'jig rten gsum gyi mnga' bdag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag por gyur ba ni 'jig rten gsum gyi mnga' bdag gang yin pa'o //
translated: He is the lord of the three worlds.

original: dbang du gyur ba ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'byung po dbang du byed pa dang / dbang po dbang du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du gyur ba ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'byung po dbang du byed pa dang / dbang po dbang du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He has power over the moving and unmoving, and he has power over the senses.

original: dga' mgur gnas pa ni tshangs pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang / lha dang / dri za dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / sha za rnams dang / mi rnams dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa rnams dang / gnas gzhan rnams su gang dang gang du dga' ba de dang der gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' mgur gnas pa ni tshangs pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang / lha dang / dri za dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / sha za rnams dang / mi rnams dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa rnams dang / gnas gzhan rnams su gang dang gang du dga' ba de dang der gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He lives wherever he wants, among Brahmas, among the lords of beings, among gods, gandharvas, yakshas, rakshasas, pisachas, humans, animals, and in other realms.

original: bdag bsam pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rig pa ste /
analyzed: bdag bsam pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rig pa ste /
translated: He has the power of thought, which means he has the power of knowledge.

original: shes pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: but not that he knows all things.

original: dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes pa dang ldan pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he knows all things.

original: yang ci'i phyir phyogs gcig tu shes na yang bde byed de nyid shes pa dang ldan par brjod kyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phyogs gcig tu shes na yang bde byed de nyid shes pa dang ldan par brjod kyi /
translated: Again, why is it that when one knows one part, one is said to know that very thing,

original: gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not the other?

original: bdag nyid rnam par dag mthong ba //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam par dag mthong ba //
translated: Seeing the purity of the self,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid yin la dag pa yang yin pas de skad ces bya la /üîΩde'i mthong ba @272a * //üîΩzhes bsdu'o // de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni de'i ste bdag rnam par dag pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid yin la dag pa yang yin pas de skad ces bya la / de'i mthong ba @272a * // zhes bsdu'o // de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni de'i ste bdag rnam par dag pa mthong ba'o //
translated: This is the self and it is pure, hence it is so called.üîΩThe seeing of that is the seeing of the self as pure.

original: rgyu mtshan ni de'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni de'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The reason for that is the reason for that, i.e., the seeing of the self as pure.

original: de yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is that reason?

original: de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is of the nature of that.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdag de ma dag na de'i mtshan nyid mthong ba de ma dag par 'jug pa de ni mi shes pa zhes brjod de smad par bya ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdag de ma dag na de'i mtshan nyid mthong ba de ma dag par 'jug pa de ni mi shes pa zhes brjod de smad par bya ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The reason for that is that if the self is impure, then seeing its characteristics is impure. That is called ignorance, because it is to be disparaged.

original: gal te bsam gtan goms pa las tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i shes pa srid pa khas len pa de'i tshe gang gis de dag kyang thogs pa med pa dang dag pa'i shes pa 'dod pas sangs rgyas la sogs pa la ci zhig ste zhes
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan goms pa las tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i shes pa srid pa khas len pa de'i tshe gang gis de dag kyang thogs pa med pa dang dag pa'i shes pa 'dod pas sangs rgyas la sogs pa la ci zhig ste zhes
translated: If you accept that it is possible for the knowledge of Brahma and so on to be pure through cultivating meditative stabilization, then why do you not accept that the knowledge of the Buddha and so on is unobstructed and pure?

original: dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Anticipating this qualm,

original: phyogs gzhan pa 'dod pa'i sgo nas tshangs pa la sogs pa khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan pa 'dod pa'i sgo nas tshangs pa la sogs pa khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: in order to teach that Brahma and so on are special from the perspective of asserting a different position, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the self is the cause of all things,‚Äù and so on.

original: rig byed kyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i phyir rig byed kyi lus can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i phyir rig byed kyi lus can zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the nature of the Vedas, it is called the body of the Vedas.

original: dngos po thams cad shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rig byed ni kun shes pa kun gyi rang bzhin yin no /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir rig byed ni kun shes pa kun gyi rang bzhin yin no /
translated: Because it is the cause of knowing all things, the Vedas are the nature of all knowledge.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa rang dbang gi chos la sogs pa la shes pa thogs pa med par 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa rang dbang gi chos la sogs pa la shes pa thogs pa med par 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Brahma and so on do not engage in the knowledge of independent phenomena and so on without obstruction.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what?

original: rig byed kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rig byed kyi sgo nas so //
translated: They do so through the Vedas.

original: de ltar khyed cag gis sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar khyed cag gis sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In that case, you do not assert that the Vedas are the object of knowledge of the Buddha and so on,

original: de dag gi shes pa ni rang byung yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa ni rang byung yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their knowledge is self originated.

original: gzhan yang tshangs pa la sogs pa ni bsam gtan goms pa las shes pa rnam par dag par rig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs pa la sogs pa ni bsam gtan goms pa las shes pa rnam par dag par rig pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, Brahma and so on are known to have pure knowledge through cultivating meditative stabilization,

original: de dag ni lha nyid yin pas skye bo thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir dang rig byed kyis mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lha nyid yin pas skye bo thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir dang rig byed kyis mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are gods and they are superior to all beings and they are not refuted by the Vedas.

original: mi rnams la ni nam yang 'di 'dra ba'i nus pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rnams la ni nam yang 'di 'dra ba'i nus pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Such a capacity is never possible for humans,

original: de ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the opposite of that.

original: de lta bas na mi rnams kyang thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi rnams kyang thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is foolish to say that humans are omniscient.

original: 'di ni rmongs pa'i lta ba can khyed cag gi yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rmongs pa'i lta ba can khyed cag gi yin no //
translated: This is the view of the foolish, and it is yours.

original: 'di snyam du gal te changs pa la sogs pa'i rig byed du 'dod na de'i tshe ji ltar mi rtag pa'i brjod par bya ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir rig byed kyang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te changs pa la sogs pa'i rig byed du 'dod na de'i tshe ji ltar mi rtag pa'i brjod par bya ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir rig byed kyang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If you assert that the Vedas are eternal, then how is it that the Vedas are not also impermanent because they are related to impermanent expressions?

original: yang rig byed @272b rnams rtag pa nyid du 'dod na tshangs pa la sogs pa rig byed rtag pa brjod par bya ba 'gal te de dag ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rig byed @272b rnams rtag pa nyid du 'dod na tshangs pa la sogs pa rig byed rtag pa brjod par bya ba 'gal te de dag ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you assert that the Vedas are eternal, then it is contradictory to say that BrahmƒÅ and so on are the authors of the eternal Vedas because they are impermanent.üîΩIf you think that this is not contradictory, then it is not contradictory that Buddhists and so on are the authors of the Vedas.

original: ci ste 'di mi 'gal na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa de'i brjod bya nyid du mi 'gal lo snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ci ste 'di mi 'gal na de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa de'i brjod bya nyid du mi 'gal lo snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: To anticipate this, he says,

original: rig byed lung ni rtag par yang //
analyzed: rig byed lung ni rtag par yang //
translated: The Vedas are also eternal.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: de rtag nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa de dag ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtag nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa de dag ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are permanent‚Äù means that Brahma, etc. are permanent.

original: de dag rtag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag rtag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This is clarified by ‚ÄúTheir permanence, etc.‚Äù

original: rtag pa ni lung gis rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni lung gis rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Permanence is not to be understood from scripture,

original: sgra dang don gyi 'brel ba mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i lung yang gzhan gyis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang don gyi 'brel ba mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i lung yang gzhan gyis khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the relationship between the word and its meaning would be impermanent, and because no one accepts a scripture that is permanent.

original: khas len na yang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len na yang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one did accept it, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be pointless to understand an omniscient being.

original: 'di nyad ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyad ston pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa shes byed pas //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa shes byed pas //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the omniscient one is known‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa shes par byed pa las rtag pa'i lung gi don rtogs pa mchog nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa shes par byed pa las rtag pa'i lung gi don rtogs pa mchog nyid du 'dod do //
translated: means that the meaning of the scripture of permanence is understood to be supreme by the omniscient one.

original: ji ltar de mchog yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de mchog yin zhe na /
translated: How is it supreme?

original: rig byed kyis rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rig byed kyis rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said ‚Äúbecause it is understood through the Vedas,‚Äù etc.

original: rig byed la brten pas chos shes pa 'byung ba na ma bsgribs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig byed la brten pas chos shes pa 'byung ba na ma bsgribs par 'gyur te /
translated: When the knowledge of dharmas arises in dependence on the Vedas, it is not obscured,

original: 'jig rten gnas kyi bar du khyad par med pa thams cad la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas kyi bar du khyad par med pa thams cad la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible for all who are not obstructed to exist in the world.

original: rig byed kyis rtogs pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pas rtogs par bya ba'i chos ni bsgribs pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyis rtogs pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pas rtogs par bya ba'i chos ni bsgribs pa yin te /
translated: All dharmas that are realized by the Vedas are obscured dharmas, because they are realized by the omniscience of the Vedas.

original: de'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni de mi gsal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni de mi gsal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Their nirvana is not clear.

original: / mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i gnas skabs na yang ma nges pas nye bar bstan pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: / mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i gnas skabs na yang ma nges pas nye bar bstan pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Even when they are not in the state of nirvana, they are not ascertained, so they are not taught.

original: nye bar ston pa na yang thams cad la thams cad kyi tshe thams cad kyis thos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar ston pa na yang thams cad la thams cad kyi tshe thams cad kyis thos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when they are taught, they are not heard by all at all times.

original: nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad mas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad mas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The omniscience of the Vedas is not realized by the valid knowledge of inference.

original: gal te kun mkhyen dang 'dra 'ga' //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te kun mkhyen dang 'dra 'ga' //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If someone were equal to the Omniscient One,üîΩthen he would see the Omniscient One.

original: nye bar 'jal ba ni 'dra ba dang de'i khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i dngos po 'byung ba med na mi 'byung zhing mi nya ba'i don gyi spyod yul can @273a * //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba ni 'dra ba dang de'i khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i dngos po 'byung ba med na mi 'byung zhing mi nya ba'i don gyi spyod yul can @273a * //
translated: The means of knowing by analogy has as its object a similar thing and its distinction. Therefore, if a similar thing does not exist, the means of knowing by analogy does not occur. It has as its domain the meaning of a similar thing,

original: yin te / dper na ba men 'dzin pa'i sgo nas ba lang dran pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yin te / dper na ba men 'dzin pa'i sgo nas ba lang dran pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, like remembering a cow through the apprehension of a gayal.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dra ba 'ga' zhig rtogs pa srid pa yang ma yin pas des na 'dra ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mi 'jug go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dra ba 'ga' zhig rtogs pa srid pa yang ma yin pas des na 'dra ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mi 'jug go //
translated: And it is not possible to understand anything similar to an omniscient being. Therefore, because there is no apprehension of a similar thing, the means of knowing by analogy does not occur.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la 'dra ba 'dzin pa med pa de ni nye bar 'jal bas go bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la 'dra ba 'dzin pa med pa de ni nye bar 'jal bas go bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not have the apprehension of a similar thing is not to be understood through the means of knowing by analogy,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'dra ba 'dzin pa med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'dra ba 'dzin pa med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the apprehension of a similar thing to an omniscient being is the nonapprehension of the pervader.

original: gzhan yang nye bar 'jal ba las thams cad mkhyen pa go bar mi byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar 'jal ba las thams cad mkhyen pa go bar mi byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
translated: Moreover, not only does the means of knowing by analogy not cause the understanding of an omniscient being,üîΩbut also

original: 'on kyang slar la skyes bu thams cad nye bar 'jal ba las thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa kho nar rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang slar la skyes bu thams cad nye bar 'jal ba las thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa kho nar rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
translated: But it is shown that it is only right that all men are not omniscient, since they are born again.

original: de ltar yod pa'i mi rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa'i mi rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúMen who exist in this way . . . ‚ÄùüîΩIt is not established that omniscience is proven by implication.üîΩThis is what is intended.

original: don gyis go bas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan par 'dod nas re zhig gzhan gyi 'dod par byed pa ni /üîΩchos dang chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don gyis go bas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan par 'dod nas re zhig gzhan gyi 'dod par byed pa ni / chos dang chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The assertion of the opponent is first presented:üîΩ‚ÄúIf one does not directly perceive virtue and so on, then the teaching of the Buddha and so on would not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te chos la sogs pa des dngos su rig par ma gyur na sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa nye bar ston pa gang yin pa de bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos la sogs pa des dngos su rig par ma gyur na sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa nye bar ston pa gang yin pa de bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not directly perceive virtue and so on, then the teaching of the Buddha and so on would not exist.

original: de lta bas na gal te yang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa med pa de lta na yang don gyis go ba ni thams cad rig pa'i skyes bu grub po zhes de ltar ston par byed pa gang yin pa de mi
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te yang thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa med pa de lta na yang don gyis go ba ni thams cad rig pa'i skyes bu grub po zhes de ltar ston par byed pa gang yin pa de mi
translated: Therefore, even though direct perception and so on that realize omniscience do not exist, still, the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe person who knows all things is established‚Äù is

original: rigs par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs par bstan par bya ste /
translated: taught to be illogical.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa las so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa las so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is taught by the reasoning that will be explained.

original: yang na 'di ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin gyi don gyis go ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin gyi don gyis go ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Or else, this is inference alone, it is not the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe person who knows all things is established.‚Äù

original: tshul gsum srid pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshul gsum srid pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: This is because the three modes are possible.

original: yang na 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúOr else, in this regard‚Äù and so on teaches this.

original: spyir ma mthong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bye brag tu mthong ba mi srid par bstan to ;
analyzed: spyir ma mthong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bye brag tu mthong ba mi srid par bstan to ;
translated: In general, the statement ‚Äúnot seen‚Äù teaches that in particular, seeing is impossible.

original: / rtags dang rtags can gang kho na mngon sum gyis 'brel ba mthong ba'i rtags can de kho na rtags can de nyid kyis dus gzhan du the tshom gcad par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de'i tshe khyad par du mthong ba'i rjes su
analyzed: / rtags dang rtags can gang kho na mngon sum gyis 'brel ba mthong ba'i rtags can de kho na rtags can de nyid kyis dus gzhan du the tshom gcad par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de'i tshe khyad par du mthong ba'i rjes su
translated: That which is the sign and the possession of the sign, which is seen to be related by perception, is the possession of the sign.

original: dpag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When that very possession of the sign is inferred at another time in order to eliminate doubt, then that is called inference of what is seen in particular.

original: thams cad @273b mkhyen pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa nye bar ston pa 'gas kyang 'brel ba ma bzung ba des na 'dir ni spyir mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad @273b mkhyen pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa nye bar ston pa 'gas kyang 'brel ba ma bzung ba des na 'dir ni spyir mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: Even though some teachers, such as the omniscient one, teach that there is no relation between the sign and the possession of the sign, still, in this case, it is only seen in general.

original: 'di ltar spyir nye bar bstan pa ni gzhan du ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyir nye bar bstan pa ni gzhan du ste /
translated: Thus, the teaching in general is elsewhere.

original: rang gi rgyud la shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ste /
translated: It is seen that knowledge precedes one's own continuum.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar lha sbyin sngon du 'gro ba can yul gzhan du phyin par dmigs pa las nyi ma yul gzhan du phyin pas 'gro ba rjes su dpag par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar lha sbyin sngon du 'gro ba can yul gzhan du phyin par dmigs pa las nyi ma yul gzhan du phyin pas 'gro ba rjes su dpag par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as Devadatta's going to another place is inferred from the observation of his going to another place, in the same way,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang chos la sogs pa nye bar ston pa las de'i shes pa rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang chos la sogs pa nye bar ston pa las de'i shes pa rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha Bhagavat is also inferred from the teaching of the Dharma, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la la nye bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni smra ba po'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la la nye bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni smra ba po'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is taught is preceded by the knowledge of the speaker,

original: dper na aa ru ra la sogs pa'i nus pa nye bar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na aa ru ra la sogs pa'i nus pa nye bar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: like the teaching of the potency of myrobalan, etc.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa 'di yang nye bar ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa 'di yang nye bar ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma, etc. by the Buddha, etc. is a teaching. This is a natural inference.

original: 'dir lan smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir lan smra ba ni /
translated: Here is the reply:

original: gzhan du yang ni srid pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ni srid pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is possible in other cases as well,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: gzhan du yang ste rmongs pas nye bar bstan pa yang srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang don gyis go ba gnyi ga yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ste rmongs pas nye bar bstan pa yang srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang don gyis go ba gnyi ga yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is possible in other cases, i.e., because it is possible that it is taught through delusion, both the inference and the presumption are inconclusive.

original: ji ltar gzhan du yang srid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du yang srid ce na /
translated: How is it possible in other cases?

original: rmi lam la sogs mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuch as dreams‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: ji skad du ri khrod pa'i bshad pa las /üîΩnye bar bstan pa ni rmongs pa las kyang 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji skad du ri khrod pa'i bshad pa las / nye bar bstan pa ni rmongs pa las kyang 'gyur la /
translated: As it is said in the Explanation of the Forest-dweller:üîΩ‚ÄúInstruction‚Äù can come from the ignorant,

original: rmongs pa med pa ni rig byed las kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa ni rig byed las kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: and it can come from the learned.

original: de la rmongs pa las 'gyur ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de la rmongs pa las 'gyur ba mthong ste /
translated: Here, we see that it can come from the ignorant.

original: dper na rmi lam du dmigs pa'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam du dmigs pa'i don bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the object perceived in a dream.

original: rig byed las mthong ba ni dper na shed la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rig byed las mthong ba ni dper na shed la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: We see that it can come from the learned. For example, it is like the Vedas.

original: gang dag bde bar gshegs par rig byed mngon par mi shes pa de dag ni rmongs pa las sam /
analyzed: gang dag bde bar gshegs par rig byed mngon par mi shes pa de dag ni rmongs pa las sam /
translated: Those who do not understand the Vedas of the Sugata should be instructed by the ignorant,

original: gzhan bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar ston pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar ston pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: or else they should be protected from others.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gang dag rig byed mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gang dag rig byed mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The same point is taught in the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúThose who do not understand the Vedas‚Äù and so on.

original: de la mi brten zhes bya ba ni rig byed la mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi brten zhes bya ba ni rig byed la mi brten pa'o //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúdo not rely on them‚Äù means do not rely on the Vedas.

original: nye bar bstan pa 'di rig byed la mi rton no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /üîΩgal te rig byed ces bya ba la @274a * //üîΩsogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos la sogs pa bstan pa rig byed kyi rtsa ba can du gyur na de'i tshe shed la sogs pa bzhin du rig byed shes pa'i bram ze rnams kho na las ston par 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩ'di dag ni bram ze rnams kho na la nye bar bstan pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang dmangs rigs rmongs pa rnams la yin no //üîΩde'i phyir nye bar bstan pa kun rdzob pa lhar brdzun yin par go ste /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa 'di rig byed la mi rton no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na / gal te rig byed ces bya ba la @274a * // sogs pa smos te / gal te sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos la sogs pa bstan pa rig byed kyi rtsa ba can du gyur na de'i tshe shed la sogs pa bzhin du rig byed shes pa'i bram ze rnams kho na las ston par 'gyur ba zhig na / 'di dag ni bram ze rnams kho na la nye bar bstan pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang dmangs rigs rmongs pa rnams la yin no // de'i phyir nye bar bstan pa kun rdzob pa lhar brdzun yin par go ste /
translated: How do you understand this statement, ‚ÄúDo not rely on the Vedas‚Äù?üîΩIf the Vedas are the root of the Dharma, etc.,

original: dper na slu ba'i tshig la sogs pa dang / dong rtse se na la sogs pa'i las bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na slu ba'i tshig la sogs pa dang / dong rtse se na la sogs pa'i las bzhin no //

original: gang yang shed la sogs pa de dag ni rig byed shes pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa rig byed kyi rtsa ba can kho na yin gyi rang dbang can ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gang dag gtso bos zhes bya ba la
analyzed: gang yang shed la sogs pa de dag ni rig byed shes pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa rig byed kyi rtsa ba can kho na yin gyi rang dbang can ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gang dag gtso bos zhes bya ba la
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that the Vedas are the basis for the teachings of dharma and so on, because they are known by the wise, and they are not independent.

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúthe Vedas were spoken by BrahmƒÅ‚Äù and so on

original: nges brjod dang / mchod sbyin dang snyan ngag ces bya ba gsum ni rig byed gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: nges brjod dang / mchod sbyin dang snyan ngag ces bya ba gsum ni rig byed gsum du brjod do //
translated: indicate that the three Vedas are called ·πög Veda, Yajur Veda, and SƒÅma Veda.

original: de dag rig pas na gsum rig pa ste bram ze rnams la brjod do //
analyzed: de dag rig pas na gsum rig pa ste bram ze rnams la brjod do //
translated: Those who know the three are called trivarga, which is a term for brahmins.üîΩThe teachings of the trivarga are the treatises and so on that are their scriptures.

original: gsum rig pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos bstan bcos la sogs pa gzhung gang dag la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gsum rig pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos bstan bcos la sogs pa gzhung gang dag la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey were spoken by the power of the Vedas‚Äù

original: de'i gzhung la brten pa la rgyu bstan pa ni /üîΩrig byed stobs kyis smras pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhung la brten pa la rgyu bstan pa ni / rig byed stobs kyis smras pa yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: indicates the cause of their scriptures.üîΩThe words ‚Äúspoken by the power of the Vedas‚Äù

original: rig byed kyi stobs kyis smras pa gang dag la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi stobs kyis smras pa gang dag la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: indicate that they were spoken by the power of the Vedas.

original: 'di yang ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar nges she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: rig byed tshig rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rig byed tshig rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words of the Vedas are not the means of valid cognition.

original: ston pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTeaching‚Äù means ‚Äúrealizing.‚Äù

original: de ltar tshad ma rnam pa lngas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma rnam pa lngas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because omniscience is not established by the five types of valid cognition,

original: lhag mar gyur bas dngos po med pa nyid kyis go bar bya ba yin pas dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag mar gyur bas dngos po med pa nyid kyis go bar bya ba yin pas dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: the remaining one is understood by the absence of entityness, because the entityness that is the object of the valid knowledge of the absence of entityness does not exist. Thus this reason is established.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin te med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin te med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is also not indeterminate, as was previously explained, because there is no other reason for the convention of nonexistence.

original: gang yang kho bo cag gis rva nas bzung nas thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrubs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang kho bo cag gis rva nas bzung nas thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrubs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept that omniscience is established by grasping the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we accept?

original: spyir srid pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spyir srid pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: We accept that omniscience is established by the mere possibility of existence in general.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'ga' zhig yod @274b pa'am 'ga' zhig tu thams cad mkhyen pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'ga' zhig yod @274b pa'am 'ga' zhig tu thams cad mkhyen pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Does omniscience exist in some person or does some person exist who is omniscient?üîΩBecause we see that wisdom and so on have reached the highest degree.

original: shes rab la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: In response to this, the root text states:üîΩThe existence of a person who is omniscient

original: skyes bu kun mkhyen 'ga' zhig yod //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu kun mkhyen 'ga' zhig yod // ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
translated: is not established by any means of valid knowledge.üîΩThe reason is stated in the first line. The second line shows that the thesis is not established. The third line shows that the example is not established. The fourth line shows that the reason is not established.üîΩThe reason is stated in the first line. The second line shows that the thesis is not established. The third line shows that the example is not established. The fourth line shows that the reason is not established.

original: re zhig gtan tshigs ni sngar ma nges pa nyid du bstan zin pas des na phyogs kyi skyon nyid ston par byed do //üîΩgal te gzhan bsgrub par 'dod pa na gzhan dam 'cha' bar byed pa ni dam bca' ba ma tshang ba'i phyogs kyi skyon yin la /üîΩ'dir yang rang gi ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub par bya bar 'dod kyi spyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gtan tshigs ni sngar ma nges pa nyid du bstan zin pas des na phyogs kyi skyon nyid ston par byed do // gal te gzhan bsgrub par 'dod pa na gzhan dam 'cha' bar byed pa ni dam bca' ba ma tshang ba'i phyogs kyi skyon yin la / 'dir yang rang gi ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub par bya bar 'dod kyi spyir ni ma yin no //

The second line shows that the thesis is not established. The third line shows that the example is not established. The fourth line shows that the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa tshol ba zhen pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa tshol ba zhen pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason is stated in the first line. The second line shows that the thesis is not established. The third line shows that the example is not established. The fourth line shows that the reason is not established.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The reason is stated in the first line. The second line shows that the thesis

original: de'i tshe gang las chos dang chos ma yin pa dag shes nas 'jug par bya ba'am ldog par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang las chos dang chos ma yin pa dag shes nas 'jug par bya ba'am ldog par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i 'dod pa yin no //
translated: At that time, there is a desire to engage or to disengage, having understood what is Dharma and what is not Dharma from which?

original: spyir grub na yang des skyes bu'i 'jug pa la nye bar mkho ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyir grub na yang des skyes bu'i 'jug pa la nye bar mkho ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were established in general, it would not be of any use for a person‚Äôs engagement,

original: khyad par yongs su shes pa med par de'i tshig tu ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par yongs su shes pa med par de'i tshig tu ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without understanding the distinction, it is not ascertained as its word.

original: de lta bas na 'jug par 'dod pas khyad par de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jug par 'dod pas khyad par de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the one who desires engagement must establish that distinction,

original: spyir dam bca' ba ni dam bca' ba ma tshang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyir dam bca' ba ni dam bca' ba ma tshang ba nyid yin no //
translated: the general thesis is incomplete.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i 'dod pa'i don zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning that is desired to be established is the meaning that is desired to be established.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par rang gi ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par rang gi ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the distinction, which is taught by oneself.

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú By this‚Äù refers to the thesis.

original: gang brjod pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par la ma reg par skyes bu thams cad mkhyen pa 'ga' zhig yod pa'am la lar thams cad mkhyen pa yod do zhes grub pa das kyang dogs pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang brjod pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par la ma reg par skyes bu thams cad mkhyen pa 'ga' zhig yod pa'am la lar thams cad mkhyen pa yod do zhes grub pa das kyang dogs pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: As for what is said, without touching on the distinction, there is not the slightest doubt that someone is omniscient or that someone is omniscient somewhere.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gis lung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis lung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says by whom the scriptures are established as true, and so on.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gang gis lung bden pa nyid du grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gang gis lung bden pa nyid du grub pa'o //
translated: As for that, it is by whom the scriptures are established as true.

original: ci'i phyir mi rnyed ce na ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rnyed ce na ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why is it not found? He says as long as, and so on.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen par ma grub pa de srid du de'i tshig kyang bden par nges pa yod pa ma yin la /üîΩspyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub pa na sangs rgyas kyi tshig bden par grub par 'gyur ba yang @275a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen par ma grub pa de srid du de'i tshig kyang bden par nges pa yod pa ma yin la / spyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub pa na sangs rgyas kyi tshig bden par grub par 'gyur ba yang @275a * //
translated: Thus, as long as all buddhas are not established as omniscient, their words are not ascertained as true.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: And in general, when omniscience is established, the words of the Buddha are not established as true.

original: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection.

original: 'di ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ston pa ni /
translated: This is shown by

original: gzhan du kun mkhyen yod pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan du kun mkhyen yod pa ni //
translated: Otherwise, omniscience would exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gang gi tshe de dag 'brel bar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde dag gzhi mthun yod pa na //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag 'brel bar 'gyur zhe na / de dag gzhi mthun yod pa na //
translated: When do they become related?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhen there is a common locus,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhi mthun pa ni skyes bu gcig la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa ni skyes bu gcig la brten pa nyid do //
translated: A common locus is the basis of dependence of a single person.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang tshig dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang tshig dag go //
translated: ‚Äú They‚Äù refers to omniscience and the words.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu dag go //
translated: The relation of part to whole is that of cause and effect.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /üîΩgcig la brten pa nyid yin na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig bden pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin to //
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te / gcig la brten pa nyid yin na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig bden pa'i rgyur 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin to //
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are the basis of dependence of a single person, the words of the omniscient one become the cause of truth, but not otherwise, because that would be absurd.

original: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa bkod pa de yang 'di nyid kyis gsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa bkod pa de yang 'di nyid kyis gsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that the proof that others set forth in order to prove omniscience is also clarified by this, he says,

original: gang zhig 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is called ‚Äòthe world‚Äô . . .‚Äù

original: gang gzhal bya nyid dang dngos po nyid dang ldan pa de ni 'ga' zhig gi mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gzhal bya nyid dang dngos po nyid dang ldan pa de ni 'ga' zhig gi mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: That which possesses the nature of being an object of knowledge and the nature of being a thing is not the direct perception of anyone.

original: dper na zho'i gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zho'i gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the form, taste, etc., of curd.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo thams cad kyang gzhal bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo thams cad kyang gzhal bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of being an object of knowledge, etc. This is an argument from the nature of things.

original: 'di la snga ma bzhin du dam bca' ba ma tshang ba nyid dang gtan tshigs kyang ma nges pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la snga ma bzhin du dam bca' ba ma tshang ba nyid dang gtan tshigs kyang ma nges pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: As before, it should be said that the thesis is incomplete and the reason is indeterminate.

original: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa ni khyad par gyi sgo nas srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa ni khyad par gyi sgo nas srid pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, omniscience is not possible in terms of a specific instance.

original: spyi'i sgo nas kyang ma yin pas des na de med do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: spyi'i sgo nas kyang ma yin pas des na de med do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Nor is it possible in terms of a general instance. Therefore, it is established that it does not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir de'i tshig kyang med pas de'i tshig las su yang 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de'i tshig kyang med pas de'i tshig las su yang 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not exist, its words do not exist. Therefore, it is not possible for anyone to engage with its words.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na skyes bu thams cad mkhyen pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang gang las khyed cag 'jug par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pas byas pa'i tshig mi srid pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na skyes bu thams cad mkhyen pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang gang las khyed cag 'jug par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pas byas pa'i tshig mi srid pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In one sense, it is acceptable that all beings are omniscient. However, it is impossible for the words of an omniscient being to be the source of your entry into the path.üîΩTo demonstrate this, the text says:

original: sa bcu dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa bcu dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Those who abide on the ten grounds,üîΩwho are free from all stains of attachment and so on,üîΩwho are endowed with wisdom that is like a pure crystal,üîΩwho have realized all objects of knowledge,üîΩare not able to teach the meaningüîΩto those who are not of the same kind.

original: 'di ltar sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma'i rtogs pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir shel dag pa dang mtshungs pa'i ye shes kyis shes bya mtha' dag rtogs @275b so zhes bya ba de ltar khyed cag gis brjod parüîΩgrags te / de lta yin dang gnas skabs 'di 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma'i rtogs pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir shel dag pa dang mtshungs pa'i ye shes kyis shes bya mtha' dag rtogs @275b so zhes bya ba de ltar khyed cag gis brjod par grags te / de lta yin dang gnas skabs 'di 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Those who abide on the ten grounds, who are free from all stains of attachment and so on, who are endowed with wisdom that is like a pure crystal, who have realized all objects of knowledge‚Äîit is well known that you describe them in this way.

original: sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa 'di don rtogs pa kho na la ston pa'i phyir chos nye bar ston par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa 'di don rtogs pa kho na la ston pa'i phyir chos nye bar ston par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If this is so, then those who abide in this state, who are endowed with one-pointed concentration, are not able to teach the meaning that they have realized to those who are not of the same kind.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gis bya ba 'di tsam zhig byed par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gis bya ba 'di tsam zhig byed par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not possible for anyone to perform just this much action.

original: gal te bsam gtan las langs nas ston pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan las langs nas ston pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that he teaches after rising from meditative concentration,

original: gang gi tshe spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then it is said that when there is no conceptualization, etc.

original: rtog pa rig pa med par tshig 'jug pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs na 'di'i chos ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa rig pa med par tshig 'jug pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs na 'di'i chos ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because words do not function without conceptualization, he does not teach the Dharma when in a state of mind with conceptualization.

original: de lta yin dang gnas skabs 'dir byis pa dang mkhas pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa des bshang ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas bshad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gnas skabs 'dir byis pa dang mkhas pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa des bshang ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas bshad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then because there would be no difference between the childish and the wise in this state, everything explained by him would be explained by one who is not omniscient, because he is not omniscient.

original: 'di snyam du rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir 'di cung zad nye bar ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir 'di cung zad nye bar ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is thought that he does not teach anything at all because he is abiding in a concentration without conceptualization,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is the use of this?

original: de'i dbang gis chos ston pa sna tshogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig par rig pa skal ba dang ldan pa rnams las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis chos ston pa sna tshogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig par rig pa skal ba dang ldan pa rnams las byung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the various teachings of the Dharma appear through the power of the consciousnesses of those who are fortunate.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: On the night the Tathagata fully awakened,

original: gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs shing ma bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs shing ma bstan to //
translated: and on the night he will pass into parinirvana, in between he did not speak or teach a single syllable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Because the Tathagata is always in equipoise.üîΩHowever, those who are to be tamed by syllables, expressions and teachings hear the sound of Dharma coming from the mouth, the crown protrusion and the urna of the Tathagata.

original: 'on kyang yi ge dang brjod pa dang bstan pa rnams kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag gis gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal dang / dbu'i gtsug tor dang mdzod sbu las chos kyi sgra 'byung ba thos pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on kyang yi ge dang brjod pa dang bstan pa rnams kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag gis gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal dang / dbu'i gtsug tor dang mdzod sbu las chos kyi sgra 'byung ba thos pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think this,

original: de la / de yi bsam gtan la bzhugs te //
analyzed: de la / de yi bsam gtan la bzhugs te //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúHe abides in his meditative stabilization,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so forth.

original: yid bzhin rin chen ni yid bzhin nor bu'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin rin chen ni yid bzhin nor bu'o //
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel is a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the condensed meaning:

original: gang dag dad pa dang ldan pa de dag la tshad ma med pa 'di brjod pa ni mdzes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang dag dad pa dang ldan pa de dag la tshad ma med pa 'di brjod pa ni mdzes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is beautiful to speak of this to those who have faith.

original: gang yang kho bo cag @276a * //
analyzed: gang yang kho bo cag @276a * //
translated: But those like us

original: lta bus tshad mas 'thad pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid kyis rigs pa kho na don du gnyer ba de dag ni de dag ji ltar tshad ma med pa can 'di brjod pa ni 'dzin par 'gyur gzhan yang rtog pa de lta bu yin du chug mod /
analyzed: lta bus tshad mas 'thad pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid kyis rigs pa kho na don du gnyer ba de dag ni de dag ji ltar tshad ma med pa can 'di brjod pa ni 'dzin par 'gyur gzhan yang rtog pa de lta bu yin du chug mod /
translated: who are only interested in logic because we are concerned with the meaning of the valid cognitions that we ourselves accept, how could they accept this when it is said to be without valid cognition?üîΩMoreover, even if one were to allow that such a thought exists,

original: de lta na yang rtsig pa la sogs pa nas 'byung ba bstan pa dag la thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba nyid du the tshom za ba'i phyir de la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams tshad ma nyid du yid ches pa ma yin no zhes ston
analyzed: de lta na yang rtsig pa la sogs pa nas 'byung ba bstan pa dag la thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba nyid du the tshom za ba'i phyir de la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams tshad ma nyid du yid ches pa ma yin no zhes ston
translated: still, since one doubts that the statements that arise from walls and so on arise due to the power of the omniscient one, those who are skeptical do not believe that it is a valid cognition.

original: pa ni / rtsig pa sogs nas 'byung ba'i tshogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa ni / rtsig pa sogs nas 'byung ba'i tshogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The collection that arises from walls and so on.

original: thams cad go bar zad do //
analyzed: thams cad go bar zad do //
translated: Everything is understood.

original: 'di tsam gyi bar du ku m'a ra ri las smras pa phyogs snga mar byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyi bar du ku m'a ra ri las smras pa phyogs snga mar byas pa yin la /
translated: Up to this point, KumƒÅrila‚Äôs position is stated as the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: da ni la ba can dang mchod sbyin can dag gi lugs kyis slar thams cad mkhyen pa sun 'byin pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: da ni la ba can dang mchod sbyin can dag gi lugs kyis slar thams cad mkhyen pa sun 'byin pa smras pa ni /
translated: Now, the refutation of omniscience by the system of the LokƒÅyatas and the Jains is stated:

original: slar yang 'di ltar dpyad bya ste //
