analyzed: slar yang 'di ltar dpyad bya ste //
translated: Again, this should be analyzed:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is stated is this:

original: ci cig car ma lus pa rnam par shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci cig car ma lus pa rnam par shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam /
translated: Is it because all objects are simultaneously cognized that one is omniscient?

original: 'on te rim gyis te go rims su yin /
analyzed: 'on te rim gyis te go rims su yin /
translated: Or is it because they are cognized gradually, in sequence?üîΩOr is it because all transmigrating beings are known to have the nature of one thing, such as impermanence?

original: yang na 'gro ba thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa gcig gi ngo bor shes pa las yin nam rnam pa gcig tu ni gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa gcig gi ngo bor shes pa las yin nam rnam pa gcig tu ni gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: Or is it because one thing, such as the principal, is known in one aspect?

original: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de kho na shes pa las sam yang na dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na mes thams cad rim gyis dang cig car
analyzed: skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba'i las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de kho na shes pa las sam yang na dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na mes thams cad rim gyis dang cig car
translated: Because it is the means of knowing just that which is necessary for a person, such as karma and its effects, or because it possesses the ability to fully understand all things, like fire, which gradually or instantaneously burns all that is to be burned.

original: dag gis mi zan yang thams cad za zhes bya ba lta bur thams cad mkhyen par brjod grang /
analyzed: dag gis mi zan yang thams cad za zhes bya ba lta bur thams cad mkhyen par brjod grang /
translated: Because it knows only the objects of persons, such as karma and its effects, or because it has the ability to fully know all things, it is called omniscient, just as fire is said to consume all things even though it does not consume everything all at once.

original: de la phyogs dang po la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: The first position has two parts.

original: blo gcig gis cig car ma lus pa shes sam du mas yin /
analyzed: blo gcig gis cig car ma lus pa shes sam du mas yin /
translated: Does a single mind simultaneously know everything or does it do so in stages?

original: re zhig gcig gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gcig gis ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not know everything at once.

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don rnams cig car shes pa gcig gis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don rnams cig car shes pa gcig gis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a single consciousness does not simultaneously see mutually exclusive objects such as pure and impure things.

original: 'di snyam du de'i 'gal ba'i dngos po du ma'i yul can gyi blo mang po cig car 'jug pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de'i 'gal ba'i dngos po du ma'i yul can gyi blo mang po cig car 'jug pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that many minds that possess the objects of many mutually exclusive things arise simultaneously,

original: 'gar yang blo rnams tha dad kyang //
analyzed: 'gar yang blo rnams tha dad kyang //
translated: ‚ÄúNor do the cognitions ever differ.üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde dag ni ma mthong ngo zhes rnam par @276b dbya ba bsgyur la sbrel bar bya'o //üîΩblo tha dad pa rnams cig car mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de dag ni ma mthong ngo zhes rnam par @276b dbya ba bsgyur la sbrel bar bya'o // blo tha dad pa rnams cig car mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúnor‚Äù should be supplied.

original: sems can rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognitions do not differ, because the sentient beings have a single stream of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir blo du mas kyang cig car 'dzin pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo du mas kyang cig car 'dzin pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that many cognitions apprehend simultaneously.

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable that they apprehend successively,

original: byung ba dang 'byung ba dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir lo brgyas kyang shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung ba dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir lo brgyas kyang shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the things that have arisen, are arising, and will arise are infinite, and one cannot know them even in a hundred years.

original: lo brgya smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: lo brgya smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The mention of a hundred years is an illustration.

original: bskal bas kyang mi nus pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bskal bas kyang mi nus pa kho na ste /
translated: It is not possible even in a kalpa,

original: de lta ma yin na tha ma med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha ma med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, the doctrine of beginninglessness would be undermined.

original: gcig gi ngo bos kyang dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bos kyang dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to know all things by means of the nature of one thing.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that one would not apprehend its own characteristics.

original: gang zhig bzung bas de ngag 'dzin par 'gyur ba phan tshun tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams kyi ngo bo gcig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig bzung bas de ngag 'dzin par 'gyur ba phan tshun tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams kyi ngo bo gcig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no single nature of things that are mutually different, by apprehending which one would apprehend them all.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la rag las pa'i don bya ba bsgrub pa ni don gyi bya ba mi byed pa spyi'i rnam pa can de'i rtogs pa po ste shes pa po thams cad mkhyen pas rtogs pa cung zad kyang dgos pa med de rang gi mtshan nyid yongsüîΩsu mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la rag las pa'i don bya ba bsgrub pa ni don gyi bya ba mi byed pa spyi'i rnam pa can de'i rtogs pa po ste shes pa po thams cad mkhyen pas rtogs pa cung zad kyang dgos pa med de rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who accomplishes the purpose that depends on its own characteristics, the one who does not perform the function of the purpose, the one who has a general aspect, the one who knows all, the one who understands, the one who knows, the one who is omniscient, does not need to understand anything at all, because he does not fully understand its own characteristics.

original: des spyi'i sgo nas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid rnams shes par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: des spyi'i sgo nas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid rnams shes par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that he also knows its own characteristics by means of the general,

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚ÄúThe other aspect,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs kyi shes pas kyang ro 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang gcig gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i shes pa de bden pa'i don can yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi shes pas kyang ro 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang gcig gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i shes pa de bden pa'i don can yin nam /
translated: because it would follow that the consciousness of form would also apprehend taste.üîΩMoreover, is the consciousness that apprehends the entity of one thing

original: log pa'i don can yin grang /
analyzed: log pa'i don can yin grang /
translated: true or false?

original: de la bden pa'i don can yin na dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba thob po //
analyzed: de la bden pa'i don can yin na dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba thob po //
translated: If it is true, then the thesis is contradicted by perception.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa med par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Omniscience would not exist.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po thams cad kyi yul can gcig gi ngo bo'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang dag pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe shugs kyis dngos po thams cad gcig nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po thams cad kyi yul can gcig gi ngo bo'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang dag pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe shugs kyis dngos po thams cad gcig nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that the consciousness that has the aspect of the entity of one thing that has all things as its object is real, then it would follow that all things are one by implication.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so,

original: ji ltar gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa bden pa'i don can du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa bden pa'i don can du 'gyur /
translated: how could the consciousness that has the aspect of one thing have a true object?

original: gal te des @277a * //
analyzed: gal te des @277a * //
translated: If it were not so,

original: gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po rnams ngo bo gcig tu bden par ma gyur na ji ltar rnam pa gcig pa can gyi shes pa bden pa'i don can du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po rnams ngo bo gcig tu bden par ma gyur na ji ltar rnam pa gcig pa can gyi shes pa bden pa'i don can du 'gyur /
translated: If the things that are apprehended are not truly of one nature, how could a consciousness that has one aspect be truly existent?

original: 'di yang mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: This also contradicts what is seen,

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad par rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad par rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the natures of things are to be known as different due to the differences of place, time, and nature.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba thams cad gnyis su med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba thams cad gnyis su med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, all transmigrators would be nondual.

original: gnyis ni bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis ni bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa'am /
translated: The two are the one to be taught and the teacher,

original: bstan pa dang ston pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa de gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang ston pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa de gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: or the teaching and the teacher, and so on. That which does not have that is said to be nondual.

original: de lta yin dang slob ma la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang slob ma la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, the classification of disciples and so on would not exist,

original: ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their unmixed natures would not be ascertained.

original: ci ste log pa'i don can zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe rtog pa gcig log pa nyid du khas len par byed na thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste log pa'i don can zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe rtog pa gcig log pa nyid du khas len par byed na thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is the position that it has a mistaken meaning, then at that time, if one accepts that a single thought is mistaken, then an omniscient being would be mistaken.

original: log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he would possess a mistaken consciousness.

original: de la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault in that?

original: smyon pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: smyon pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf he were mistaken, then . . . like the words of a madman . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te 'khrul par gyur na de'i tshe de'i tshig don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pas gus par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gal te 'khrul par gyur na de'i tshe de'i tshig don ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pas gus par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te ;
translated: If he were mistaken, then one who is endowed with the thought that seeks to understand the meaning just as it is would not respect him,

original: smyon pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: smyon pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin no //
translated: because his words would be like the words of a madman.

original: gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin nam //
analyzed: gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin nam //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the chief . . . ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: This is the question.

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'jig rten 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pas sam /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'jig rten 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pas sam /
translated: ‚ÄúIf he were in samƒÅdhi . . . ‚Äù

original: zag pa med pas so //
analyzed: zag pa med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSupramundane‚Äù means that he is equipoised or that he is uncontaminated.

original: de ltar gyur pa 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga med do zhes sngar rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma lnga med do zhes sngar rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir /
translated: This has been extensively explained above.

original: des na de 'dra ste skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: des na de 'dra ste skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, such a person, the so-called ‚Äúprimary object of a person,‚Äù does not exist.

original: dngos po'i bye brag mtha' dag ma bzung bar gtso bo'i don rtogs pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i bye brag mtha' dag ma bzung bar gtso bo'i don rtogs pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Without apprehending all the particulars of a thing, it is impossible to understand the primary object.

original: gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te /
translated: This is because the primary and the nonprimary are mutually exclusive.

original: gnas pa'i phyir gdon mi za ba'i dngos po'i gtso bo ma yin pa las rnam par phye nas gtso bo'i rang bzhin rtogs par bya dgos te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir gdon mi za ba'i dngos po'i gtso bo ma yin pa las rnam par phye nas gtso bo'i rang bzhin rtogs par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, without doubt, the nature of the primary must be understood by distinguishing it from the nonprimary.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo ma 'chol bar rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo ma 'chol bar rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the nature of the primary be understood without confusion?

original: de lta @277b yin dang 'di ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba yin la 'di ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye nas gtso bo nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtso bo ma yin pa yang nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta @277b yin dang 'di ni skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba yin la 'di ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye nas gtso bo nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtso bo ma yin pa yang nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
translated: In that case, since one would ascertain the principal one by distinguishing it in that way, how could one not ascertain the non-principal as well?

original: nus pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not possible, he says:

original: ji ltar rim dang cig car gyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar rim dang cig car gyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How is it by gradual or instantaneous?

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya ba yin la /
translated: The capacity of things is to be inferred from the effect.

original: gang las 'di rjes su dpog par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i nus pa'i 'bras bur gyur na dngos po ma lus pa'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las 'di rjes su dpog par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i nus pa'i 'bras bur gyur na dngos po ma lus pa'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which infers this were the effect of the capacity of the omniscient one who fully knows all things, it would be a cognition that has as its object all things without exception.

original: de yang rim dang cig car dag gis kyang srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang rim dang cig car dag gis kyang srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that it is not possible for that to be either gradual or instantaneous.

original: de'i phyir rim mam cig car gyis nus pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba gang yin pa de med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rim mam cig car gyis nus pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba gang yin pa de med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no such thing as an effect that is produced either gradually or instantaneously.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: med na gang zhig rjes dpog nus //
analyzed: med na gang zhig rjes dpog nus //
translated: If it does not exist, what is inferred?

original: zhes bya ba lhag ma de mi srid pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lhag ma de mi srid pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the remainder of this passage is that it is absolutely impossible.

original: rim dang cig car ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rim dang cig car ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The terms gradual and instantaneous are illustrative;

original: rang bzhin gcig dang gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig dang gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should also understand that the terms ‚Äúone nature‚Äù and ‚Äúprimal substance‚Äù are also illustrative.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i nus pa ni 'ga' zhig la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i nus pa ni 'ga' zhig la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, no one has the ability to understand all things,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no effect that has that kind of nature.

original: ci ste 'bras bu mi byed kyang nus par gyur na thams cad 'bras bu thams cad la nus par 'gyur zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu mi byed kyang nus par gyur na thams cad 'bras bu thams cad la nus par 'gyur zhes ston pa ni /
translated: But if something does not produce an effect, but is still a potentiality, then everything would be a potentiality for everything.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says:

original: ; yang na thams cad nus pa nyid //
analyzed: ; yang na thams cad nus pa nyid //
translated: Or else, everything would be a potentiality for everything.

original: ces bya'o // rnam pa 'di lta bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya'o // rnam pa 'di lta bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show this, he says:

original: thams cad thams cad rtogs pa la //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad rtogs pa la //
translated: In the realization of all things,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhing thams cad shes pa ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhing thams cad shes pa ni bdag go //
translated: Thus, the field of all things is the self.

original: dngos po thams cad rtogs pa la nus pa'i ngang tshul ni nus pa zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rtogs pa la nus pa'i ngang tshul ni nus pa zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: The state of being able to realize all things is called the ability.

original: dngos po thams cad rtogs pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir skyes bu 'ga' yang thams cad rtogs pa ma yin no zhes 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi stong pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rtogs pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir skyes bu 'ga' yang thams cad rtogs pa ma yin no zhes 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi stong pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no means of realizing all things, it is just asserted that no person whatsoever realizes all things, but not because of emptiness.

original: de bas na dngos su dngos po thams cad rig pa'i skyes bu yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad ma med pa can yin pa'i @278a * //
analyzed: de bas na dngos su dngos po thams cad rig pa'i skyes bu yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni tshad ma med pa can yin pa'i @278a * //
translated: Therefore, this assertion that a person who directly knows all things exists is without a valid means of knowledge.

original: phyir ; bzhig  tshad ma lnga dang bral ba'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo de ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin dang nam mkha'i padma'i yul can bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di grub po //üîΩgzhan yang ci rnam pa med pa'i shes pas thams cad shes sam /
analyzed: phyir ; bzhig  tshad ma lnga dang bral ba'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo de ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin dang nam mkha'i padma'i yul can bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di grub po // gzhan yang ci rnam pa med pa'i shes pas thams cad shes sam /
translated: The object that is the domain of the valid cognition that is the absence of entityness, which is free from the five valid cognitions, is like the son of a barren woman or like the object of a sky flower.üîΩMoreover, it should be said: ‚ÄúDoes consciousness without aspects cognize everything,

original: 'on te rnam pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: or does it cognize with aspects?‚Äù

original: phyogs dang po la blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i dngos po rnam par phye nas yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur te shes pa de shes bya thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid kyis las so so la rnam par dbye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: phyogs dang po la blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i dngos po rnam par phye nas yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur te shes pa de shes bya thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid kyis las so so la rnam par dbye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro
translated: In the first case, the object to be adopted and the object to be rejected would not be distinguished and ascertained, because that consciousness, being the same with respect to all objects of cognition, would not be able to distinguish one object from another.

original: // de rnam par ma phye ba yang ji ltar yul tha dad pa yang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: // de rnam par ma phye ba yang ji ltar yul tha dad pa yang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, how could it posit different objects without distinguishing them?

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ni rtogs pa thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ni rtogs pa thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason for that is all objects of cognition.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the position that it has aspects,

original: rang gi rnam par shes las 'di nyid kyis rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa las tha dad pa'i don gyi rnam pa mi rig pa'i phyir shes pa tsam shes par 'gyur gyi thams cad shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes las 'di nyid kyis rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa las tha dad pa'i don gyi rnam pa mi rig pa'i phyir shes pa tsam shes par 'gyur gyi thams cad shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because consciousness itself is aware of itself, and because there is no awareness of an object that is different from consciousness, which is by nature self-awareness. Therefore, consciousness is aware of itself, but not of everything.

original: rnam pa 'dzin pas don rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed na 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dzin pas don rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du byed na 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is said that the object is perceived because it apprehends the aspect, then there is error.

original: gang zhig gzhan mthong ba la brten nas bdag mthong ba zhes rtog par byed pa de ji ltar 'khrul par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan mthong ba la brten nas bdag mthong ba zhes rtog par byed pa de ji ltar 'khrul par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could there not be error if one imagines that one sees oneself on the basis of seeing another?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa gnyis las ma gtogs par shes pa'i don 'dzin pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa gnyis las ma gtogs par shes pa'i don 'dzin pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the two kinds of perception that have been explained, there is no other perception of an object whatsoever.

original: de lta bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is no perception of a transcendent object at all.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa las thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa las thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: Thus, etc. is the opponent‚Äôs position, which is summarized in order to establish omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is established in order to establish omniscience.

original: de ltar thob pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams sun 'byin par rtsom mo //
analyzed: de ltar thob pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams sun 'byin par rtsom mo //
translated: Thus, the attainment, etc. is the beginning of the refutation.üîΩFirst,

original: re zhig / de phyir dbang po las 'das don //
analyzed: re zhig / de phyir dbang po las 'das don //
translated: Therefore, the transcendent object

original: dngos su blta ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos su blta ba yod ma yin //
translated: Is not directly seen.

original: tshig ni rtag pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: tshig ni rtag pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig mthong bo des mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mthong bo des mthong ngo //
translated: Indicates that it is seen by some.

original: zhes chos shes pa bkag pa byas nas rang gi phyogs bzhag pa byas pa gang yin pa de mi @278b rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir rig byed rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes chos shes pa bkag pa byas nas rang gi phyogs bzhag pa byas pa gang yin pa de mi @278b rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir rig byed rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to show that it is not correct to refute the knowledge of reality and then to posit one‚Äôs own position, he says, The Vedas, etc.

original: sngar thos pa brtag par rig byed rnams rgyas par skyes bus byas pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa des na tshig rtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa rtog pa'i khyad par tshig rtag pa la brten pa nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: sngar thos pa brtag par rig byed rnams rgyas par skyes bus byas pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa des na tshig rtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa rtog pa'i khyad par tshig rtag pa la brten pa nyid ma grub po //
translated: Previously, in the examination of scripture, it was already proven that the Vedas were composed by a person. Therefore, since it is impossible for words to be permanent, it is not established that the specific conception of a transcendent object is based on permanent words.

original: des na dngos su dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba po yod pa yin gyi tshig rtag pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos su dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba po yod pa yin gyi tshig rtag pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is directly by the existence of the seer of a transcendent object, not by means of permanent words.

original: tshig rtag pa de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig rtag pa de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that permanent word is impossible.

original: gzigs pa yod pa nyid ces pa'i nges par gzung ba'i rim pa bzhin du dngos su zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa yod pa nyid ces pa'i nges par gzung ba'i rim pa bzhin du dngos su zhes bya ba 'di'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdirectly‚Äù should be supplied at the end of ‚Äúthe existence of the seer.‚Äù

original: tshig rtag pa nyid yin du chug pa de lta na yang de ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtog pa la rgyu yi dngos por rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir rtag pa'i tshig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: tshig rtag pa nyid yin du chug pa de lta na yang de ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtog pa la rgyu yi dngos por rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir rtag pa'i tshig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Even if one allowed that words are permanent, it would still be demonstrated that they are not known to be the cause of the conception of a transcendent object. To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúEven if words were permanent,‚Äù and so on.

original: smos te / de la rang don ni rang gi brjod par bya ba'am yang na rang gi don ni bdag nyid de sgra yi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: smos te / de la rang don ni rang gi brjod par bya ba'am yang na rang gi don ni bdag nyid de sgra yi rang bzhin no //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúone‚Äôs own purpose‚Äù is one‚Äôs own expression, or else one‚Äôs own purpose is one‚Äôs own nature, which is the nature of sound.üîΩ‚Äú

original: don ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose‚Äù is the object of expression.üîΩ‚Äú

original: rang dang don ni rang don ni dag go //
analyzed: rang dang don ni rang don ni dag go //
translated: One‚Äôs own purpose‚Äù is the combination of these two.

original: de dag gi shes pa de bskyed pa la ste /
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa de bskyed pa la ste /
translated: The knowledge of these two is generated from that.

original: de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir tshig rtag pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa de rang las yin nam /
analyzed: de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir tshig rtag pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa de rang las yin nam /
translated: In order to generate that, is the nature of the power of the eternal word established from itself?

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan las yin grang /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan las yin grang /
translated: Or is it established from another, a cooperative condition?

original: de la re zhig rang las ni ma yin no gang las she na /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang las ni ma yin no gang las she na /
translated: In this regard, it is not from itself. From what?

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis 'bras bu bskyed par 'gal ba'i phyir te gang gi don byed par 'gyur ba rim par cig car dag las rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis 'bras bu bskyed par 'gal ba'i phyir te gang gi don byed par 'gyur ba rim par cig car dag las rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is because it is contradictory for the eternal to generate an effect in sequence or simultaneously. Because whatever is an effect is not another type apart from sequential or simultaneous.

original: 'di dag ni phan tshun rnam par bcad nas gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan tshun rnam par bcad nas gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because these two are characterized by the exclusion of each other.

original: des na rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa la khyab la tshig rtag pa la rim gyis rang gi don la nus pa skyed par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa la khyab la tshig rtag pa la rim gyis rang gi don la nus pa skyed par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the performance of a function is necessarily either sequential or simultaneous. It is not logical for a permanent word to generate its meaning sequentially,

original: dang po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i gnas skabs la dus phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i phyir de tsam las byung ba'i 'bras bu rnams cig car kho nar 'gyur ro //üîΩrim ma yin pas kyang rim pa ma yin te dus phyis kyang dang po'i 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa tshang ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pas mi bskyed pa nyid du 'gal @279a * //
analyzed: dang po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i gnas skabs la dus phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i phyir de tsam las byung ba'i 'bras bu rnams cig car kho nar 'gyur ro // rim ma yin pas kyang rim pa ma yin te dus phyis kyang dang po'i 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa tshang ba'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pas mi bskyed pa nyid du 'gal @279a * //
translated: because the nature of generating the effect of a later cognition is not impaired in the state of generating the effect of the first. Therefore, the effects that arise from that would be simultaneous.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not sequential, because even later, the nature of the complete ability to produce the effect of the first is not impaired. Therefore, it is contradictory that it does not produce it.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi khyab par byed pa'i chos dang bral ba la ni de'i khyab par bya ba'i chos dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi khyab par byed pa'i chos dang bral ba la ni de'i khyab par bya ba'i chos dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is devoid of the property of the pervader is devoid of the property of the pervaded.

original: dper na shing nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni de'i khyab par bya ba shing sha pa nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni de'i khyab par bya ba shing sha pa nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a pot, which is empty of the property of being a tree, is also empty of the property of being a shapely object, which is pervaded by being a tree.

original: rig byed du brjod pa'i tshig dag kyang don byed par nus pa'i chos kyi khyab par byed pa rim dang rim ma yin pa'i chos dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni don byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rig byed du brjod pa'i tshig dag kyang don byed par nus pa'i chos kyi khyab par byed pa rim dang rim ma yin pa'i chos dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni don byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The words expressed in the Vedas are also devoid of the property of being able to perform a function, which is pervaded by the property of being a sequence or non-sequence. This is the non-observation of a related object.

original: de bas na rtag pa'i tshig gi nus pa rang la yod pa ma yin la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan las kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa'i tshig gi nus pa rang la yod pa ma yin la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan las kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the power of the words of the Vedas does not exist in themselves, nor does it exist in other co-operating causes.

original: des na de'i rang bzhin dang tha mi dad pa'i nus pa ni de'i rang bzhin gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de'i rang bzhin dang tha mi dad pa'i nus pa ni de'i rang bzhin gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power, which is not different from the nature of the Vedas, cannot make that nature into something else.

original: gzhan nyid yin na yang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes 'di ni mang du dpyad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na yang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes 'di ni mang du dpyad zin to //
translated: And if it were different, the relation would not be established. This has been analyzed extensively.

original: de lta bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don yongs su shes pa'i gtan tshigs rtag pa rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don yongs su shes pa'i gtan tshigs rtag pa rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: As such, because the reason of the complete understanding of the object that is beyond the sense faculties is undermined by the inference of permanence, it is not logical.

original: gang yang dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa med do zhes smras pa de la gzhan gyis khas blangs pa nyid kyi chos shes pa med par dam bca' ba'i don gyi go rims tshad ma'i gnod pa nyid
analyzed: gang yang dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa med do zhes smras pa de la gzhan gyis khas blangs pa nyid kyi chos shes pa med par dam bca' ba'i don gyi go rims tshad ma'i gnod pa nyid
translated: Moreover, with regard to the statement, ‚ÄúThe cognition of reality does not exist because the object that is the domain of the valid knowledge that is the nonexistence of things is not an object,‚Äù the opponent‚Äôs assertion that the cognition of reality does not exist is undermined by valid knowledge, and the order of the meaning of the proposition is taught.

original: dang gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is also unestablished, it is said:

original: de phyir mtho ris mchod sbyin sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir mtho ris mchod sbyin sogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore heaven, sacrifice, and so on

original: rang gis zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gis te rig byed la ltos pa med pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gis te rig byed la ltos pa med pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy oneself‚Äù means by one‚Äôs own power, the meaning of which is ‚Äúby a consciousness that does not rely on the Vedas.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis bkag pa ci 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis bkag pa ci 'dra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù refers to the kind of refutation that you CƒÅrvƒÅka make.

original: don gyis rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rig byed tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis thob pas so //
analyzed: don gyis rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rig byed tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis thob pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is obtained in fact‚Äù means that it is implicitly obtained because it is accepted that the Vedas are valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma grub ste /
translated: For that very reason, the nature of the object of non-existent valid cognition is also not established,

original: don gyi go bas yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi go bas yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an object that is understood through the meaning.

original: gang yang thams cad kyi sgra skabs kyi don la ltos te mang du brtags nas sun 'byin pa smras pa de mi 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang thams cad kyi sgra skabs kyi don la ltos te mang du brtags nas sun 'byin pa smras pa de mi 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Also, the refutation that was stated by examining in detail all words in terms of their relevance to the context is not applicable.

original: phyogs 'di khas ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di khas ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because this position is not accepted.

original: gang gi de la sun 'byin par 'gyur ba kho bo @279b cag gis chos la sogs pa las ma gtogs par brjod pa 'dod pa'i don mtha' dag shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi de la sun 'byin par 'gyur ba kho bo @279b cag gis chos la sogs pa las ma gtogs par brjod pa 'dod pa'i don mtha' dag shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept that the omniscience of the Buddha is the knowledge of all objects of knowledge that are not included among phenomena and so on, in order to refute that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what do you accept?

original: gang zhig nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dri ma mtha' dag dang bral ba'i sems kyi chos la sogs pa'i shes bya mtha' dag gsal bya de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'dod na de la khyed cag gis gnod par byed pa cung zad
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dri ma mtha' dag dang bral ba'i sems kyi chos la sogs pa'i shes bya mtha' dag gsal bya de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par 'dod na de la khyed cag gis gnod par byed pa cung zad
translated: If you assert that omniscience is the clarity of all objects of knowledge, such as the phenomena of the mind, free from all the stains of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, then you have not said anything that harms that assertion in the least.

original: kyang ma brjod do //üîΩgang yang / lus po gcig po kho na yi //
analyzed: kyang ma brjod do // gang yang / lus po gcig po kho na yi //
translated: Also, the statement,üîΩThe body is just as many

original: rdul phran ji snyed yod pa rnams //
analyzed: rdul phran ji snyed yod pa rnams //
translated: as the atoms of the body,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de ni tshad ma med pa can gyi dam bca' ba tsam brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de ni tshad ma med pa can gyi dam bca' ba tsam brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: is just the expression of a thesis that lacks a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'thad pas stong pa'i dam bca' ba tsam las don grub pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'thad pas stong pa'i dam bca' ba tsam las don grub pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not possible to establish a meaning from a thesis that is devoid of a proof,üîΩbecause it follows that everyone would establish every meaning.

original: thams cad kyis don thams cad grub pa la thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di thams cad zhe la bzhag nas /
analyzed: thams cad kyis don thams cad grub pa la thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di thams cad zhe la bzhag nas /
translated: Having thought about all of this,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu med ces bya ba la rgyu ni 'thad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu med ces bya ba la rgyu ni 'thad pa ste /
translated: The cause is a logical possibility.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which does not have a reason consisting of the trimodal mark is called ‚Äúwithout a cause.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri mas dben pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri mas dben pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is devoid of the stains of the obscurations that are the afflictions and the knowable.

original: phyi rol mu stegs byed kyis rgol ba'i phyir rlung gis mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol mu stegs byed kyis rgol ba'i phyir rlung gis mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is unshaken by the wind because it is not shaken by the wind of external sophistry.

original: ye shes gang yin pa de nyid kyi sgron ma yin te gsal bar byed pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes gang yin pa de nyid kyi sgron ma yin te gsal bar byed pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is pristine wisdom is itself a lamp because it illuminates, because it is similar to a lamp.

original: des na gang gis chos la sogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa gsal ba ste yul du byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na gang gis chos la sogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa gsal ba ste yul du byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called that because it illuminates, that is, it makes into an object, all things such as the Dharma.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Even though it is dependent, it is included because it is an illuminator.

original: 'di la gnod byed ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la gnod byed ma brjod do //
translated: No one has said that it is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúvalid means of knowledge‚Äù is left out.

original: ma brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'di la gnod pa byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ma brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'di la gnod pa byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Not only is it not stated, but it is also not the slightest bit damaged.

original: de ltar re zhig mngon sum ni gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mngon sum ni gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, direct perception is not a refutation,

original: de ni de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of that.

original: ji ltar dngos po gang kho na mngon sum gyis yul du byed pa de la mngon sum gyis grub pa las bzlog pa'i chos khas len pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa @280a * //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po gang kho na mngon sum gyis yul du byed pa de la mngon sum gyis grub pa las bzlog pa'i chos khas len pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa @280a * //
translated: Just as whatever thing is made an object by direct perception, in the case of accepting a property that is the opposite of what is established by direct perception, direct perception is a refutation.

original: yin te // dper na chos can sgra la mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis gnod pa lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: yin te // dper na chos can sgra la mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis gnod pa lta bu yin gyi /
translated: For example, with respect to the subject, sound, being not audible is refuted by being audible.

original: gang du mngon sum mi 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du mngon sum mi 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it is not where direct perception does not engage.

original: gang gi de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dam bca' ba mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dam bca' ba mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mind in the continuum of someone who is not omniscient makes the mind in the continuum of another person an object of direct perception, and that person‚Äôs omniscience is undermined by direct perception.

original: thams cad tshu rol mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad tshu rol mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all see only a limited range.

original: yul du byed na de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir mi spang ngo //
analyzed: yul du byed na de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir mi spang ngo //
translated: If it were an object, it would be omniscient.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag ni mngon sum 'jug pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed do zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag ni mngon sum 'jug pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed do zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that when direct perception engages its object, it proves that things do not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: log pa na ste 'di ltar dngos po gang la mngon sum log pa'i don dngos po med par byed de dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: log pa na ste 'di ltar dngos po gang la mngon sum log pa'i don dngos po med par byed de dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: When direct perception is mistaken, it proves that things do not exist, because it makes the object of direct perception nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: gang la 'jug pa der ni yod pa ste dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la 'jug pa der ni yod pa ste dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: When it engages its object, it proves that things exist, like form and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med pa de bas na de log pas de med par nges par byed do snyam du sems na de ni 'brel pa med de 'di ltar log pa las dngos po med par nges pa gang
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med pa de bas na de log pas de med par nges par byed do snyam du sems na de ni 'brel pa med de 'di ltar log pa las dngos po med par nges pa gang
translated: If you think that since there is no direct perception that engages the object of omniscience, then the nonexistence of that object is ascertained by the cessation of that direct perception, that is not related to the point.

original: yin pa de mngon sum las 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yin pa de mngon sum las 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Why? Because the ascertainment of nonexistence from the cessation of direct perception does not arise from direct perception.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gcig tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi dngos po med pa 'di de las nges par byed pa mngon sum log pa la dngos po med pas khyab pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gcig tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro // gang gi dngos po med pa 'di de las nges par byed pa mngon sum log pa la dngos po med pas khyab pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This is because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive.

original: dngos po yod na yang chod pa la sogs pa la mngon sum log par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod na yang chod pa la sogs pa la mngon sum log par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the cessation of direct perception is not pervaded by the nonexistence of the object, because even when the object exists, the cessation of direct perception is seen in the case of an obstruction and so on.

original: 'di snyam du mngon sum log pa las dngos po med pa nges so zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du mngon sum log pa las dngos po med pa nges so zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: If you think that we do not say that nonexistence is ascertained from the cessation of direct perception,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what do you think?

original: 'on kyang mngon sum ldog pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum ldog pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that when direct perception ceases, it proves nonexistence,

original: 'di nyid khyed cag gis sgra gzhan gyi brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zangs kyi don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid khyed cag gis sgra gzhan gyi brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zangs kyi don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because, for you, the meaning of ‚Äúother sound‚Äù is not a different object.

original: sgra gzhan pa tsam las don gzhan nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra gzhan pa tsam las don gzhan nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for something to be different from mere other sound.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: 'di ltar log pa'i sgras dngos po yod pa bkag pa brjod pa bzlog pa'i sgras kyang don dam par de nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar log pa'i sgras dngos po yod pa bkag pa brjod pa bzlog pa'i sgras kyang don dam par de nyid brjod do //
translated: Thus, a false sound expresses the negation of an existent thing. Even the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù ultimately expresses that itself.

original: 'on kyang @280b gcig nyid khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa las de brjod la gzhan ni mi spangs pas so zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang @280b gcig nyid khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa las de brjod la gzhan ni mi spangs pas so zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: However, the difference is that one wishes to know just that much by excluding other features, and that is expressed, while the other does not exclude anything else.

original: don dam par ni gnyi gas kyang dngos po med pa nyid bstan pa yin la med pa ni rgyu'i dngos por yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni gnyi gas kyang dngos po med pa nyid bstan pa yin la med pa ni rgyu'i dngos por yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, both teach the nonexistence of things. Nonexistence is not possible as a causal thing,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad kyi stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad kyi stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its definition is the emptiness of all abilities.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig gang gi skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig gang gi skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if something is a producer of something,

original: gsal bar byed pa yin pa de ni de'i skyed par byed pa dang gsal bar byed pa yin pas nye bar yod pa can du 'gyur gyi ldog pa'i rang bzhin du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yin pa de ni de'i skyed par byed pa dang gsal bar byed pa yin pas nye bar yod pa can du 'gyur gyi ldog pa'i rang bzhin du ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is the producer and the illuminator, it is present, but it is not the nature of the opposite.

original: myu gu'i sa bon dang gzugs kyi sgron ma bzhin no //
analyzed: myu gu'i sa bon dang gzugs kyi sgron ma bzhin no //
translated: It is like the seed of the sprout and the lamp of the form of the pot.

original: de dag bzlog pa na myu gu dang bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa skyed par byed pa dang gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag bzlog pa na myu gu dang bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa skyed par byed pa dang gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When they are reversed, it is not the case that the seed of the sprout and the lamp of the form of the pot are the producer and the illuminator.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum ldog pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir don ci la 'dod /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum ldog pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir don ci la 'dod /
translated: Moreover, if direct perception is the opposite, what is the meaning of the claim that it proves non-entity?

original: gal te re zhig de ltar gnas pa las ldog go zhes bya ba'i don yin na de'i tshe shugs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba de ltar brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te re zhig de ltar gnas pa las ldog go zhes bya ba'i don yin na de'i tshe shugs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba de ltar brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is the meaning that it is the opposite of that which abides in that way, then by implication it is said that it is the state of the past and future.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin te de ji ltar med pa la bya ba grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin te de ji ltar med pa la bya ba grub par 'gyur /
translated: It has been shown that past and future things do not exist. How can a nonexistent thing be established as an action?

original: ci ste de ltar yin yang gang zhig yul gang la mi skye ba de ni de las log par brjod na de lta na de las dngos po med pa grub pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste de ltar yin yang gang zhig yul gang la mi skye ba de ni de las log par brjod na de lta na de las dngos po med pa grub pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if that were so, if something does not arise in a certain place, it is said to be absent there. But in that case, the absence of a thing is not established from that, because of error.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dri dang ro la sogs pa'i yul la mi skye ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis de las de med par yul du byed pa'i phyir dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dri dang ro la sogs pa'i yul la mi skye ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis de las de med par yul du byed pa'i phyir dngos po med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere fact that visual consciousness does not arise in regard to objects such as smell and taste is not the nonexistence of those things, because they are not objects of that consciousness.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyis 'ga' zhig gi dngos po med pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyis 'ga' zhig gi dngos po med pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of something is not established by perception.

original: de lta na ji ltar khyed cag gis mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i mngon sum las phyogs kyi bye brag gzhan du dngos po med pa grub par brjod ce na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar khyed cag gis mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i mngon sum las phyogs kyi bye brag gzhan du dngos po med pa grub par brjod ce na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, how do you establish the absence of a thing in a particular place by means of nonapprehension, which is a type of perception?

original: de las mngon sum dngos po med pa yul du byed pa'i phyir dngos po med pa sgrub par byed do zhes ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de las mngon sum dngos po med pa yul du byed pa'i phyir dngos po med pa sgrub par byed do zhes ni mi brjod do //
translated: But we do not say that the non-existence of a real entity is established by perception, because perception does not have a non-entity for its object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: shes pa gcig la 'drer rung ba'i don dag la gnag yang rung ba grub pa gang yin pa de nyid cig shos med par grub pa yin no @281a * //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la 'drer rung ba'i don dag la gnag yang rung ba grub pa gang yin pa de nyid cig shos med par grub pa yin no @281a * //
translated: That very establishment of the suitability of the object for a single cognition is the establishment of the other, i.e., the non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba de ltar byas pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar byas pas so //
translated: It is in this way.

original: gang gi phyir de dag yod pa na ngo bo gcig nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag yod pa na ngo bo gcig nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When they exist, there is no ascertainment of a single nature, because there is no difference in suitability.

original: gang zhig 'ba' zhig dmigs pa'i phyir de med par nges pa de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig shes pa gcig dang 'dre bar nges pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'ba' zhig dmigs pa'i phyir de med par nges pa de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig shes pa gcig dang 'dre bar nges pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Just as it is ascertained that something does not exist because it is not perceived, in the same way, omniscience is not ascertained as being suitable for a single cognition together with something else.

original: de ni rtag tu shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is always extremely hidden.

original: de ltar re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod par byed pa mngon sum srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod par byed pa mngon sum srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, to begin with, there is no direct perception that contradicts omniscience.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference also does not prove the nonexistence of omniscience,

original: don sgrub pa'i yul can nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don sgrub pa'i yul can nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the object of inference is an existent object.

original: gang gi phyir khyed cag gis dngos po med pa kho na tshad ma dngos po med pa'i yul du brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed cag gis dngos po med pa kho na tshad ma dngos po med pa'i yul du brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Because you assert that only the nonexistence of a thing is a non-existent object of valid cognition, and not anything else.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang don gyis go ba la sogs pa gsum yang gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang don gyis go ba la sogs pa gsum yang gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the three, presumption and so on, are also not contradictory.

original: ci ste yang kho bo cag gis med par dgag pa'i ngo bo thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang kho bo cag gis med par dgag pa'i ngo bo thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if you think that we do not prove the nonexistence of omniscience by means of the nature of a nonaffirming negation,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what do we prove?

original: skyes bu thams cad phyogs su byas nas ma yin par 'jug pa de dag la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad phyogs su byas nas ma yin par 'jug pa de dag la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: We prove that all persons who are engaged in nonexistence are not omniscient.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i bya ba yod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i bya ba yod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, the activity of inference and so on does exist.

original: de lta bu yod mod de lta na yang re zhig rjes su dpag pas srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu yod mod de lta na yang re zhig rjes su dpag pas srid pa ma yin te /
translated: This is so, but still, for the time being, it is not possible by inference,

original: skyes bu thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa med pa la mi 'khrul pa'i rtags ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa med pa la mi 'khrul pa'i rtags ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason that all persons are not omniscient is not established.

original: gang yang gzhal bya nyid dang smra ba po nyid la sogs pa smras pa de yang 'khrul pa yin no zhes phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang gzhal bya nyid dang smra ba po nyid la sogs pa smras pa de yang 'khrul pa yin no zhes phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: And what is more, it will be explained later that the reason that the object of knowledge and the speaker and so on are also mistaken.

original: don gyis go ba yang thams cad mkhyen pa med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go ba yang thams cad mkhyen pa med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The implication of the meaning also proves that there is no omniscience.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs par gzhan dag tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs par gzhan dag tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because other than perception and inference, the others are not established as valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma gzhan nyid yod na yang re zhig don gyis go bas ni /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan nyid yod na yang re zhig don gyis go bas ni /
translated: Even if there were another valid cognition, for the time being, by implication,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa med pa nyid du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not possible to prove that there is no omniscience.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'am /
translated: Because it is not seen.

original: thos pa'i don gzhan du mi mthang pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtog par byed pa na don gyis go ba yin la gang las de don gyis go bar rtog par byed pa @281b thams cad mkhyen pa med par skyes bu thams cad la mthong ba'i don 'ga' zhig
analyzed: thos pa'i don gzhan du mi mthang pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtog par byed pa na don gyis go ba yin la gang las de don gyis go bar rtog par byed pa @281b thams cad mkhyen pa med par skyes bu thams cad la mthong ba'i don 'ga' zhig
translated: And it is not tenable that all beings who conceive of understanding the meaning have seen any object.

original: 'thad pa yang ma yin no //üîΩnye bar 'jal ba yang nus pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar dran par bya ba'i dngos po mdun na yod pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i khyad par ram /üîΩmdun na gnas pa'i dran par bya ba'i dngos por rtogs pa'i 'dra ba tsam nye bar 'jal bas rtog par byed de dper na ba lang mthong ba'i nyams su myong ba'i nags na gnas pa'i skyes bu ba men mthong ba las sngar nyams su myong ba'i ba lang
analyzed: 'thad pa yang ma yin no // nye bar 'jal ba yang nus pa ma yin te / 'di ltar dran par bya ba'i dngos po mdun na yod pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i khyad par ram / mdun na gnas pa'i dran par bya ba'i dngos por rtogs pa'i 'dra ba tsam nye bar 'jal bas rtog par byed de dper na ba lang mthong ba'i nyams su myong ba'i nags na gnas pa'i skyes bu ba men mthong ba las sngar nyams su myong ba'i ba lang
translated: Nor is it possible to infer that.üîΩThus one conceives of a thing to be remembered by inferring a mere similarity to a thing that exists in front of oneself or by inferring a mere similarity that is realized in a thing to be remembered that exists in front of oneself.üîΩFor example, a person who has seen a cow and who lives in a forest sees a gayal and thinks, ‚ÄúThis is similar to a cow.‚Äù

original: la de dang chos mtshungs pa'i shes pa bzhin te ji skad du /
analyzed: la de dang chos mtshungs pa'i shes pa bzhin te ji skad du /
translated: Or, for example, a person who has seen a cow thinks, ‚ÄúThis is similar to a cow.‚Äù

original: de phyir 'dra bas khyad par du //üîΩbyas pa'i dran pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: de phyir 'dra bas khyad par du // byas pa'i dran pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is a memory of what is similar to the object.

original: de la brten pa'i 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i 'dra ba ste //
translated: Or, it is a memory of what is similar to the object that is produced by the object.üîΩOr, it is a memory of what is similar to the object that is based on the object.

original: nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the object of a scale that is weighed by what is similar to it.

original: de lta bas na dran par bya ba nyid kyi chos can nye bar 'jal ba'i yul yin la nyams su myong ba nyid kyang dran pas yul du byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dran par bya ba nyid kyi chos can nye bar 'jal ba'i yul yin la nyams su myong ba nyid kyang dran pas yul du byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the object of the memory is the object that is the basis of the memory. The object of the experience is also the object of the memory. It is not something else.

original: gang la dran pas yul du byed par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig gis skyes bu thams cad la yod pa'i sems rnams nyams su myong ba yang ma yin la gang gi dbang gis skyes bu thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa ma
analyzed: gang la dran pas yul du byed par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig gis skyes bu thams cad la yod pa'i sems rnams nyams su myong ba yang ma yin la gang gi dbang gis skyes bu thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa ma
translated: No one who is not omniscient has experienced the minds of all beings, which exist in all beings. By what means would the omniscience of all beings be known to him?

original: yin pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa skyes bu thams cad dang nyams su myong ba'i dngos po'i thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thun mong ba'i chos nges pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa skyes bu thams cad dang nyams su myong ba'i dngos po'i thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thun mong ba'i chos nges pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no other property that is ascertained to be common to all men and to the omniscience of the one who has the experience of all things.

original: gang yang yod pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig la mthong ba de yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid kyis thun mong bar grub pa ma yin te thams cad mkhyen pa la yang yod pa la sogs pa miüîΩ'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang yod pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig la mthong ba de yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid kyis thun mong bar grub pa ma yin te thams cad mkhyen pa la yang yod pa la sogs pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that which is seen in some non-omniscient person, such as existence, etc., is not established to be common to the non-omniscient person, because it is not contradictory that it also exists in the omniscient person.

original: ba men la yod pa la sogs pa'i chos mthong ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yang ba men dang 'dra bar rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba men la yod pa la sogs pa'i chos mthong ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yang ba men dang 'dra bar rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For, because of seeing the property of existence, etc., in a non-omniscient person, one does not infer that a pot, etc., is like a camel.

original: skyes bu thams cad yod pa la sogs pas chos mthun pa yin la rag mod /
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad yod pa la sogs pas chos mthun pa yin la rag mod /
translated: It is true that all men are similar in having existence, etc.,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du ni mi 'grub po //
translated: but it is not established that they are non-omniscient.

original: 'dis ni / de ltar yod pa'i mi rnams kun //
analyzed: 'dis ni / de ltar yod pa'i mi rnams kun //
translated: All those who exist in this way

original: kun mkhyen min par mthong nas ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yang gsal ba yin no //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa la gnod par byed @282a * //
analyzed: kun mkhyen min par mthong nas ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di yang gsal ba yin no // thams cad mkhyen pa la gnod par byed @282a * //
translated: are seen to be non-omniscient.

original: pa'i tshad ma sgra zhes bya ba la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i tshad ma sgra zhes bya ba la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that there is a valid cognition that contradicts omniscience, called ‚Äúverbal valid cognition.‚Äù

original: re zhig skyes bus byas pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don gyis yul las tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du dpyod pa pa rnams rang nyid kyis khas blangs la /
analyzed: re zhig skyes bus byas pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don gyis yul las tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du dpyod pa pa rnams rang nyid kyis khas blangs la /
translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas themselves accept that whatever is produced by a person is not a valid cognition with regard to a transcendent object.üîΩAnd it has been demonstrated that

original: gang yang skyes bus ma byas pa //
analyzed: gang yang skyes bus ma byas pa //
translated: whatever is not produced by a person

original: de yang tshad ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: is a valid cognition.

original: skyes bu thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i rig byed kyi tshig 'ga' zhig dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i rig byed kyi tshig 'ga' zhig dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there any Vedic statement observed that demonstrates that all persons are not omniscient.

original: der ma bstan pas kyang don gzhan med par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: der ma bstan pas kyang don gzhan med par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not established that it has no other meaning because it is not taught.

original: dngos po thams cad bstan bcos su bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bstan bcos su bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because not all things are taught in the treatises.

original: de lta ma yin na khyod kyi ma bag mar blangs pa la sogs pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur te der mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyod kyi ma bag mar blangs pa la sogs pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur te der mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, then it would follow that your mother‚Äôs marriage and so on would not exist, but that is unacceptable.

original: 'ga' zhig phyogs gcig tu 'don par ma mthong ba'i phyir thams cad du mi 'don par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig phyogs gcig tu 'don par ma mthong ba'i phyir thams cad du mi 'don par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that because one does not see the recitation of some texts in one place, they are not recited everywhere.

original: dngos po thams cad bstan bcos su bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bstan bcos su bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because not all things are taught in the treatises.

original: 'phros pa brgya phrag gcig tu ma nub par thos pa'i phyir gtan du yang 'don pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phros pa brgya phrag gcig tu ma nub par thos pa'i phyir gtan du yang 'don pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that some texts are recited permanently, since they are heard without interruption for a hundred years.

original: ltas can zhes bya ba'i 'phros pa gzhan du gsal rab tu thams cad mkhyen pa 'don pa yin no zhes phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ltas can zhes bya ba'i 'phros pa gzhan du gsal rab tu thams cad mkhyen pa 'don pa yin no zhes phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: The recitation of the text called ‚ÄúThe One with the Mark‚Äù is clearly known elsewhere to be the recitation of the Omniscient One. This will be explained later.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma yul du byas pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma yul du byas pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the nonexistence of a valid cognition is established as not existing, because it is taken as an object.

original: 'di ltar gal te tshad ma med pa log pa tsam med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i tshad mar brjod na de'i tshe 'di 'ga' zhig gis rtogs pa ma yin zhing rtog pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pa nges yul du byed pa rigs pa ma
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te tshad ma med pa log pa tsam med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i tshad mar brjod na de'i tshe 'di 'ga' zhig gis rtogs pa ma yin zhing rtog pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pa nges yul du byed pa rigs pa ma
translated: In that case, if the mere absence of a non-existent valid cognition is described as a non-existent valid cognition, which is defined as a negative phenomenon that is an external negation, then at that time it is not understood by anyone, and it is not a cause of understanding. It is not logical to take as an object a non-existent valid cognition,

original: yin te / dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a non-existent.

original: de lta bas na 'di tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not a valid cognition.

original: ci ste ma yin par 'jug pas tshad ma zhes bya ba'i dngos po las gzhan pa'i dngos po nyid du 'dod pa de lta na yang tshad ma las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid yin pas tshad ma nyid du 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste ma yin par 'jug pas tshad ma zhes bya ba'i dngos po las gzhan pa'i dngos po nyid du 'dod pa de lta na yang tshad ma las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid yin pas tshad ma nyid du 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
