translated: But if you assert that it is a different thing from the thing called valid cognition, because it engages in non-existence, then even in that case it would not be established as a valid cognition, because it has a nature that is the opposite of a valid cognition.

original: bram ze las gzhan ni bram ze nyid du mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bram ze las gzhan ni bram ze nyid du mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is illogical for something that is not a Brahmin to be a Brahmin.

original: 'dir 'di snyam du 'di tshad ma thams cad las ldog pa nyid mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'di snyam du 'di tshad ma thams cad las ldog pa nyid mi brjod do //
translated: Here, one might think, ‚ÄúI do not say that this is the opposite of all valid cognitions.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what?‚Äù

original: brjod par @282b 'dod pa'i tshad ma lnga las gzhan pa'i shes pa'i khyad par nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: brjod par @282b 'dod pa'i tshad ma lnga las gzhan pa'i shes pa'i khyad par nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is the specific cognition that is different from the five valid cognitions that are asserted,

original: gal te de lta na 'di lta bu'i rnam pa yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di lta bu'i rnam pa yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: then in that case, you should state what its aspect is.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma lnga'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa 'di med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma lnga'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa 'di med do snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is the aspect that thinks, ‚ÄòThis omniscience does not exist because it is not the object of the five valid cognitions,‚Äô

original: rnam pa de lta bu yin na 'o na tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu yin na 'o na tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: then if it is that sort of aspect, it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mistaken.

original: gang gi phyir gang gis shes pa 'di bden par 'gyur ba rang bzhin ma yin pa dang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i tshad ma lnga po ldog pa na 'brel pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i nges pa ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis shes pa 'di bden par 'gyur ba rang bzhin ma yin pa dang rgyu ma yin par gyur pa'i tshad ma lnga po ldog pa na 'brel pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i nges pa ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the five valid cognitions, which are not the nature and cause of this cognition, are reversed, the ascertainment of omniscience and so on, which are unrelated, are not reversed.

original: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, we think that there is not the slightest valid cognition that contradicts omniscience.

original: 'di snyam du khyed cag gis rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du khyed cag gis rjes su dpag pa nyid du brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThe non-observation that you call inference itself contradicts omniscience,‚Äù

original: 'di kho bo cag la tshad ma gzhan gyis ci zhes bya snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di kho bo cag la tshad ma gzhan gyis ci zhes bya snyam du sems na /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúWhat need do we have for another valid cognition?‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa ni bden te 'on kyang 'dir ci khyod kyis rang gi dmigs pa ldog pa thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la mi dmigs par 'dod dam 'on te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa ni bden te 'on kyang 'dir ci khyod kyis rang gi dmigs pa ldog pa thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la mi dmigs par 'dod dam 'on te /
translated: It is true that non-observation is not a valid cognition, but here we ask, do you assert that non-observation proves that the cessation of your own observation is the absence of omniscience,

original: skyes bu thams cad kyis dmigs pa ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad kyis dmigs pa ldog par 'gyur /
translated: or do you assert that the cessation of the observation of all persons is the absence of omniscience?

original: rang gi mi dmigs pa la yang ci dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par la mi rten pa'i phyir khyad par med pa mngon par 'dod dam /
analyzed: rang gi mi dmigs pa la yang ci dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par la mi rten pa'i phyir khyad par med pa mngon par 'dod dam /
translated: In the case of your own non-observation, do you assert that it is a nonobservation of the special object, or do you assert that it is a nonobservation of the special subject?

original: 'on te khyad par dang bcas pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /üîΩde la re zhig rang gi mi dmigs pa khyad par med pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la tshad mar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te khyad par dang bcas pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste / de la re zhig rang gi mi dmigs pa khyad par med pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la tshad mar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, is it qualified? This must be analyzed.

original: de ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te tsam smos pa ni /
analyzed: de ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te tsam smos pa ni /
translated: First, it is not reasonable to take one‚Äôs own nonapprehension, which is not distinguished, as valid knowledge in the proof of the nonexistence of the Omniscient One.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable to infer nonexistence from mere nonapprehension,‚Äù and so on. The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù is used to eliminate the distinction ‚Äúin terms of the characteristic of nonapprehension.‚Äù

original: med par nges pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa med par mi nges pa'o //
analyzed: med par nges pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa med par mi nges pa'o //
translated: And it is not ascertained as nonexistent, that is, it is not ascertained as not existing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdngos po rnams la ste /üîΩdngos @283a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po rnams la ste / dngos @283a * //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it is not reasonable to apprehend an object that is a thing

original: po'i yul la dmigs pa rgyu dang khyad par byed pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: po'i yul la dmigs pa rgyu dang khyad par byed pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: as a cause or as a qualifier.

original: shing sha pa nyid kyi shing bzhin du tshu rol mthong ba'i dmigs pa ni dngos po rnams kyi khyad par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shing sha pa nyid kyi shing bzhin du tshu rol mthong ba'i dmigs pa ni dngos po rnams kyi khyad par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference of things is not due to the object of perception of the present, like the difference of the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: dngos po yod na yang yul la sogs pas bskal pa la mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod na yang yul la sogs pas bskal pa la mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even if the thing exists, it is possible that it is not perceived due to the remoteness of the object, etc.

original: du ba'i me bzhin du rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba'i me bzhin du rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the cause, like fire of smoke,

original: dngos po rnams nyid dmigs pa la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams nyid dmigs pa la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thing itself is the cause of perception.

original: rgyu ma yin pa dang khyad par byed par gyur pa ma yin pa gzhan log pa na gzhan ldog pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa dang khyad par byed par gyur pa ma yin pa gzhan log pa na gzhan ldog pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that when another, which is not the cause and which is not the difference, ceases, another ceases.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurdity.

original: gang yang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa bshad pa de ni rgyu tsam gyi med pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa bshad pa de ni rgyu tsam gyi med pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And that non-perception of effect which was mentioned does not cause the understanding of the mere non-existence of the cause.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: nus pa thogs pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: It causes the understanding of the mere non-existence of the unobstructed potency.

original: gang gis de log pa na dngos po rnams kyi med pa sgrub par byed pa tshu rol mthong ba'i dmigs pa la dngos po rnams nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de log pa na dngos po rnams kyi med pa sgrub par byed pa tshu rol mthong ba'i dmigs pa la dngos po rnams nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: When that is reversed, the non-existence of things is established.  The capacity of things to be perceived by those who see only the near side is not obstructed.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po med pa dang log pa na yang ji ltar gzhan ldog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po med pa dang log pa na yang ji ltar gzhan ldog pa yin zhe na /
translated: When the cause and the pervader are non-existent and reversed, how can the other be reversed?

original: 'dir rgyu dang khyab byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu dang khyab byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, he says, ‚ÄúThe cause, the pervader, etc.‚Äù

original: gang la rgyu yod pa de ni rgyu dang ldan pa ste 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la rgyu yod pa de ni rgyu dang ldan pa ste 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has a cause is endowed with a cause, which means it is an effect.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa dang khyad par byed pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar la /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa dang khyad par byed pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar la /
translated: The cause is endowed with and the distinction is made by.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa dang khyab par byed pa de dag ldog pa rigs pa yin no zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa dang khyab par byed pa de dag ldog pa rigs pa yin no zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The cause is endowed with and the pervader is reversed.  This is connected to the previous.

original: 'di la rgyu ni de las byung phyir gcig yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni de las byung phyir gcig yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the cause is one because it arises from that.

original: rgyu ldog pa na rgyu dang ldan pa log ste rgyu de las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ldog pa na rgyu dang ldan pa log ste rgyu de las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: When the cause is eliminated, that which possesses the cause is eliminated, because it arises from that cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po thob pa'i phyir dper na me ldog pa na du ba ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po thob pa'i phyir dper na me ldog pa na du ba ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when fire is eliminated, smoke is eliminated, because the thing obtains its status through possessing a cause.

original: de bzhin du khyab par byed pa ldog pa na khyab par bya ba ldog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab par byed pa ldog pa na khyab par bya ba ldog ste /
translated: Similarly, when the pervader is eliminated, the pervaded is eliminated,

original: khyab par byed pa de dang lhan cig yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgcig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de dang lhan cig yin pa'i phyir ro // gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is simultaneous with the pervader.

original: dper na shing log pa na aa mra la sogs pa ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing log pa na aa mra la sogs pa ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a tree is eliminated, an amra fruit and so on are eliminated, because they are the same nature.

original: shing gi khyad par nyid aa mra la sogs par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi khyad par nyid aa mra la sogs par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference of a tree is renowned as an amra fruit and so on.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it is not so,

original: gal te rgyu log pa na yang mi @283b ldog na de rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu log pa na yang mi @283b ldog na de rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: if it is not eliminated even when the cause is eliminated, it would not be the cause.

original: gang zhig gang med kyang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang med kyang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is illogical that that which arises even when something does not exist is the cause of that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a gross error.

original: gang log kyang gad mi ldog pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang log kyang gad mi ldog pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that even if anything is reversed, that is its nature.

original: ba men gyis ba lang bzhin no //üîΩde lta bas na rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba ldog pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba men gyis ba lang bzhin no // de lta bas na rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba ldog pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is like a cow and a gayal.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when a cause or a pervader is reversed, the effect and the pervaded are reversed, but not the other way around, because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be reversed.

original: ji skad du /üîΩde phyir de tsam dang 'brel ba'i //
analyzed: ji skad du / de phyir de tsam dang 'brel ba'i //
translated: As it has been said:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo nyid //
translated: Therefore, the nature of that which is related to that

original: ldog par 'gyur ba'am rgyu yis kyang //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ba'am rgyu yis kyang //
translated: is reversed, or else the cause

original: 'bras bu 'khrul pa med phyir ro //üîΩde lta min na gcig log pas //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'khrul pa med phyir ro // de lta min na gcig log pas //
translated: would not be mistaken with regard to the effect.üîΩIf it were not so, then how could the reversal of one

original: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur //üîΩmi la rta mi bdog ces te //üîΩphyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur // mi la rta mi bdog ces te // phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci //
translated: cause the reversal of another?üîΩIs it not the case that when a man does not own a horse

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: he also does not own cattle?

original: ci ste yang rang gi dmigs pa don thams cad la rgyu nyid dang khyab par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe dam bca' bar rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste yang rang gi dmigs pa don thams cad la rgyu nyid dang khyab par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe dam bca' bar rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if one does accept that the object of observation is the cause and the pervader of all objects, then at that time, the thesis would contradict one‚Äôs own words.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, it says,

original: ma lus pa'i don dag la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i don dag la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to all objects.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni nges pa la ltos nas drug pa'i dmigs pa dang don dag la zhes bya ba ni drug pa dang bdun pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni nges pa la ltos nas drug pa'i dmigs pa dang don dag la zhes bya ba ni drug pa dang bdun pa gnyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose causes and pervaders‚Äù refers to the sixth and seventh terms, ‚Äúthe object of observation‚Äù and ‚Äúthe object.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag / ces bya ba 'di la ltos nas go rims bzhin du 'brel pa dang yul gyi dngos por sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag / ces bya ba 'di la ltos nas go rims bzhin du 'brel pa dang yul gyi dngos por sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In reliance on ‚Äúthose causes and pervaders,‚Äù they are respectively applied as the related object and the object-field.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gal te re zhig tshad ma 'ga' zhig las rang gi dmigs pa'i don thams cad la rgyu nyid dang khyab par byed pa nyid du nges pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te re zhig tshad ma 'ga' zhig las rang gi dmigs pa'i don thams cad la rgyu nyid dang khyab par byed pa nyid du nges pa de'i tshe /
translated: If one were to ascertain that some valid cognition is the cause and the pervader of all objects of observation,

original: khyod kyis bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gsal rab tu dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gsal rab tu dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: You are clearly committed to the position that you are omniscient.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i shes pa ni shes bya ma lus pa las khyab par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i shes pa ni shes bya ma lus pa las khyab par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: The consciousness of one who is not omniscient does not pervade all objects of knowledge.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la yang sgrub par byed pa nye bar len pa'i phyir de nyid 'gegs pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo //üîΩde ltar re zhig khyab par byed pa med pa'i rang gi mi dmigs pa ni thams cad @284a * //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la yang sgrub par byed pa nye bar len pa'i phyir de nyid 'gegs pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo // de ltar re zhig khyab par byed pa med pa'i rang gi mi dmigs pa ni thams cad @284a * //
translated: And in the proof that there is no omniscience, the proof itself is the object to be established, and so it is refuted. Thus, you contradict yourself.

original: mkhyen pa med par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhyen pa med par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the nonobservation of something that is a pervader is not suitable to be stated as a proof that there is no omniscience.

original: dmigs pa mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis khyad par dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis khyad par dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of the nonobservation of the characteristic‚Äù is not even a specific instance of a general statement that includes specific instances.

original: 'di ltar de ston pa na yang dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes rang gi sgras ston na thams cad mkhyen pa med pa sgrub pa la yang 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'di ltar de ston pa na yang dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes rang gi sgras ston na thams cad mkhyen pa med pa sgrub pa la yang 'gyur ro
translated: In this way, when the non-existence of the omniscient one is taught, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúA pot does not exist in some specific place because it is not observed, having the characteristic of being observed.‚Äù If it is taught by its own words, it would also prove the non-existence of the omniscient one.

original: // yang na dper na 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // yang na dper na 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúHere smoke does not exist because fire does not exist.‚Äù

original: shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu don gzhan de'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa med par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu don gzhan de'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa med par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or, ‚ÄúA ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree does not exist because a tree does not exist.‚Äù In that case, it is because the non-existence of the cause of that object and the pervader of that object is seen, having the characteristic of being observed.

original: 'brel med pa rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa ma yin par gyur pa gzhan log pa na gzhan nges par ldog par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel med pa rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa ma yin par gyur pa gzhan log pa na gzhan nges par ldog par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: When another unrelated object that is not a cause and is not a pervader is eliminated, it is not logical for another to be ascertained as eliminated.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Because it would lead to a great absurdity. This was explained earlier.

original: rang gi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa ma nges pa'i don rgyu dang khyab par byed pa log pa las ldog par grub pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir des na de la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i khyab pa la bsten
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ldog pa ma nges pa'i don rgyu dang khyab par byed pa log pa las ldog par grub pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir des na de la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i khyab pa la bsten
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot ascertained as the reversal of its cause or pervader‚Äù is not established from the reversal of its cause or pervader. Therefore, in that case, one should rely on the pervasion that is called ‚Äúhaving the characteristic of observation.‚Äù

original: par bya'o // de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par bya'o // de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would also be omniscience.

original: yang na don gzhan du gyur pa dngos dang brgyud pas 'gal ba nyid grub pa las de dag 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don gzhan du gyur pa dngos dang brgyud pas 'gal ba nyid grub pa las de dag 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Or, it is established that the other object is directly or indirectly contradictory, but they are not contradictory,

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they occur together.

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dngos su 'gal ba'i me bsgrub pa las grang ba'i reg pa 'gegs pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa 'gegs pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dngos su 'gal ba'i me bsgrub pa las grang ba'i reg pa 'gegs pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa 'gegs pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like the establishment of fire that is directly contradictory, where it is said, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because fire exists.‚Äù In the same way, it would be the refutation of omniscience.

original: yang na brgyud pas kyang res 'ga' 'gal ba ni de'i khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba bsgrubs pas thams cad mkhyen pa 'gegs te /
analyzed: yang na brgyud pas kyang res 'ga' 'gal ba ni de'i khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba bsgrubs pas thams cad mkhyen pa 'gegs te /
translated: Or, indirectly, sometimes a contradiction is established by establishing the contradiction with the pervader of that.

original: dper na ba mo'i reg pa'i khyab par byed pa grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me bsgrub pa las pa mo'i reg pa 'gegs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba mo'i reg pa'i khyab par byed pa grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me bsgrub pa las pa mo'i reg pa 'gegs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, by establishing fire, which is the opposite of cold, the pervader of the sensation of cold, the sensation of cold is refuted.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dper na ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa dang @284b 'gal ba gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag bsgrub pa las grang ba'i 'bras bu spu long byed pa la sogs pa 'gegs pa bzhin du de'i rgyu 'gal ba
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dper na ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa dang @284b 'gal ba gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag bsgrub pa las grang ba'i 'bras bu spu long byed pa la sogs pa 'gegs pa bzhin du de'i rgyu 'gal ba
translated: Or, in one way, just as the result of cold, the sensation of cold, is refuted by establishing the particular thing that burns, which is the opposite of the sensation of cold, the cause of goose bumps and so on, by establishing the contradiction with its cause,

original: bsgrubs pas sam /
analyzed: bsgrubs pas sam /
translated: the contradiction with the result is established.

original: yang na dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig tu grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i me la sogs pa'i 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa las grang ba'i reg pa 'gegs pa bzhin du de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu bsgrubs pa
analyzed: yang na dper na phyogs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig tu grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i me la sogs pa'i 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa las grang ba'i reg pa 'gegs pa bzhin du de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu bsgrubs pa
translated: Or, for example, just as the result of fire, such as smoke, which is incompatible with cold contact in some specific direction is established and cold contact is refuted,üîΩthe result of that which is incompatible with cold contact is established.

original: las sam / yang na dper na spu long la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me'i 'bras bu du ba mthong ba'i phyir spu long la sogs pa 'gegs pa yin te /
analyzed: las sam / yang na dper na spu long la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba dang 'gal ba'i me'i 'bras bu du ba mthong ba'i phyir spu long la sogs pa 'gegs pa yin te /
translated: Or, for example, just as the result of fire, such as smoke, which is incompatible with the cause of shivering is seen, shivering is refuted.

original: phyogs 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i mi dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu de'i rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa las yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs 'di na du ba yod pa'i phyir spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i mi dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu de'i rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa las yin nam /
translated: Because smoke exists in this direction, a person who possesses shivering and so on is not possessed by ghosts.

original: yang na dper na nges par 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba nges par 'gyur ba med pa'i khyab par bya ba'i ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid bsgrubs pas nges par 'gyur ba nyid 'gegs pa bzhin du de dang 'gal bas khyab pa bsgrub pa las yin zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: yang na dper na nges par 'gyur ba dang 'gal ba nges par 'gyur ba med pa'i khyab par bya ba'i ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid bsgrubs pas nges par 'gyur ba nyid 'gegs pa bzhin du de dang 'gal bas khyab pa bsgrub pa las yin zhes bya ba'i
translated: Or, just as the proof of the pervasion of the absence of the definite occurrence of the opposite by the definite occurrence of the opposite is the negation of the definite occurrence of the opposite, so too, it is from the proof of the pervasion by the opposite.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba 'di thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa la srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba 'di thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa la srid pa ma yin te /
translated: This syllogism of non-apprehension is not possible in any proof of omniscience,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de rtag tu dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de rtag tu dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because omniscience is not always of the nature of the object of apprehension.

original: 'di thams cad mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di thams cad mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is all a division of non-apprehension, he says,

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù is because of the consequence of contradicting one‚Äôs own words.

original: khyed cag gi thams cad mkhyen par rang nyid kyis dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par khas blang bar mi bya ste ;
analyzed: khyed cag gi thams cad mkhyen par rang nyid kyis dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par khas blang bar mi bya ste ;
translated: You should not accept that the omniscient one is characterized by the object of observation,

original: de lta yin dang rang nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rang nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: because if that were the case, you would accept that he is omniscient.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩgal te khyed la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / gal te khyed la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How so?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúIf you also have a consciousness that has all objects as its object,‚Äù

original: gal te khyed cag la yang don thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa can yin na /üîΩde @285a * //
analyzed: gal te khyed cag la yang don thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa can yin na / de @285a * //
translated: if you also have a consciousness that has all objects as its object,

original: lta na khyed la thams cad mkhyen pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lta na khyed la thams cad mkhyen pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: then in that case, you would have the omniscient one characterized by the object of observation, but not otherwise,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod yul du thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod yul du thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is not the case that the object of activity of the non-omniscient one becomes omniscient.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag la thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag la thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin mod /
translated: You might think, ‚ÄúWe do not have the omniscient one characterized by the object of observation,üîΩbut we have the omniscient one characterized by the object of activity.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang ci'i phyir de med par bsgrub par bya ba la mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba 'di dag mi srid snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci'i phyir de med par bsgrub par bya ba la mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba 'di dag mi srid snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúWhy is it impossible to prove that it does not exist by this application of non-observation?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: gang gi phyir khyed la thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang / rang bzhin ma mthong ba'i khyad par la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma dmigs pa mi 'grub te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed la thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang / rang bzhin ma mthong ba'i khyad par la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma dmigs pa mi 'grub te /
translated: Because for you, the omniscient one is not the cause, the pervader, or the nature that is observed as the characteristic of the object of observation. The non-observation of that is not established.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba dang po gsum ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba dang po gsum ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the first three applications‚Äîthe non-observation of the nature, the cause, and the pervader‚Äîare not established.

original: de lta na 'o na khyad par gzhan dag grub pa de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa med par grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na khyad par gzhan dag grub pa de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa med par grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then even though other attributes are established, omniscience is established as nonexistent.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rnam gsum 'di //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rnam gsum 'di //
translated: Non-observation is threefold.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid spros na rnam pa mang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid spros na rnam pa mang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one elaborates on just these three types of non-observation of the nature, cause, and pervader that have just been explained, there are many types.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de dang de 'gal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dang de 'gal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat which is incompatible with that . . .‚Äù

original: de'i sgras ni skabs su bab pa'i rang bzhin dang khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu zhes bya ba gsum dang 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni skabs su bab pa'i rang bzhin dang khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu zhes bya ba gsum dang 'brel par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the three: nature, pervader, and cause, which are relevant to the present context.

original: rang bzhin la sogs pa de dang 'gal ba ni de dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pa de dang 'gal ba ni de dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: That which is incompatible with those natures and so on is incompatible with them.

original: de yang rang bzhin dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it becomes three types by the specific types of incompatibility with nature, pervader, and cause.

original: de dang 'gal ba dang po gang la yod pa de ni de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba dang po gang la yod pa de ni de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which has the first type of incompatibility with that is called ‚Äúincompatible with that‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang 'gal bas khyab pa gsum gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang 'gal bas khyab pa gsum gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the three: the effect that is contradictory with the cause, the cause that is contradictory with the effect, and the pervader that is contradictory with the pervaded.

original: yang de'i sgra gnyis @285b pas rang bzhin la sogs pa gsum po de nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang de'i sgra gnyis @285b pas rang bzhin la sogs pa gsum po de nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be applied to those three, nature and so on.

original: de ni de yang yin la de dang 'gal ba yin pas de dang de 'gal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni de yang yin la de dang 'gal ba yin pas de dang de 'gal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is because they are that and contradictory with that, and thus they are called ‚Äúcontradictory with that‚Äù and so on.

original: go rims bzhin du de dag ma rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ni de 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du de dag ma rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ni de 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: In order, not understanding that and understanding that and contradictory with that and so on are understanding that and not understanding that and contradictory with that and so on.

original: de ma rtogs pa dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa dang de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of not understanding that and understanding that and contradictory with that and so on.

original: de dag gi dbye ba ni de'i sgo nas dbye ba zhes bya bar bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba ni de'i sgo nas dbye ba zhes bya bar bsdu'o //
translated: Their divisions are subsumed by the phrase ‚Äútheir divisions through that.‚Äù

original: de la ma rtogs pas dngos su rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa la mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum bstan la /
analyzed: de la ma rtogs pas dngos su rang bzhin dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa la mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum bstan la /
translated: With respect to that, not understanding that directly teaches the three types of nonobservation of nature, cause, and the pervader.

original: mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid kyis mi dmigs pa lhag ma rnams brgyud nas ston par byed pa yin pas 'di dag gi rtsa ba'i dbye ba'i ngo bo mi dmigs pas rnam pa gsum yin no //üîΩde 'di ltar de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa rang bzhin dang 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid kyis mi dmigs pa lhag ma rnams brgyud nas ston par byed pa yin pas 'di dag gi rtsa ba'i dbye ba'i ngo bo mi dmigs pas rnam pa gsum yin no // de 'di ltar de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa rang bzhin dang 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: Since these three types of non-observation also indirectly indicate the remaining types of non-observation, the root types of non-observation are three in number.üîΩThis is how the three types of non-observation are explained: the observation of a contradictory object, the observation of a contradictory nature, the observation of a contradictory pervader, and the observation of a contradictory cause.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the observation of a contradictory effect, the observation of an effect that is contradictory with its cause, and the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: 'di dag gis kyang brgyud nas ci rigs par rang bzhin dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa rnams mtshon pa yin pa de'i phyir rtsa ba'i dbye ba gsum gyi ngo bo rnam pa gsum thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la nus pa med par bstan pa'i phyir de'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnams 'bad pa med par de stonüîΩpar byed pa yin pas 'di dag logs shig tu nus pa med par bstan pa'i phyir 'bad pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang brgyud nas ci rigs par rang bzhin dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa rnams mtshon pa yin pa de'i phyir rtsa ba'i dbye ba gsum gyi ngo bo rnam pa gsum thams cad mkhyen pa med par bsgrub pa la nus pa med par bstan pa'i phyir de'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnams 'bad pa med par de ston par byed pa yin pas 'di dag logs shig tu nus pa med par bstan pa'i phyir 'bad pa mi bya ste /
translated: These also indirectly illustrate the three types of nonobservation of a cause, the three types of nonobservation of a pervader, and the three types of nonobservation of a nature. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the three types of root evidence are incapable of proving the nonexistence of an omniscient being, the three types of branch evidence are effortlessly demonstrated.

original: rtsa ba chad pa na yal ga rnams gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba chad pa na yal ga rnams gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one should not make an effort to demonstrate the incapability of these three types of branch evidence separately, because when the root is cut, the branches do not remain.

original: don dam par ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the nonobservation of a nature is the only root of all of these,

original: nang gses kyi dbye ba la brten pa'i phyir @286a * //
analyzed: nang gses kyi dbye ba la brten pa'i phyir @286a * //
translated: because the other two types of nonobservation are subcategories of it.

original: rnam pa gsum rtsa ba nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum rtsa ba nyid du brjod do //
translated: Therefore the three types of nonobservation are called the roots.

original: gal te 'di snyam du thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i khyad par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du thams cad mkhyen pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i khyad par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that omniscience is not characterized by perception, then nonperception is not established as a distinct characteristic.

original: de'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i khyad par de ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i khyad par de ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Why is that nonperception not established as a distinct characteristic? Because its cause and its pervader are characterized by perception.

original: de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is incompatible with it and so on are of the nature of perception.

original: ci'i phyir / dmigs pa 'grub par mi 'gyur snyam du sems /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / dmigs pa 'grub par mi 'gyur snyam du sems / rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why do you think that perception is not established?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúCause and effect, etc.,‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid dang zhes zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid dang zhes zlas dbye'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCause and effect,‚Äù ‚Äúpervaded and pervader,‚Äù and ‚Äúincompatibility‚Äù are to be construed as a pair.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin na thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni mi snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin na thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni mi snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no
translated: The relation of cause and effect is established by perception and non-apprehension, but omniscience and so on are not perceptible, so the relation of cause and effect is not established in regard to them.

original: // khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: // khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the relation of pervaded and pervader,

original: de la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that case, non-apprehension, which has the characteristic of the object of apprehension, would have to precede.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig log pa na gang nges par ldog pa ni des khyab par bstan la /üîΩldog pa yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa med par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig log pa na gang nges par ldog pa ni des khyab par bstan la / ldog pa yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa med par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one is absent, the other is ascertained to be absent, and that shows the pervasion.üîΩAnd absence is not established without non-apprehension, which has the characteristic of the object of apprehension.

original: 'gal ba yang snang du rung ba dag kho na la grub par 'gyur gyi mi snang ba dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang snang du rung ba dag kho na la grub par 'gyur gyi mi snang ba dag ni ma yin te /
translated: And contradiction is established only in regard to what is perceptible, not in regard to what is not perceptible.

original: 'di ltar re zhig lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ni rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir rtogs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ni rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba la gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir rtogs te /
translated: Thus, the contradiction of non-coexistence is understood in the case of the arising of an effect when the cause is not incomplete, because when the other exists, it does not exist.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po yod pa dang med pa dag nges par nus so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po yod pa dang med pa dag nges par nus so //
translated: The existence and nonexistence of things can be ascertained by the nature of non-apprehension.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yang gang yongs su gcod pa gang zhig rnam par bcad pa pa med na mi 'byung ba de dag la rnam par gzhag @286b ste /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yang gang yongs su gcod pa gang zhig rnam par bcad pa pa med na mi 'byung ba de dag la rnam par gzhag @286b ste /
translated: The contradiction of mutually exclusive identity is also established in the case of any determination that is invariably concomitant with the exclusion of another.

original: rim dang rim ma yin pa dag lta bu yin la /
analyzed: rim dang rim ma yin pa dag lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, sequential and non-sequential.

original: yongs su gcod pa yang mi snang ba dag la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa yang mi snang ba dag la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But determination is not possible in the case of non-appearances.

original: gal te de lta na yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur ste /
translated: If that is so, how can existence and nonexistence, etc., be contradictory?

original: de la gnyi ga snang du rung ba nyid du grub pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnyi ga snang du rung ba nyid du grub pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not established that both can appear there.

original: nyes pa 'di med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag logs shig tu yongs su bcad nas phyis de dag rnam par gcad par bya ba dang / rnam par gcod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir gsal bar rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag logs shig tu yongs su bcad nas phyis de dag rnam par gcad par bya ba dang / rnam par gcod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir gsal bar rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not to be posited as mutually exclusive, because they are the objects of exclusion and the excluder, after having separately determined existence and nonexistence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what are they?

original: logs shig tu yongs su gcod pa dag la'o //
analyzed: logs shig tu yongs su gcod pa dag la'o //
translated: They are the separate determinations.

original: 'di ltar chos can gcig la dus gcig tu de dag 'gal bar rnam par gzhag gi / chos can gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos can gcig la dus gcig tu de dag 'gal bar rnam par gzhag gi / chos can gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, they are posited as mutually exclusive in regard to one and the same substratum at one and the same time, but not in regard to different substrata.

original: ba lang med pa la rta yod pa la ni 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: ba lang med pa la rta yod pa la ni 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: For there is not the slightest contradiction in the existence of a horse in the absence of a cow.

original: chos can gcig la dus tha dad du de dag 'gal ba yang ma yin te sngar yod pa'am med pa ni phyis med pa'am yod par mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can gcig la dus tha dad du de dag 'gal ba yang ma yin te sngar yod pa'am med pa ni phyis med pa'am yod par mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they mutually exclusive in regard to one and the same substratum at different times, because it is not impossible that what was existent or nonexistent previously is nonexistent or existent later.

original: dngos po gcig la de dag cig car yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir 'gal gyi de nyid du yongs su mi gcod pa dang rnam par mi gcod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la de dag cig car yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir 'gal gyi de nyid du yongs su mi gcod pa dang rnam par mi gcod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because they do not simultaneously eliminate that in one entity, they are contradictory. But they are not contradictory because they do not eliminate and do not distinguish that in reality.

original: yongs su mi gcod pa ji ltar rnam par mi gcod ce na /
analyzed: yongs su mi gcod pa ji ltar rnam par mi gcod ce na /
translated: How is non-elimination a non-distinction?

original: de nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because of that.

original: gang kho na la chos can de la yongs su mi gcod pa de kho na las de rnam par gcod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang kho na la chos can de la yongs su mi gcod pa de kho na las de rnam par gcod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: That which is not eliminated in that entity is distinguished from that.

original: de lta bu ma yin na de las yongs su gcod pa'i chos ji ltar rnam par gcad par bya bar nus /üîΩde med par rnam par gcod pa gang yin pa 'di nyid de yongs su gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin na de las yongs su gcod pa'i chos ji ltar rnam par gcad par bya bar nus / de med par rnam par gcod pa gang yin pa 'di nyid de yongs su gcod pa yin la /
translated: If it were not so, how could the property of elimination be distinguished from that which is to be distinguished?üîΩThat which is distinguished as the absence of that is itself the elimination of that.

original: gang kho na gzhan gyis dben pa de yongs su gcod pa de nyid de la gzhan med pa yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang kho na gzhan gyis dben pa de yongs su gcod pa de nyid de la gzhan med pa yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: That which is distinguished as the absence of that which is isolated from something else is itself the elimination of the absence of that in that.

original: de lta bas na chos can gang gi dngos po med pa rnam par gcod pa dang dngos po yongs su gcod pa 'di gdon mi za bar snang bar khas blang bar bya ste /üîΩmi snang ba ni yongs su gcad par bya ba ma yin la yongs su ma bcad pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i chos rnam par @287a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos can gang gi dngos po med pa rnam par gcod pa dang dngos po yongs su gcod pa 'di gdon mi za bar snang bar khas blang bar bya ste / mi snang ba ni yongs su gcad par bya ba ma yin la yongs su ma bcad pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i chos rnam par @287a * //
translated: Therefore, you must admit that the non-existence of the non-entity of any subject is perceived, and that the entity is ascertained.

original: gcod pa srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gcod pa srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That which is not perceived is not ascertained, and that which is not ascertained cannot exclude a property that is incompatible with it.

original: gang gi de dag la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa yongs su gcod pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par gcod par grub par 'gyur ba chos can skyes bu thams cad 'ga' zhig la snang ba ni ma yin te /üîΩde nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi de dag la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa yongs su gcod pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par gcod par grub par 'gyur ba chos can skyes bu thams cad 'ga' zhig la snang ba ni ma yin te / de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no subject, any person, whatsoever, in whom these two are perceived, because if they were perceived, it would follow, absurdly, that he was omniscient.

original: de'i phyir chos can mi dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid dag 'gal bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can mi dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid dag 'gal bar mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, since the subject is not perceived, it is not established that omniscience and non-omniscience are mutually exclusive.

original: rang gi rgyu la ni grub ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la ni grub ste /
translated: It is established in its own cause.

original: de la yang ma 'ongs ba'i gnas skabs la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang ma 'ongs ba'i gnas skabs la ni ma yin te /
translated: And that is not in the future state,

original: de ni da lta mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni da lta mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived in the present.

original: de lta bas na snang ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na snang ba nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the established conclusion: the appearance itself is established as the entity of cause and effect.

original: gang gi bdag nyid khyad par bcas //
analyzed: gang gi bdag nyid khyad par bcas //
translated: That which is associated with a distinction

original: zhes bya ba ni grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: is established.

original: de la bdag nyid ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthat which‚Äù refers to the entity.

original: khyad par dang lhan cig 'jug pas na khyad par bcas so //
analyzed: khyad par dang lhan cig 'jug pas na khyad par bcas so //
translated: It is ‚Äúassociated with a distinction‚Äù because it operates together with a distinction.

original: de la khyad par ni skal pa rnam pa gsum dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la khyad par ni skal pa rnam pa gsum dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Here, a distinction is the absence of the three kinds of similarity.

original: des na mi dmigs pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthese nonapprehensions‚Äù are the nonapprehensions of cause, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang 'gal ba dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na yang la lar res 'ga' mngon sum nyid du ma grub pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang 'gal ba dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na yang la lar res 'ga' mngon sum nyid du ma grub pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Omniscience is not established as a thing that is the cause and effect of something, nor as the pervaded and pervader, because it is not established as direct perception even when there is another existent cause.

original: dgag pa'i yan lag gzhan yang med //
analyzed: dgag pa'i yan lag gzhan yang med //
translated: There is no other part of the negation.

original: ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i khyad par ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i khyad par ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: This means that there is no other part of non-apprehension.

original: gzhan yang khyad par med pa'i rang gi mi dmigs pa sbyor ba na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba thog tu bab pa'i sgo nas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par med pa'i rang gi mi dmigs pa sbyor ba na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba thog tu bab pa'i sgo nas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, when one applies one's own non-apprehension without distinction, it is demonstrated to be uncertain by the consequence that is directly applicable.

original: gal te ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one says, I do not see, and so on.

original: ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras pha ma'i dga' ba nyams su myong ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras pha ma'i dga' ba nyams su myong ba gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase taking a bride, and so on, includes the experience of the parents' pleasure.

original: de lta yin dang khyod @287b nal phrug nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyod @287b nal phrug nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, you would be a mere child.

original: ji skad du gal te 'dir khyed cag gi mig rdul gyis ma dmigs pas don spong bar byed na /
analyzed: ji skad du gal te 'dir khyed cag gi mig rdul gyis ma dmigs pas don spong bar byed na /
translated: As it is said, if you reject objects because you do not perceive them with your eyes covered with film,

original: pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yang mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu khyod nyid nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yang mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu khyod nyid nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: then you would lose your own position, because it would follow that the reason for the convention of cause and effect would not be engaged.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Here, the opponent‚Äôs response is anticipated:üîΩThe response to that is stated in the following:

original: rgyur brjod pa de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur brjod pa de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reason is stated to be the effect of that.

original: ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i phyir rgyu de med par thal bar 'gyur pa de mi dmigs pas grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i phyir rgyu de med par thal bar 'gyur pa de mi dmigs pas grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the reason for the convention of the effect of that is established by the valid knowledge of inference, the consequence that the cause does not exist is not established by the nonobservation of that.üîΩThe response to that is stated in the following:

original: de med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the following:

original: de med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de med ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat does not exist‚Äù means

original: ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa de med par ro //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa de med par ro //
translated: that the taking of a wife and so on does not exist.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,üîΩsince the effect, the son, is observed, namely, a son born from a woman who has intercourse with a man other than her husband, in the same way, your mother would also be like that.

original: gang la ma bag mar phyin pa de dang dga' ba nyams su myong ba med par bud med g-yem ma 'ga' zhig skyes bu gzhan dang phrad par bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pas de bzhin du khyod kyi ma la yang 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa
analyzed: gang la ma bag mar phyin pa de dang dga' ba nyams su myong ba med par bud med g-yem ma 'ga' zhig skyes bu gzhan dang phrad par bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pas de bzhin du khyod kyi ma la yang 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa
translated: Therefore, the inference

original: ma grub po //
analyzed: ma grub po //
translated: is not established.

original: de lta yin dang khyod nal phrug tu thal bar bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyod nal phrug tu thal bar bzlog par dka'o //
translated: If that were so, it would be hard to avoid the conclusion that you are a bastard.

original: slob dpon chos kyi grags pas kyang khyad par can gyi pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir nal phrug nyid thal bar 'gyur ba kho na mdzad do //
analyzed: slob dpon chos kyi grags pas kyang khyad par can gyi pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan med par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir nal phrug nyid thal bar 'gyur ba kho na mdzad do //
translated: Also, the master Dharmakƒ´rti, wishing to state the absurd consequence that there would be no reason for the convention of ‚Äúdistinctive,‚Äù only states the absurd consequence that you would be a bastard.

original: gal te de ni gzhan dmigs pas //
analyzed: gal te de ni gzhan dmigs pas //
translated: If that is observed as other,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: and so on, he anticipates the response of others.

original: skyes bu gzhan dag gis dmigs pa ni gzhan dmigs pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan dag gis dmigs pa ni gzhan dmigs pas so //
translated: The object of other persons is different from the object of this one.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That refers to the taking of a maiden in marriage, etc.

original: de ni med par rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: de ni med par rtogs ma yin //
translated: It is not understood as nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba la 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, Well then, what?

original: yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: It is understood as existent.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis dmigs pa ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis dmigs pa ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the object of another is not established here,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, But if you say, etc.

original: ji ltar zhes dris pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes dris pa las /
translated: He asks, How?

original: gzhan gyis smras pa nye bar bsten phyir na //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa nye bar bsten phyir na //
translated: The other replies, Because of the teaching of the other.

original: zhes bya ba la grub ces skabs dang sbyar ro //üîΩha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nye bar bstan pa ma nges @288a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la grub ces skabs dang sbyar ro // ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nye bar bstan pa ma nges @288a * //
translated: The word established is supplied from the context.

original: par bstan par bya ba'i phyir //üîΩkun mkhyen la yang 'di cis med //
analyzed: par bstan par bya ba'i phyir // kun mkhyen la yang 'di cis med //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the teaching is indefinite because of the absurdity,

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, Why is this not so for the Omniscient One?

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, this refers to the teaching.

original: kun mkhyen la yang ci'i phyir med de 'on kyang yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: kun mkhyen la yang ci'i phyir med de 'on kyang yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Why is this not so for the Omniscient One? It is, rather, just so.

original: de la gal te ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa'i nye bar bstan pa tshad mar byed na thams cad mkhyen pa yod do zhes bya ba'i kho bo cag gis nye bar bstan pa 'di yang ci'i phyir tshad mar mi byed de khyad par med pa'i phyir
analyzed: de la gal te ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa'i nye bar bstan pa tshad mar byed na thams cad mkhyen pa yod do zhes bya ba'i kho bo cag gis nye bar bstan pa 'di yang ci'i phyir tshad mar mi byed de khyad par med pa'i phyir
translated: If you accept that the statement of a maiden‚Äôs marriage, etc. is valid, then why do you not accept that our statement ‚ÄúThe Omniscient One exists‚Äù is valid? There is no difference between them.

original: ro // gzhan yang rang gi tshig nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ro // gzhan yang rang gi tshig nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that the statement itself demonstrates that the statement is not valid.

original: skyes bu rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúPeople also say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig khyad par med pa ni ma nges pa'i phyir dang / khyad par dang bcas pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir rang gi dmigs pa log pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa la tshad mar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig khyad par med pa ni ma nges pa'i phyir dang / khyad par dang bcas pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir rang gi dmigs pa log pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa la tshad mar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, since the absence of a specific reason is inconclusive and since the presence of a specific reason is not established, it has already been demonstrated that the cessation of one‚Äôs own observation is not a valid means of knowledge for establishing the nonexistence of the Omniscient One.

original: da ni skyes bu thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa ma grub pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa la tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skyes bu thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa ma grub pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa la tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that since the object of all persons is not established, it is not reasonable to establish the nonexistence of an omniscient being by means of a valid cognition, he says:

original: yang na nye bar bstan 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na nye bar bstan 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or, this is taught by the valid cognition of all sentient beings.

original: nyer bstan zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ston par byed pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nyer bstan zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ston par byed pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Taught‚Äù means that which teaches an omniscient being.

original: yang na nye bar bstan pa 'di'i tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nye bar bstan pa 'di'i tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, this is taught by the valid cognition of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyis bdag mthong na //
analyzed: sems can kun gyis bdag mthong na //
translated: When all sentient beings see me,

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can kun gyi rang bzhin mthong ba ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can kun gyi rang bzhin mthong ba ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen all sentient beings see‚Äù means when they see the nature of all sentient beings.üîΩIf you say that we do not exist,

original: kho bo cag gi sems can thams cad kyis bdag mthong ba yod pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩde mthong ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi sems can thams cad kyis bdag mthong ba yod pa nyid do zhe na / de mthong ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhen all sentient beings see me,‚Äù and so on.

original: de mthong ba ni sems can thams cad kyis bdag mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba ni sems can thams cad kyis bdag mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú When they see‚Äù means when all sentient beings see the self.

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyis bdag mthong ba med na'o //
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyis bdag mthong ba med na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if all sentient beings did not see the self,

original: yod pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i dngos po'i yod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: yod pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i dngos po'i yod pa bzhin te /
translated: as if it existed, as if it were an existent thing that is separated from the object, etc.

original: yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is as if it existed.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /üîΩji ltar yul la sogs pas bskal ba'i dngos po mi dmigs pa yin na yang de yod par the tshom za ba bzhin du dngos po yod na yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir de ltar skyes bu gzhan la yod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul can la yang the
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te / ji ltar yul la sogs pas bskal ba'i dngos po mi dmigs pa yin na yang de yod par the tshom za ba bzhin du dngos po yod na yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir de ltar skyes bu gzhan la yod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul can la yang the
translated: This is the point that is taught.

original: tshom nyid du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshom nyid du rigs pa yin no //
translated: Just as, even though a thing that is separated from the object, etc. is not perceived, one doubts that it exists, in the same way, even though a thing exists, it is not perceived. Thus, it is reasonable to doubt the existence of the object of the omniscience of another person, just as it is reasonable to doubt the existence of the object of one‚Äôs own omniscience.

original: yang na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Or, the point is this.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs na yang thams cad mkhyen pa yod @288b pa la the tshom za ba de bzhin du dmigs na yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la the tshom bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs na yang thams cad mkhyen pa yod @288b pa la the tshom za ba de bzhin du dmigs na yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la the tshom bya ba yin te /
translated: Just as, even though it is not perceived, one doubts the existence of omniscience, in the same way, even though it is perceived, one should doubt the object of omniscience.

original: gnyis ka yang rang bzhin gyis bskal pas mi dmigs par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang rang bzhin gyis bskal pas mi dmigs par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are possible, since they are naturally separated.

original: 'on te dngos po yod pa la yang the tshom rig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po yod pa la yang the tshom rig pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there doubt about the existence of an entity?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po yod pa la de mi dmigs pa mthong ba'i phyir res 'ga' 'gyur ro snyam du srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po yod pa la de mi dmigs pa mthong ba'i phyir res 'ga' 'gyur ro snyam du srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that sometimes there is doubt about the existence of an entity, since one sees that it is not perceived.

original: tshu rol mthong ba 'ga' zhig la thams cad mkhyen pa srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba 'ga' zhig la thams cad mkhyen pa srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible that someone with limited vision is omniscient.

original: mi srid pa'i dngos po la rtogs pa dang ldan pa the tshom za bar rigs pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i dngos po la rtogs pa dang ldan pa the tshom za bar rigs pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And it is not reasonable to doubt that which is impossible.

original: 'ga' zhig kun mkhyen yin pa na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kun mkhyen yin pa na //
translated: ‚ÄúIf someone is omniscient,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy oneself‚Äù means

original: gzhan gyi grub mtha' khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //üîΩrang nyid ces bya ba bstan pa ni bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi grub mtha' khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no // rang nyid ces bya ba bstan pa ni bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that one should state it having accepted the tenets of another.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúby oneself‚Äù is ‚Äúby me.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúby one‚Äôs own self‚Äù is ‚Äúby a person.‚Äù

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni bdag ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni bdag ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù means that the self is by nature the essence of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid sgrub pa yin no //
translated: This very statement, ‚Äúbecause of that,‚Äù etc., is the proof.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the omniscient one.

original: gal te 'di snyam du tshu rol mthong ba rnams kho na thams cad kyis sgra brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du tshu rol mthong ba rnams kho na thams cad kyis sgra brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think that only those who see only a limited range of things want to express the word ‚Äúomniscient one,‚Äù but not the omniscient ones themselves,

original: des na dogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /üîΩde gcig yongs su dor ba la //
analyzed: des na dogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na / de gcig yongs su dor ba la //
translated: and therefore there is no problem,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúBut if you reject the omniscient one,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa de yongs su spangs nas tshu rol mthong ba gzhan dag gis mi dmigs pas gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa de yongs su spangs nas tshu rol mthong ba gzhan dag gis mi dmigs pas gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you reject the omniscient one and accept as the reason the fact that other limited perceivers do not perceive him, then it is not established for you.

original: de ni rang gi mi dmigs pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa med pa dang lhan cig med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mi dmigs pa bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa med pa dang lhan cig med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to omniscience, like the non-observation of itself, by the character of not being simultaneously present.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su mi shes phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su mi shes phyir //
translated: Because it is not known by others,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'brel pa med pa de nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'brel pa med pa de nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: and so on, prove that very lack of relation.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma ma nges pa nyid dang / ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma ma nges pa nyid dang / ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the so-called non-observation is indeterminate and unestablished.

original: da ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that this reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the nature of the object of the valid knowledge of non-existence,‚Äù is doubtful and unestablished,

original: tshu rol mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe one who sees only a part,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshu rol mthong ba mkhas pa'i blo can 'ga' zhig kyang res 'ga' rjes su dpag pa las thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs @289a * //
