analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba mkhas pa'i blo can 'ga' zhig kyang res 'ga' rjes su dpag pa las thams cad mkhyen pa rtogs @289a * //
translated: The one who sees only a part, even a wise one, sometimes understands omniscience from inference.

original: so zhes bya ba srid pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshig 'di the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: so zhes bya ba srid pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshig 'di the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is possible‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause the nature of the object is made by the valid knowledge of nonexistence‚Äù are uncertain and unestablished.

original: 'di ltar rig byed kyi sgra dang / dri dang / lus dang / rdo rje la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid la sogs par gsal rab kyang khyed cag spyod pa ba phyugs rnams kyis ma mtshon pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed kyi sgra dang / dri dang / lus dang / rdo rje la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid la sogs par gsal rab kyang khyed cag spyod pa ba phyugs rnams kyis ma mtshon pa na /
translated: In this way, the sounds of the Vedas, smells, bodies, vajras, and so on are clearly momentary, selfless, and so on, but you logicians do not perceive them.

original: kho bo cag gis sgrub par byed pa rten pa bstan pa'i sgo nas bsgrub pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa la gal te de ltar sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa de lta na yang srid pa'i phyir the tshom za bas de'i phyir tshad ma lnga
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sgrub par byed pa rten pa bstan pa'i sgo nas bsgrub pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa la gal te de ltar sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa de lta na yang srid pa'i phyir the tshom za bas de'i phyir tshad ma lnga
translated: Just as we establish the omniscient one by teaching the proof, in the same way, although the nonobservation of the proof is not perceived, because it is possible, there is doubt. Therefore the five valid knowledges

original: dang bral ba'i rnag bzhin gyi dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: dang bral ba'i rnag bzhin gyi dngos po med pa'i tshad mas yul du byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ma grub ste /
translated: are not established as the nature of the object made by the valid knowledge of nonexistence.

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of doubt.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni chad ma med pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni chad ma med pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In regard to what‚Äù means in regard to what is not interrupted.

original: gzhan yang tshu rol mthong ba thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa la rjes su dpag pa med du chug mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshu rol mthong ba thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa la rjes su dpag pa med du chug mod /
translated: Moreover, even if it is the case that there is no inference in regard to the proof of omniscience for all who see only this side,

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: still, the reason is not ascertained. In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: rjes su dpag pa med na yang //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med na yang //
translated: Even though there is no inference,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po'i rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa yang ma yin pa'i tshad ma de ji ltar 'di ldog pa na yang dngos po ldog par 'gyur zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa yang ma yin pa'i tshad ma de ji ltar 'di ldog pa na yang dngos po ldog par 'gyur zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: As was previously explained, how can a valid cognition that is neither the cause of an entity nor a pervader cause the cessation of an entity when it ceases?

original: 'di ltar lcags kyi gong bu'i me la sogs pa du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa khang pa'i nang gi phugs na gnas pa la rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mi skye la de'i yod pa yang mi ldog pa'i phyir med pa yang
analyzed: 'di ltar lcags kyi gong bu'i me la sogs pa du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa khang pa'i nang gi phugs na gnas pa la rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mi skye la de'i yod pa yang mi ldog pa'i phyir med pa yang
translated: Thus, in regard to the fire of a ball of iron and so on, the effect such as smoke does not arise, because there is no evidence for one who is situated in the interior of a house. The inference does not arise, and the existence of that is not averted. Therefore, the nonexistence of that is not ascertained.

original: mi nges pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa la rjes su dpog pa med na the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: mi nges pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub pa la rjes su dpog pa med na the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Just as it is uncertain, in the same way, if there is no inference to prove the existence of the Omniscient One, there is doubt.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpog pa med pas so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpog pa med pas so //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means: because there is no inference.

original: me la sogs pa gang gis du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa de la de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: me la sogs pa gang gis du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa de la de skad ces bya la /
translated: That which does not produce the effect of smoke, etc., in fire, etc., is so called.

original: 'di ni du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa yang yin la me yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa yang yin la me yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: And this is the non-production of the effect of smoke, etc., and it is fire, thus the words are combined.

original: de'i yod pa nyid bzhin te yod pa nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i yod pa nyid bzhin te yod pa nyid lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Like its existence‚Äù means like existence.

original: res 'ga' dmigs pa'i don la ni //
analyzed: res 'ga' dmigs pa'i don la ni //
translated: Sometimes the object of perception is

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyis lcags kyi gong bu la sogs pa'i dpe the tshom za ba'i rgyur dmigs par ston cing thams cad mkhyen pa la yang de med pa'i phyir the tshom mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyis lcags kyi gong bu la sogs pa'i dpe the tshom za ba'i rgyur dmigs par ston cing thams cad mkhyen pa la yang de med pa'i phyir the tshom mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa
translated: . Here, another person, in order to show that the example of a lump of iron, etc., is the cause of doubt, points out the perception, and in order to show that doubt is not proper with regard to the Omniscient One because it does not exist there, he teaches the uncertainty of the reason.

original: nyid sgrub par @289b byed pa yin no /
analyzed: nyid sgrub par @289b byed pa yin no /
translated: and it is the means of establishing that.

original: don gang zhig sngar res 'ga' dmigs pas de nyid la the tshom bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: don gang zhig sngar res 'ga' dmigs pas de nyid la the tshom bya bar rigs te /
translated: It is proper to doubt that very object which has been perceived sometimes in the past,

original: dper na mtho yor la mi bzhin du de gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dper na mtho yor la mi bzhin du de gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is perceived as having both aspects, like a post,

original: gzhan du na gang cung zad ma mthong ba de thams cad the tshom gyis dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gang cung zad ma mthong ba de thams cad the tshom gyis dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, everything that is not seen a little would be perceived by doubt.

original: de lta yin dang cha gnyi ga la dmigs pa nyid kyis nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang cha gnyi ga la dmigs pa nyid kyis nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would be ascertained by the very perception of both aspects.

original: des na lcags kyi gong bu'i me la sogs pa the tshom za bar rigs kyi thams cad mkhyen pa la ni ma yin te de ni res 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na lcags kyi gong bu'i me la sogs pa the tshom za bar rigs kyi thams cad mkhyen pa la ni ma yin te de ni res 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to doubt fire, etc. in a mass of iron, etc., but not with respect to the Omniscient One, because He is never not perceived.

original: rnam pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: He replies to that with ‚ÄúThese aspects, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te res 'ga' dmigs pa'i don la the tshom za ba la gzhan du med par nges pa na de'i tshe rigs pa 'di nyid kyis khyed cag gis ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa the tshom med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' dmigs pa'i don la the tshom za ba la gzhan du med par nges pa na de'i tshe rigs pa 'di nyid kyis khyed cag gis ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa the tshom med par 'gyur te /
translated: If, on occasion, one doubts the object of perception, and then ascertains that it does not exist elsewhere, at that time, by this very reasoning, you would have no doubt about taking a wife, etc.

original: gang gis 'di la yang khyed kyis med nges par mi 'gyur ba khyed kyis res 'ga' sngar ma bag mar len pa dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di la yang khyed kyis med nges par mi 'gyur ba khyed kyis res 'ga' sngar ma bag mar len pa dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because, in this case, you would not ascertain that it does not exist, and you have not previously perceived the taking of a wife on occasion.

original: de la rgol ba dang lan lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgol ba dang lan lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The remaining objections and responses should be stated as before.

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni bzhad gang du byed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni bzhad gang du byed pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise‚Äù refers to those who laugh at this.

original: de lta na'o na the tshom rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na'o na the tshom rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, doubt would have no cause.‚Äù

original: nged kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nged kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: We say:

original: tshad ma med pa ni dngos po yod pa dang med pa gnyid ka la yang mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa mi gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma med pa ni dngos po yod pa dang med pa gnyid ka la yang mthong ba'i phyir rnam pa mi gnas pa yin te /
translated: Because valid cognition does not exist, the non-enduring aspect is seen in both existent and non-existent things.

original: des na yod pa dang med par nges pa mi skye ba'i phyir the tshom du brjod do //
analyzed: des na yod pa dang med par nges pa mi skye ba'i phyir the tshom du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since ascertainment of existence and nonexistence does not arise, it is called doubt.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir khyad par la ltos pa'i rnam par spyod pa ni the tshom mo zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir khyad par la ltos pa'i rnam par spyod pa ni the tshom mo zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it does not abide in the observation or nonobservation of an object, the operation of doubt depends on a distinction.

original: 'di snyam du dngos po yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga la yang tshad ma ldog par mthong ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dngos po yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga la yang tshad ma ldog par mthong ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that a valid cognition is not seen to be blocked in regard to both existent and nonexistent things,

original: dngos po yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúEven though an entity exists. . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod kyang mig ma tshang ba la tshad ma mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod kyang mig ma tshang ba la tshad ma mi 'jug la /
translated: Thus, even though an entity such as a pot exists, a valid cognition does not operate in regard to it if the eye is defective.

original: mig la sogs pa de dag ma tshang ba med na yang yul zhes bya ba'i dngos po mi nye ba nyid kyis med na yang mi 'jug go zhes rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag ma tshang ba med na yang yul zhes bya ba'i dngos po mi nye ba nyid kyis med na yang mi 'jug go zhes rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Even if the eye and so on are not defective, if the entity called the object is not present, then the valid cognition does not operate. This is the natural way of things.

original: dper na rung ba'i yul na mi nye ba'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rung ba'i yul na mi nye ba'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a pot that is not present in a suitable location.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly‚Äù indicates the absence of a special object of seeing.

original: gnyis su mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of seeing duality‚Äù means because of seeing existence and nonexistence.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: mchog @290a * //
analyzed: mchog @290a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe highest‚Äù means the root of virtue.

original: ces bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the connection of the root of virtue,

original: 'di ltar log pa'i lta bas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun bcad pa rnams la the tshom dang yod par blta ba dag gis dge ba'i mtshams sbyor ba brjod pa yin te /üîΩmtshams ni the tshom yod lta bas //
analyzed: 'di ltar log pa'i lta bas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun bcad pa rnams la the tshom dang yod par blta ba dag gis dge ba'i mtshams sbyor ba brjod pa yin te / mtshams ni the tshom yod lta bas //
translated: thus, in those who have severed the root of virtue through wrong views, the connection of the root of virtue is described through doubt and the view of existence.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe connection is doubt and the view of existence.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dang der slob dpon rnams kyis the tshom skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang der slob dpon rnams kyis the tshom skyed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the masters generate doubt in that and that.

original: gal te yod pa la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa la tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: If it exists, what is the valid knowledge?

original: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom yin la rag mod /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir the tshom yin la rag mod /
translated: Therefore, it is certainly doubt.

original: 'di snyam du gal te thams cad mkhyen pa yod na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te thams cad mkhyen pa yod na /
translated: If the omniscient one exists,

original: ci'i phyir res 'ga' 'ga' zhig gis dmigs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir res 'ga' 'ga' zhig gis dmigs par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why is it that sometimes it is not observed?

original: gal te 'di tshu rol mthong bas rtag tu mi dmigs pa zhes pa de lta na yang de'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gis ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
analyzed: gal te 'di tshu rol mthong bas rtag tu mi dmigs pa zhes pa de lta na yang de'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gis ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
translated: If you say that it is not always observed because it is seen only occasionally, then why is its effect not also apprehended?

original: mig la sogs ba rnams mngon sum ma yin pa na de'i 'bras bu'i shes pa yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: mig la sogs ba rnams mngon sum ma yin pa na de'i 'bras bu'i shes pa yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that if the eyes, etc. are not direct perception, then the consciousness that is their effect will not be direct perception,

original: de'i phyir de ni yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then to respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúEven though it exists, etc.‚Äù

original: mi mthong zhes bya ba ni dngos su zhes bya ba dang 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthong zhes bya ba ni dngos su zhes bya ba dang 'brel par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not seen‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúdirectly.‚Äù

original: gang gis dmigs pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa med par 'gyur gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dmigs pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa med par 'gyur gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not apprehended, omniscience does not exist. But not everything that exists is apprehended.

original: skyes bu gzhan la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod na yang gzhan dag gis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod na yang gzhan dag gis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the conception exists in another person, it is not apprehended by others.

original: gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pas med par 'gyur ba gdon mi za bar rgyu rnams ni rtag tu 'bras bu rtsom par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pas med par 'gyur ba gdon mi za bar rgyu rnams ni rtag tu 'bras bu rtsom par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not certain that causes always produce effects, because the effect of omniscience is not observed.

original: bu ba'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa'i lcags kyi gong bu'i me la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu ba'i 'bras bu mi rtsom pa'i lcags kyi gong bu'i me la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, an iron ball that does not produce the effect of heat is seen in a fire.

original: rgyu rnams ni rnag tu 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni rnag tu 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: But are causes not always endowed with an effect?

original: de lta na yang de'i 'bras bu med par nges pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gis 'bras bu ma dmigs pas de'i med par grub par 'gyur ba 'bras bu thams cad skyes na yang snga ba nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i 'bras bu med par nges pa ma yin te / gang gis 'bras bu ma dmigs pas de'i med par grub par 'gyur ba 'bras bu thams cad skyes na yang snga ba nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it is not certain that its effect does not exist.

original: 'bras bu skyes na yang ma mthong ba'i phyir gzhan gyi rtog pa las byung ba'i chags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes na yang ma mthong ba'i phyir gzhan gyi rtog pa las byung ba'i chags pa bzhin no //
translated: For, even if all effects were produced, it is not pervaded by the prior existence of the cause, because even when the effect is produced, it is not seen, like attachment that arises from another‚Äôs conception.

original: dper na skyes bu gzhan gyi rtog pa las byung ba ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i chags pa yang mi dmigs pa yin te 'di ni med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gzhan gyi rtog pa las byung ba ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i chags pa yang mi dmigs pa yin te 'di ni med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: For example, the attachment that arises from the improper mental activity of another person is not perceived, but it is not nonexistent.

original: yang na 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yod na yang de'i rgyu dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa @290b ma bzung ba'i skyes bu de la rjes su dpog pa skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yod na yang de'i rgyu dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa @290b ma bzung ba'i skyes bu de la rjes su dpog pa skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, if the future effect exists, then the cause of that effect is past, and it is impossible for the person to infer that effect, because he has not apprehended the invariable relation between the cause and the effect.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yod na yang rjes su dpag pa las grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar srid pa yin no //üîΩblun blos mthong ba zhes bya ba la blo nyid mthong ba ni blos mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yod na yang rjes su dpag pa las grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar srid pa yin no // blun blos mthong ba zhes bya ba la blo nyid mthong ba ni blos mthong ba ste /
translated: In the same way, even if the omniscient person exists, it is impossible to establish his existence by inference.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúseen by the deluded mind‚Äù means that the mind itself sees.

original: rmongs pa'i blos mthong ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i blos mthong ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have the deluded mind‚Äôs view are called ‚Äúdeluded.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang ji ltar tshad ma dngos po'i rgyu ma yin zhing khyab par byed pa yang ma yin bar sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar tshad ma dngos po'i rgyu ma yin zhing khyab par byed pa yang ma yin bar sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it has been previously demonstrated how a valid cognition is not the cause of an existent thing and is not a pervader.

original: de ji ltar rgyu ma yin zhing khyab par byed par gyur pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di log na dngos po ldog pa yin snyam du sems pa yin no //üîΩ'di ni rgyu ma yin pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ji ltar rgyu ma yin zhing khyab par byed par gyur pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di log na dngos po ldog pa yin snyam du sems pa yin no // 'di ni rgyu ma yin pa yang yin la /
translated: How could it be that when this inference, which is not a cause and is not a pervader, is refuted, the existent thing is refuted?üîΩIt is called ‚Äúnot a cause and not a pervader‚Äù

original: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa yang yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa yang yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: because it is not a cause and is not a pervader.

original: rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma ldog pa na dngos po ldog par mtho ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma ldog pa na dngos po ldog par mtho ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It is also not possible to say that when the valid cognition called ‚Äúthe inference that is not a cause and is not a pervader‚Äù is refuted, the existent thing is refuted.

original: mthong ba la ni mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes dgos pa la /
analyzed: mthong ba la ni mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes dgos pa la /
translated: In response to the statement, ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as an invalid cognition,‚Äù

original: de log na yang don yod par mthong ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de log na yang don yod par mthong ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven when that is refuted, an existent object is seen.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa 'di log pa yin na yang dngos po 'di yod par yang mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'di log pa yin na yang dngos po 'di yod par yang mthong ste /
translated: Although this inference is mistaken, still, this thing is seen to exist.üîΩFor example, it is like the fire of a ball of iron.

original: dper na lcags kyi gong bu'i me bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: dper na lcags kyi gong bu'i me bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained previously.

original: de ltar rgyas par thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan nas mjug sdud par byed ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par thams cad mkhyen pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan nas mjug sdud par byed ba ni /
translated: Having thus taught in detail that there is no valid cognition that contradicts the proof that the Omniscient One does not exist, he concludes:

original: de'i phyir kun mkhyen yod pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun mkhyen yod pa la //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the Omniscient OneüîΩis established by the power of the valid cognition of inference.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'di snyam du ji ltar kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ltar khyed cag la yang de sgrub par byed pa med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'di snyam du ji ltar kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ltar khyed cag la yang de sgrub par byed pa med do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that just as we have no valid cognition that contradicts, so you also have no proof of that,

original: 'di'i sgrub byed ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i sgrub byed ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe proof of that is . . .‚Äù

original: yan lag gsal ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: yan lag gsal ba ma lus pa //
translated: The complete manifestation of the parts

original: rgyas par shes pa sgrub par byed //
analyzed: rgyas par shes pa sgrub par byed //
translated: is the proof of the knowledge of all things.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: With regard to what was said,

original: ma lus don ni yongs shes pa'i //
analyzed: ma lus don ni yongs shes pa'i //
translated: the complete knowledge of all things

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above passage.

original: bsam pa 'di yis zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa 'dis so //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yis zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa 'dis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this thought‚Äù means by this intention.

original: 'di yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this?

original: mtho ris thar pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtho ris thar pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe attainment of high status and certain goodness‚Äù explains this.

original: re zhig kho bo cag gis bcom ldan 'das gtso bor mtho ris dang thar pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: re zhig kho bo cag gis bcom ldan 'das gtso bor mtho ris dang thar pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu sgrub par byed la /
translated: First, we establish that the Bhagavat is the cause for attaining high status and certain goodness.üîΩAnd we also establish that he is the one who knows all things in their entirety.

original: gang yang 'di'i ma lus pa'i yongs su shes pa bo nyid yin par shes par sgrub par byed pa de ni zhar las byung ba yin @291a * //
analyzed: gang yang 'di'i ma lus pa'i yongs su shes pa bo nyid yin par shes par sgrub par byed pa de ni zhar las byung ba yin @291a * //
translated: This is a digression,

original: te / gzhan du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa 'jug pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / gzhan du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa 'jug pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because elsewhere the Bhagavat‚Äôs knowledge is not undermined by any valid cognition.

original: dngos su don ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba la 'gas kyang mi gnod pa'i phyir de na rtog pa dang ldan pa de spong bar nus pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: dngos su don ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba la 'gas kyang mi gnod pa'i phyir de na rtog pa dang ldan pa de spong bar nus pa ma yin no ;
translated: Since he directly knows all things in their entirety, he is omniscient. No one can undermine this. Therefore, the rational one cannot abandon this.

original: /'on kyang de dag thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa don du gnyer ba de dag de'i don du 'jug par rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: /'on kyang de dag thams cad mkhyen pa thob pa don du gnyer ba de dag de'i don du 'jug par rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is reasonable for those who seek to attain omniscience to engage in it for that purpose.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med cing 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub par byed pa yang gsal ba yod pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med cing 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub par byed pa yang gsal ba yod pa na /
translated: Thus, since there is no valid cognition that can refute it, and since the proof of omniscience will be clearly stated later,

original: skyes bu thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ma rig pas bslad pa yin no zhes khyed cag nges pa gcig gi yul can gyi thams cad mkhyen pa spong ba gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa 'ba' zhig las yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ma rig pas bslad pa yin no zhes khyed cag nges pa gcig gi yul can gyi thams cad mkhyen pa spong ba gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa 'ba' zhig las yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: you who reject omniscience, which is the object of a single cognition, are simply being foolish.

original: de nas gnod byed med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gnod byed med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, the text says:üîΩ‚ÄúSince there is no refutation of it, and since there is a proof of it,

original: de 'di snyam du de lta bu'i skyes bu sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i tshad ma med do zhes de ltar sems pa kho bo cag gis spong bar byed kyi rmongs pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /üîΩde la sgrub byed med na yang //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du de lta bu'i skyes bu sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i tshad ma med do zhes de ltar sems pa kho bo cag gis spong bar byed kyi rmongs pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na / de la sgrub byed med na yang //
translated: We do not refute the ignorant.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod kyi 'di'i sgrub par byed pa 'chad par 'gyur ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod kyi 'di'i sgrub par byed pa 'chad par 'gyur ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: This is stated as if it were accepted, but in fact there is a proof of this, which will be stated later.

original: nges 'di zhes bya ba 'di thams cad mkhyen pa med do zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: nges 'di zhes bya ba 'di thams cad mkhyen pa med do zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: This is the statement ‚ÄúThere is no omniscient one.‚Äù

original: gang yang khyed cag gis skul bar byed pa kho na 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / phra ba dang chad pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rigs can gyi don rtogs par nus pa yin gyi gzhan dbang pos ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes brjod pa 'di yang gus par smra bas tshad ma
analyzed: gang yang khyed cag gis skul bar byed pa kho na 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / phra ba dang chad pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rigs can gyi don rtogs par nus pa yin gyi gzhan dbang pos ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes brjod pa 'di yang gus par smra bas tshad ma
translated: You say that only the one who is impassioned can understand such things as the meaning of the words ‚Äúarisen,‚Äù ‚Äúwill arise,‚Äù ‚Äúsubtle,‚Äù and ‚Äúannihilated.‚Äù But this statement is not a valid proof, because it is just a claim made by one who is impassioned.

original: med pa can dam bca' ba 'ba' zhig smra ba yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: med pa can dam bca' ba 'ba' zhig smra ba yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show that this is just a claim made by one who is impassioned:

original: skul byed kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skul byed kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOnly the one who is impassioned‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang mngon sum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang mngon sum la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy others‚Äù refers to omniscience, perception, and so on.

original: gzhan med ces bya ba ni gzhan chos shes pa med par nges na 'di skad du brjod par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan med ces bya ba ni gzhan chos shes pa med par nges na 'di skad du brjod par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout others‚Äù means that if it is ascertained that there is no other cognition of phenomena, one can say this. But it is not so in other cases.

original: nges par bzung ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bzung ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ascertainment would be pointless.üîΩIn this regard, it is said:

original: de la 'gro kun phra ba yi //
analyzed: de la 'gro kun phra ba yi //
translated: ‚ÄúAll goings are subtle.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and other passages.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo mkhyen //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo mkhyen //
translated: The principal object of a person is known.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this and other passages.

original: kho bo cag gis chos shes pa'i @291b yul can gyi bsam pa spangs nas thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub par byed pa la 'bad pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis chos shes pa'i @291b yul can gyi bsam pa spangs nas thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub par byed pa la 'bad pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not abandon the subjective aspect of the knowledge of reality and strive to establish omniscience.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i chos shes pa bsgrub pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i chos shes pa bsgrub pa nyid la'o //
translated: We strive to establish the knowledge of reality which is the principal object.

original: de bzhin du sngar gzhan du /üîΩdon gyis go bas rnyed pa yi //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar gzhan du / don gyis go bas rnyed pa yi //
translated: Similarly, previously in another context,üîΩYou accept the so-called Dharma

original: khyod kyis chos zhes khas blangs des //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos zhes khas blangs des //
translated: Which is understood by implication.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos zhes bya ba sgrub pa la don gyis go ba zhes bya ba khyed kyi lugs nyid kyis tshad mar brjod pa la phyis rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos zhes bya ba sgrub pa la don gyis go ba zhes bya ba khyed kyi lugs nyid kyis tshad mar brjod pa la phyis rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: In this and other passages, the so-called Dharma is established by what is called ‚Äúunderstood by implication.‚Äù In your system, the valid cognition called ‚Äúinference‚Äù will be explained later.

original: des na 'jig rten gnas ma yin pa la ngal ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gnas ma yin pa la ngal ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not a waste of effort to establish what is not established in the world.

original: 'o na ci zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na //
translated: What then?

original: gnas gnyis la'o //
analyzed: gnas gnyis la'o //
translated: It is in two contexts.

original: tshad ma byed pa kun 'brel ba'i //
analyzed: tshad ma byed pa kun 'brel ba'i //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who is the agent of valid cognition is related to the object,üîΩand so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩtshad ma byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / tshad ma byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩThe one who is the agent of valid cognition and so on is related to the object, such as the object of cognition.

original: chos la sogs pa'i yul can tshad ma byed pa po dang 'brel pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'gag par mi nus pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa dag lung tsam gyis rtogs par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa'i yul can tshad ma byed pa po dang 'brel pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'gag par mi nus pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa dag lung tsam gyis rtogs par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One cannot understand that the object is Dharma or non-Dharma merely by not seeing it through direct perception and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di tsam gyis ni spyod pa yis //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni spyod pa yis //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this much alone, one is not a practitioner.üîΩ‚Äù

original: phyogs grub na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: phyogs grub na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa 'di la /
translated: If one says ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù

original: 'di tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: one should say ‚Äúby this much alone‚Äù and so on.

original: ma grub na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is established‚Äù and so on means that because the knowledge of Dharma is not established,

original: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa rnams kyis so //üîΩgang yang rtsa ba bcad nyid phyir //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa rnams kyis so // gang yang rtsa ba bcad nyid phyir //
translated: ‚Äúby others‚Äù means by the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the root itself is cut‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yang rtsa ba ma bcad phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang rtsa ba ma bcad phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because the root has not been cut.

original: ma bcom zhes dgag pa'i tshig gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bcom zhes dgag pa'i tshig gdon par bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis so //üîΩdngos su mngon sum gyis mthong phyir //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis so // dngos su mngon sum gyis mthong phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the Buddhists.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is directly perceived‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te / lce yi dbang po dang 'brel phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te / lce yi dbang po dang 'brel phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is connected with the tongue faculty‚Äù and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is directly perceived‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te dngos su /
analyzed: gal te dngos su /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is directly perceived‚Äù and so on.

original: chang gi ro la sogs pa rig par 'gyur ba de lta na yang chos zhes bya ba nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chang gi ro la sogs pa rig par 'gyur ba de lta na yang chos zhes bya ba nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the taste of beer and so on is known, the so-called Dharma is not impaired.

original: smad par bya ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: smad par bya ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say it becomes something to be despised, that is not so.

original: gang yang lce'i dbang pos reg nas ro la sogs pa de dag myong bar mdzad na //
analyzed: gang yang lce'i dbang pos reg nas ro la sogs pa de dag myong bar mdzad na //
translated: If the Blessed One, having contacted them with the tongue faculty, experienced those tastes and so on,

original: de 'jig rten smad par bya ba nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de 'jig rten smad par bya ba nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: then it would become something to be despised by the world.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de ltar rigs par mdzad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de ltar rigs par mdzad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the Blessed One does not act in that way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, how?

original: yid kyis so //
analyzed: yid kyis so //
translated: By the mind.

original: de yang ma phrad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten na des byas pa smad @292a * //
analyzed: de yang ma phrad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten na des byas pa smad @292a * //
translated: Because it is a non-conjoined object, it is despised in the world as a creator of that.üîΩ

original: pa nyid du grags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid du grags pa ma yin no //
translated: and because it is a non-contacting subject, it is not known in the world as something to be despised.

original: don dam par smad par bya ba nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par smad par bya ba nyid 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is nothing at all to be despised,

original: de mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not endure.

original: 'di ltar gtsang sbra can gyis smad par bya ba gang yin pa de ro sreg mkhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtsang sbra can gyis smad par bya ba gang yin pa de ro sreg mkhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: Thus, what is despised by the pure is not despised by the crematory groundskeepers.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten na chang la sogs pa smad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten na chang la sogs pa smad pa yin te /
translated: However, in the world, alcohol and so on are despised.

original: de dag nyams su myong bar mdzad pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: de dag nyams su myong bar mdzad pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though the Lord experienced them,

original: bcom ldan 'das smad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das smad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: the Lord is not to be despised,

original: chang ni yid kyis myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chang ni yid kyis myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because alcohol is experienced by the mind.

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar lce'i dbang po dang 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan dag chang la sogs pa myong ba na sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de ltar yid kyis kyang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar lce'i dbang po dang 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan dag chang la sogs pa myong ba na sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de ltar yid kyis kyang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that just as others experience alcohol and so on through their connection with the tongue faculty, they experience suffering and so on, then the mind also experiences them,

original: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: ro la sogs pa lce'i dbang po dang 'brel ba nyams su myong ba dbang po la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod par byed pa na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa lce'i dbang po dang 'brel ba nyams su myong ba dbang po la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod par byed pa na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: When the tongue sense-faculty is in contact with taste, etc., and experiences them, they become the cause of pleasure, etc., when they benefit the sense-faculty.

original: de dag kyang las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rjes su byed pas phyin ci log gi blo can 'ga' zhig kho na la de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod kyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rjes su byed pas phyin ci log gi blo can 'ga' zhig kho na la de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod kyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: And since they are the effect of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, they are described as the cause of pleasure, etc., only for some who have a distorted understanding, but not for all.

original: ji ltar yi dags rnams la chu la sogs pa rnag la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yi dags rnams la chu la sogs pa rnag la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba de bzhin no //
translated: Just as water, etc., appears as pus, etc., to hungry ghosts.

original: bcom ldan 'das la de lta bu thams cad mnga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la de lta bu thams cad mnga' ba ma yin te /
translated: The Lord does not have all of that,

original: yid kho nas nyams su myong bar mdzad pa'i phyir dbang po la gnod pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kho nas nyams su myong bar mdzad pa'i phyir dbang po la gnod pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: because he experiences everything only with the mind, and so his sense-faculties are not harmed, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi dbang du 'gyur ba mi srid la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po lnga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi dbang du 'gyur ba mi srid la /
translated: Because the Bhagavat is the nature of the five uncontaminated faculties, it is impossible for him to be under the power of contaminated karma.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos myong bar mdzad pa'i phyir phyin ci log kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos myong bar mdzad pa'i phyir phyin ci log kyang ma yin no //
translated: And because he experiences things with the essence of impermanence, etc., which are unmistaken, he is not mistaken.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la yid las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi srid de de ni rmongs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la yid las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa mi srid de de ni rmongs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for the Bhagavat to have suffering, etc., which are characterized by mental dissatisfaction, etc., that arise from the mind, because they arise from delusion.

original: klan ka 'di thams cad phyi rol gyi don yod pa na 'jug pa yin gyi rnam par shes par smra ba'i tshul la ni go skabs 'di thag ring du bsrings pa yin te /
analyzed: klan ka 'di thams cad phyi rol gyi don yod pa na 'jug pa yin gyi rnam par shes par smra ba'i tshul la ni go skabs 'di thag ring du bsrings pa yin te /
translated: All of these objections apply when external objects exist, but this opportunity is far removed from the system of the Proponents of Consciousness.

original: 'di ltar don dam par gzugs kyi phung por med pa'i phyir mi gtsang ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par gzugs kyi phung por med pa'i phyir mi gtsang ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, because form does not exist ultimately in the aggregate of form, impurities, etc., do not exist.

original: de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa brtags pa'i bag chags sad pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa brtags pa'i bag chags sad pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from the mere activation of the latent propensities of unreal imagination.

original: des na don dam pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi gtsang ba la sogs @292b pa ma lus pa thag pa bsrings pa'i mthong ba la de dag snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na don dam pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa mi gtsang ba la sogs @292b pa ma lus pa thag pa bsrings pa'i mthong ba la de dag snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when the self-nature of seeing the ultimate is attained, the entire body of impurities and so on does not appear to the vision of one who has extended the rope of concentration,

original: dper na rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba na mig nyams pas mthong ba la skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba na mig nyams pas mthong ba la skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the vision of one whose eyes are free from the fault of myodesopsia and so on does not see the floaters and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid de yi ye shes la //
analyzed: de nyid de yi ye shes la //
translated: In the wisdom of that person,

original: mi gtsang ro sogs snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gtsang ro sogs snang mi 'gyur //
translated: impurities and so on do not appear.

original: rig par mi 'gyur bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: rig par mi 'gyur bdag nyid phyir //
translated: Because it is not the nature of cognition,

original: mi 'grub zla ba gnyis gzugs bzhin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'grub zla ba gnyis gzugs bzhin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not established, like the form of two moons.

original: bram ze gang gis khyab par byed pa nyid kyi rtag tu mi gtsang ba'i yul thams cad du 'brel pa'i rig byed kyi sgra kha dang khong pa la sogs par gnas pa de ji ltar 'jig rten 'dir smad par bya bar mi 'gyur /üîΩrig byed nye ba'i rig byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bram ze gang gis khyab par byed pa nyid kyi rtag tu mi gtsang ba'i yul thams cad du 'brel pa'i rig byed kyi sgra kha dang khong pa la sogs par gnas pa de ji ltar 'jig rten 'dir smad par bya bar mi 'gyur / rig byed nye ba'i rig byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How could the brahmin who is always pervaded by the impure objects of the elements that are connected to all the elements of space, and who resides in the mouth, stomach, and so on, not be despised in this world?üîΩWith respect to the passage that goes, ‚ÄúVeda, upani·π£ad, and so on,‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúVeda‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po de de ltar mkhyen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po de de ltar mkhyen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur la /
translated: Because he knows things as they are in terms of their nature of existence and so on, he is omniscient.

original: ji ltar rig byed du bstan pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i don rnams de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rig byed du bstan pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i don rnams de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The objects such as the self that are taught in the Veda do not exist in the way they are described.

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are undermined by valid knowledge.

original: de ji ltar de kho na ltar de ston pa na de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ji ltar de kho na ltar de ston pa na de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as when he teaches in that way, he sees reality,

original: des de log pa nyid du shes so zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: des de log pa nyid du shes so zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: And it cannot be said that ‚Äúhe knows that to be false.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mkhyen pa nyid de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mkhyen pa nyid de kho na nyid do //
translated: Because that knowledge itself is reality.

original: 'di ltar rig byed du bshad pa'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam thams cad dang ngan 'gro'i rgyu nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed du bshad pa'i srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam thams cad dang ngan 'gro'i rgyu nyid du bstan la /
translated: Thus, in the Vedas, all the paths of nonvirtuous actions such as killing are taught to be the cause of miserable realms.

original: de bzhin du 'di la bdag gi sems can med /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la bdag gi sems can med /
translated: And in the same way, it is said that ‚Äúhere there is no self, no sentient being,‚Äù

original: chos 'di rgyu dang bcas las byung //
analyzed: chos 'di rgyu dang bcas las byung //
translated: and ‚ÄúThis phenomenon arises from causes,‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag la sogs pa yang med pa nyid du gsungs so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag la sogs pa yang med pa nyid du gsungs so /
translated: Thus it is said that the self and so on do not exist.

original: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das kyis rig byed du brjod pa'i dngos po mi mkhyen par ma grub po //üîΩrang gzhung du don ma bstan kyang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das kyis rig byed du brjod pa'i dngos po mi mkhyen par ma grub po // rang gzhung du don ma bstan kyang //
translated: Therefore it is not established that the Bhagavat does not know the things expressed in the Vedas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In response to the statement, ‚ÄúEven if the meaning is not taught in one‚Äôs own scriptures,‚Äù

original: des na gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na gnyis med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the opponent says, ‚ÄúTherefore, nondual‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan mu stegs byed kyang ma gtogs pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa ste de dag thams cad ni phyin ci log gi bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs byed kyang ma gtogs pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa ste de dag thams cad ni phyin ci log gi bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no second, except for the non-Buddhists. All of them are attached to the false view of self.

original: 'di thams cad kyang bdag med pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang bdag med pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: All of these are the distinctions of selflessness.

original: zhi ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i thabs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i thabs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúgate to peace‚Äù is so called because it is the means of entering nirvana.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la brjod do //üîΩlta ba ngan rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i @293a * //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la brjod do // lta ba ngan rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i @293a * //
translated: ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù refers to nirvana.üîΩ‚ÄúEvil views‚Äù refers to those who have evil views of self, etc.

original: lta ba ngan pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it is called.

original: phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa byis pa'i skye bo skrag par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa byis pa'i skye bo skrag par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTerrifies those who are attached to error, the foolish‚Äù is the meaning.

original: ji skad du //üîΩbdag yod ma yin yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji skad du // bdag yod ma yin yod mi 'gyur //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe self does not exist, nor will it exist.

original: bdag gi yod min mi 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: bdag gi yod min mi 'gyur zhes //
translated: The self‚Äôs possessions do not exist, nor will they exist.

original: byis pa rnams ni de ltar skrag / mkhas pa rnams la skrag pa zad //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni de ltar skrag / mkhas pa rnams la skrag pa zad //
translated: Fools are frightened in that way; the wise have exhausted fear.

original: ces bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa la gnas pas de la mos par yang mi nus pas rtogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa la gnas pas de la mos par yang mi nus pas rtogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that one who is attached to error cannot even aspire to it, much less realize it.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa 'ga' zhig gis nam yang de sngar shes pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa 'ga' zhig gis nam yang de sngar shes pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Some who abide in the stage of ordinary beings have never known it before.

original: 'khor ba pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show this, he says:üîΩThe ordinary beings of cyclic existence,üîΩwho are not familiar with it,

original: 'khor ba pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ma 'dris pa ste goms par ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ma 'dris pa ste goms par ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: who have not cultivated it,üîΩwho have not seen it,üîΩwho have not heard of it,üîΩwho have not thought of it,üîΩwho have not understood it,üîΩwho have not realized it,üîΩwho have not attained it,üîΩwho have not actualized it,üîΩ Translation: Fools are frightened in that way; the wise have exhausted fear.üîΩThus it is said.

original: gang gis de'i don du ston pa ji ltar phan par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de'i don du ston pa ji ltar phan par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: This shows that one who is attached to error cannot even aspire to it, much less realize it.üîΩSome who abide in the stage of ordinary beings have never known it before.

original: shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show this, he says:üîΩThe ordinary beings of cyclic existence,üîΩwho are not familiar with it,üîΩwho have not cultivated it,üîΩwho have not seen it,üîΩwho have not heard of it,üîΩwho have not thought of it,üîΩwho have not understood it,üîΩwho have not realized it,üîΩwho have not attained it,üîΩwho have not actualized it,

original: shes na de mngon sum byas na nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gnod pa'i phung po ma lus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes na de mngon sum byas na nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gnod pa'i phung po ma lus pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows that, and makes it manifest, then all the aggregates of the harm characterized by afflictions and birth will be stopped.

original: dus phyis kyang de goms par byas pa na /üîΩrdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de ltar na mchog tu gyur pa'i skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba'i de kho na nyid gal te snyan dngags mkhan gyis shes pa na de dag kyang thams cad
analyzed: dus phyis kyang de goms par byas pa na / rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de ltar na mchog tu gyur pa'i skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba'i de kho na nyid gal te snyan dngags mkhan gyis shes pa na de dag kyang thams cad
translated: Later, by cultivating that,üîΩone will accomplish the special qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: mkhyen pa yin la rag mod /
analyzed: mkhyen pa yin la rag mod /
translated: Thus, if a poet knows that reality which is necessary for a supreme person, then they are omniscient.

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis skyes bu gcig ris su bcad de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas len pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis skyes bu gcig ris su bcad de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas len pa ni ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But we do not accept that one person is omniscient and another is not.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i de kho na nyid mkhyen pa gang yin pa de kho na thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i de kho na nyid mkhyen pa gang yin pa de kho na thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Rather, we assert that one who knows that reality as it has been explained is omniscient, but not another.

original: de lta bu snyan dngags mkhan rnams la ni yod pa ma yin te des na ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu snyan dngags mkhan rnams la ni yod pa ma yin te des na ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Such a thing does not exist for poets, and therefore the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: des na 'gal ba nye bar ston pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'gal ba nye bar ston pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the statement ‚Äúthe presentation of a contradiction‚Äù and so forth is also refuted, he says:

original: bdag med ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag med ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The wisdom of selflessness.

original: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes sdod ris dang ser skya la sogs pa la srid par 'gyur na de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes sdod ris dang ser skya la sogs pa la srid par 'gyur na de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If the wisdom of reality as it has been explained were possible for Kapila, Kanada, and so forth, then they would be omniscient.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag thams cad nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu log pa'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i gdon gyis bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag thams cad nyes pa thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu log pa'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i gdon gyis bzung ba yin te /
translated: But because they are possessed by the demon of grasping the self, which is the cause of all faults,

original: gang gis / ser skya min @293b zhes tshad ma ci //
analyzed: gang gis / ser skya min @293b zhes tshad ma ci //
translated: how could they be omniscient?

original: zhes brjod pas mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma ma yin pa la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma ma yin pa la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: Thus, he shows that things that are contradicted by such means of valid knowledge as perception are not momentary, and so on.

original: de ji ltar byas pa'i bar la shin tu grags pa'i lam du gyur pa'i dngos po dag la yang 'khrul pa 'di dag dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba srid pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar byas pa'i bar la shin tu grags pa'i lam du gyur pa'i dngos po dag la yang 'khrul pa 'di dag dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba srid pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How could these errors occur to those who have entered the path of seeing, which is the path of the most renowned of all paths, with regard to things that are established by such means of valid knowledge as perception?

original: 'di ltar 'dir tshad ma 'di gas la rab tu brjod par nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir tshad ma 'di gas la rab tu brjod par nus te /
translated: For, in this context, it is not possible to speak of any means of valid knowledge other than perception.

original: gang dag log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa de dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Those who are associated with erroneous consciousness are not omniscient,

original: dper na mtho yor la mi'o snyam du 'khrul pa skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mtho yor la mi'o snyam du 'khrul pa skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, a cairn on a crossroad is not a man, even though one may have the erroneous idea that it is a man.

original: sdod ris la sogs pa la yang log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal zas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sdod ris la sogs pa la yang log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal zas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause they are associated with erroneous consciousness,‚Äù and the pervasion is established by the observation of a contradictory mode of being.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'gal ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'gal ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all that is contrary to omniscience is related to a false cognition that is not omniscience.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: gang gi phyir phyin ci log gi don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir 'di dag ni log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyin ci log gi don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir 'di dag ni log pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa nyid grub po //
translated: Because they manifest a mistaken object, it is established that they are related to a false cognition.

original: 'di dag gi log pa'i don gsal bar byed pa de yang brtag pa thams cad kyis ma bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gi log pa'i don gsal bar byed pa de yang brtag pa thams cad kyis ma bstan to //
translated: And that manifestation of a false object by them is not taught by any theory.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa yang ma yin no /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa yang ma yin no /
translated: Nor is it uncertain, because the reversal in the discordant side is itself doubtful.

original: cig car dngos po ma lus pa yang dag par shes pa po yin pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: cig car dngos po ma lus pa yang dag par shes pa po yin pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'dod la /
translated: He is asserted to be omniscient because he simultaneously and perfectly knows all things.

original: gang la yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa de la de dang 'gal ba log pa'i shes pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa de la de dang 'gal ba log pa'i shes pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: And for one who has right cognition, it is not possible that there be a false cognition that is contrary to that.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'di dag phyin ci log gi don gsal bar byed pa de lta na yang de las log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa nyid du nges par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'di dag phyin ci log gi don gsal bar byed pa de lta na yang de las log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa nyid du nges par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that even though these are clarifications of the meaning of error, it is not certain that they possess consciousness that is the opposite of that,

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa gzhan du yang tha snyad bya bar nus pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa gzhan du yang tha snyad bya bar nus pa yin te /
translated: because it is possible to designate them in another way,

original: skyes bu rnams kyi bsam pa ni sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi bsam pa ni sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thoughts of persons are various.

original: des na gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Thus, the reason is uncertain and unestablished.

original: de dag gi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To anticipate this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúTheir words,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te de dag gi dgongs pa gzhan gyis 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal ba 'di smras pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gi dgongs pa gzhan gyis 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal ba 'di smras pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that their intention is to speak of this contradiction with valid knowledge, such as speaking of a different intention,

original: brjod par bya ba yin mod /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yin mod /
translated: then it must be stated.

original: kho bo cag gis rang dgar khyu mchog la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rang dgar khyu mchog la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du sgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not wish to prove that all the leaders of the world, such as Kapila, are not omniscient.

original: 'on kyang @294a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang @294a * //
translated: However,

original: khyed cag gis 'dod pa ni 'gal ba la gnas pas ser skya la sogs pa la gal te bde gshegs kun mkhyen yin pa de'i tshe ser skya ma yin no zhes bya ba la tshad ma ci zhig yod ces smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: khyed cag gis 'dod pa ni 'gal ba la gnas pas ser skya la sogs pa la gal te bde gshegs kun mkhyen yin pa de'i tshe ser skya ma yin no zhes bya ba la tshad ma ci zhig yod ces smras pa 'di la /
translated: since you maintain a contradiction, we say to you, ‚ÄúIf the Sugata is omniscient, then he is not Kapila. What is your proof for this?‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gis khyed cag gi 'dod pa de dag lugs tha dad par khas blangs nas tshad mar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis khyed cag gi 'dod pa de dag lugs tha dad par khas blangs nas tshad mar brjod pa yin te /
translated: We accept your assertions as a different system and state them as valid.

original: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, our reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'di dag dgongs pa can gyi tshig tu brjod pa de'i tshe 'di dag gi don dam pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ji lta bu zhig 'dod ces bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'di dag dgongs pa can gyi tshig tu brjod pa de'i tshe 'di dag gi don dam pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ji lta bu zhig 'dod ces bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If you say that these are words with an ulterior purpose, then you must state what the ultimate nature of things is that you assert.

original: de skad ces dris pa la gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa la gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: When asked this, the other party replies,

original: bdag med skad cig nyid la sogs //
analyzed: bdag med skad cig nyid la sogs //
translated: Selflessness, momentariness, and so forth.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSelflessness, momentariness, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag yin no zhes smras na de'i tshe lugs tha dad pa kho na brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ma grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag yin no zhes smras na de'i tshe lugs tha dad pa kho na brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ma grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say ‚Äúit is the self,‚Äù then it is not the case that the reason is not established, because you are simply stating a different position.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains the response to that in ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gis ni 'di thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes rva nas bzung ba de lta bur 'grub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni 'di thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes rva nas bzung ba de lta bur 'grub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that the omniscient one is established in the way that you grasp at him.

original: 'on kyang sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyor ro //
translated: Nevertheless, we do apply the term ‚Äúomniscient one.‚Äù

original: gal te ser skya la sogs pa rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i de kho na nyid shes par khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te ser skya la sogs pa rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i de kho na nyid shes par khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that KaÃÑsÃÅyapa and so on know suchness in that way,

original: 'o na khyed cag gis de dag ji ltar blo mi mthun zhes brjod par bya ste thams cad lugs gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na khyed cag gis de dag ji ltar blo mi mthun zhes brjod par bya ste thams cad lugs gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then why do you say that they are not in agreement, because they all agree on the same point.

original: gang yang phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ston pa de dag gis de ni 'dod pa'i don nyid du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang phan tshun 'gal ba'i don ston pa de dag gis de ni 'dod pa'i don nyid du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: And those who teach mutually contradictory doctrines do not do so with the intention of teaching suchness.

original: lugs gcig tu gnas pa rnams ni phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa'i don dang de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor smra'o zhes bya bar rigs pa yang ma yin no /
analyzed: lugs gcig tu gnas pa rnams ni phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa'i don dang de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor smra'o zhes bya bar rigs pa yang ma yin no /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that those who maintain a single system speak of the meaning of the scriptures as mutually contradictory and as having a nature of suchness.

original: de bas na lugs tha dad par 'dod na 'di dag ni tshig dgongs pa can yin no zhes brjod par mi bya la /
analyzed: de bas na lugs tha dad par 'dod na 'di dag ni tshig dgongs pa can yin no zhes brjod par mi bya la /
translated: Therefore, if you assert a different system, you should not say that these are the intended meaning of the scriptures.

original: lugs tha dad par mi 'dod na yang su zhig gcig nyid nges par byed ces brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lugs tha dad par mi 'dod na yang su zhig gcig nyid nges par byed ces brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: And if you do not assert a different system, then you should not say that anyone ascertains the one.

original: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pa kho na ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par bzung gi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pa kho na ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par bzung gi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gtan la phab zin to //
translated: Because it has already been determined that only the Sugata is ascertained as omniscient by virtue of possessing the wisdom as it has been explained, but not others.

original: gzhan yang ser skya la sogs pa rnams la ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes khas len par byed na bde bar gshegs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir dngos po kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ser skya la sogs pa rnams la ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes khas len par byed na bde bar gshegs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir dngos po kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that if the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on accept the wisdom as explained, they would be nothing but a sugata, it says ‚Äúin all things‚Äù and so on.

original: rab tu bstan pas de tshad mas bsgrubs pa'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin @294b bdag med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu bstan pas de tshad mas bsgrubs pa'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin @294b bdag med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The nature that is established by valid knowledge is the suchness that has the characteristic of selflessness and so on.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sdong ris la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni sdong ris la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In them‚Äù refers to ≈öƒÅ·πá·∏çilya and so on.

original: de tsam zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de tsam zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú That much‚Äù refers to possessing the wisdom that is praised.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the sugata.

original: gang gi phyir bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis bsngags par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis bsngags par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is a sugata, he is called a sugata because he has abandoned the obscurations of praise and so on through the wisdom of selflessness.

original: gzhan yang spyir thams cad mkhyen pa yod par bsgrubs nas yang shugs kyis bcom ldan 'das kho na gnas pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyir thams cad mkhyen pa yod par bsgrubs nas yang shugs kyis bcom ldan 'das kho na gnas pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, in general, having established that the Omniscient One exists, he also teaches that the Blessed One alone is the Omniscient One.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One, etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: de tshan nyid med pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de tshan nyid med pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it does not occur without that characteristic means

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur without the characteristic of the Omniscient One.

original: 'on te khyad par 'di ma bstan pa ji ltar rnyed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par 'di ma bstan pa ji ltar rnyed ce na /
translated: But if this distinction is not taught, how can it be understood?

original: khyad par ma bstan pa na yang //
analyzed: khyad par ma bstan pa na yang //
translated: Even if the distinction is not taught,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.
