original: gang zhig la 'gro ba thams cad bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid spyir byas nas yang gang la de dmigs pa'i khyad par de
analyzed: gang zhig la 'gro ba thams cad bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid spyir byas nas yang gang la de dmigs pa'i khyad par de
translated: Whoever realizes all things as they are in the nature of selflessness, etc. is the Omniscient One. Having thus made the general definition of the Omniscient One, he also teaches the distinction of the Omniscient One, i.e., the Blessed One, who is the object of that realization.

original: shugs kyis rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par khas len par byed pa don med do //
analyzed: shugs kyis rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par khas len par byed pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to accept a distinction.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kho na la dmigs kyis gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kho na la dmigs kyis gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: This characteristic of omniscience is observed in the Lord alone, not in others.

original: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pas ma tshang ba med pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba thabs dang bcas pa can gyi de kho na nyid gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pas ma tshang ba med pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba thabs dang bcas pa can gyi de kho na nyid gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: He is the one who, by various means, illuminates reality, which is the four noble truths in their entirety, together with the means of what is to be taken up and what is to be rejected.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i dngos po ngo bo ma rtogs pa rnams kyis phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin du ma tshang ba med par ston par nus pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i dngos po ngo bo ma rtogs pa rnams kyis phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin du ma tshang ba med par ston par nus pa ma yin te //
translated: Because those who do not understand such a reality cannot teach it without error or incompleteness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur pas //üîΩde 'chad pa ni dka' ba yin //
analyzed: thabs byung de rgyu lkog gyur pas // de 'chad pa ni dka' ba yin //
translated: The means of attaining it and its cause are hidden,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: so it is difficult to explain.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'di bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos 'gro ba rig pa de lta bu yang 'di ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na /üîΩbdag med mngon sum byas pa la //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'di bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos 'gro ba rig pa de lta bu yang 'di ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na / bdag med mngon sum byas pa la //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow can that cognition of the world as having the nature of selflessness, etc. be established as omniscience?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩthabs cad mkhyen pa ni nyon mongs @295a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / thabs cad mkhyen pa ni nyon mongs @295a * //
translated: [The root text] states, ‚ÄúHaving actualized selflessness . . .‚Äù

original: pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Omniscience is the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams nyid yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams nyid yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the afflictions such as desire are called ‚Äúafflictive obstructions‚Äù because they are the obstacles to seeing the truth.

original: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid mthong na yang rnam pa thams cad yong su mi shes pa dang / ston par mi nus pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid mthong na yang rnam pa thams cad yong su mi shes pa dang / ston par mi nus pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obstructions to omniscience are those things that, even though one sees the reality of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, one does not know everything in all ways, and one is not able to teach.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni bdag med pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni bdag med pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir spangs pa yin la /
translated: The afflictive obstructions are abandoned by directly perceiving selflessness.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba 'jug pa nye bar med par dus yun ring por goms pa las spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba 'jug pa nye bar med par dus yun ring por goms pa las spangs pa yin no //
translated: The obstructions to omniscience are abandoned by the long-term cultivation of the vision of selflessness.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i rtsa ba can du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis nges kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i rtsa ba can du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis nges kyi /
translated: Thus, these afflictions such as attachment are definitely the progeny of the view of self, in terms of both their forward and reverse orders of elimination.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi mthu las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi mthu las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise from the power of external objects.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol yod na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa nyid la byed pa med par mi 'byung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol yod na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa nyid la byed pa med par mi 'byung la /
translated: Because, even if external objects exist, they do not arise without the power of improper mental activity.

original: don med na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du gyur ba las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: don med na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du gyur ba las skye ba yin no //
translated: And, even if external objects do not exist, they arise from the power of the direct perception of improper conceptualization.

original: gang zhig gang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i 'bras bu rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i 'bras bu rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that something is the effect of something else if it does not follow the existence or nonexistence of the other.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: 'di dag ni gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag dang 'du ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag dang 'du ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not the self and the aggregates imagined by others,

original: bdag de ni bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de ni bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self has already been refuted.

original: de yod na yang rtag tu 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yang rtag tu 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it did exist, it would follow that attachment and so on would always occur, because it would be inseparable from them.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa'i rgyu bdag ma tshang ba med pa rtag tu nye ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis bos dbyung du med pa ni de la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam pa mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa'i rgyu bdag ma tshang ba med pa rtag tu nye ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis bos dbyung du med pa ni de la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam pa mang du bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained many times that it is not tenable to posit that which is permanent and independent as the cause of birth and endurance, because it is always present in its entirety and because it cannot be activated by another.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag la rten dang brten pa bkag pa'i phyir la lar 'di dag 'du ba rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rtag pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ma yin la phyi rol gyi don gyi mthu las byung ba yang
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag la rten dang brten pa bkag pa'i phyir la lar 'di dag 'du ba rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rtag pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ma yin la phyi rol gyi don gyi mthu las byung ba yang
translated: Since the existence and nonexistence of the self and the aggregates as the support and the supported have been refuted, it is illogical for them to be related as the support and the supported. Therefore the self does not exist as the support of the cause and effect of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: It is also not the case that the self arises from the power of external objects.

original: 'on kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong ba'i stobs kyis byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong ba'i stobs kyis byung ba yin te /
translated: But they arise by the power of seeing an unreal object.

original: 'di ltar bdag ces ma mthong bar ni bdag la chags pa 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ces ma mthong bar ni bdag la chags pa 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: Thus, attachment to self does not arise without seeing self.

original: bdag gis zhes ma bzung bar yang bdag la bde ba bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du ma bzung ba'i dngos po la bdag gi ba nyid du mngon @295b bar zhen 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes ma bzung bar yang bdag la bde ba bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du ma bzung ba'i dngos po la bdag gi ba nyid du mngon @295b bar zhen 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: And clinging to ‚Äúmine‚Äù does not arise without grasping things as being agreeable or disagreeable, that is, as conducive or not conducive to the pleasure of the self.

original: zhe sdang yang bdag gi ba dang rjes su mi mthun pa nyid du ma bzung ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang yang bdag gi ba dang rjes su mi mthun pa nyid du ma bzung ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Hatred also does not arise without grasping things as being disagreeable.

original: bdag dang bdag gi la mi gnod pa dang de la gnod pa'i gnyen po can la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi la mi gnod pa dang de la gnod pa'i gnyen po can la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is impossible for one who does not harm the self and who is the antidote to harming it.

original: de bzhin du nga rgyal la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nga rgyal la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of pride and so on.

original: de lta bas na thog ma med pa'i rigs 'dra ba snga ma snga ma goms pas bskyed pa'i bdag tu lta bas ni bdag gir 'dzin pa skyed par byed la nges kyang bdag la chags pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na thog ma med pa'i rigs 'dra ba snga ma snga ma goms pas bskyed pa'i bdag tu lta bas ni bdag gir 'dzin pa skyed par byed la nges kyang bdag la chags pa'o //
translated: Thus, the view of self, generated by the repeated practice of the view of self in previous lives, which are linked by a similar type of continuity, generates the grasping of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de yang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis 'di dag bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba can nyid du gsal rab tu gnag rdzi'i chung ma'i bar la grags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis 'di dag bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba can nyid du gsal rab tu gnag rdzi'i chung ma'i bar la grags pa nyid yin no //
translated: And the fact that they are the roots of attachment, hatred, etc., is well known in the world, as is the fact that they are abandoned by the path of vision.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yang bdag med par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba yang bdag med par lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of selflessness is the antidote to the view of self,

original: de las bzlog pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the view that is the opposite of the view of self.

original: 'di dag cig car rgyud gcig la thag pa dang sbrul gyi shes pa bzhin du lhan cig gnas pa dang gcig yin pa 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di dag cig car rgyud gcig la thag pa dang sbrul gyi shes pa bzhin du lhan cig gnas pa dang gcig yin pa 'gal lo //
translated: They cannot coexist in one continuum at the same time, like the cognition of a rope and the cognition of a snake.

original: des na bdag med par lta ba dang bdag tu lta ba 'gal ba'i phyir de'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: des na bdag med par lta ba dang bdag tu lta ba 'gal ba'i phyir de'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the view of selflessness and the view of self are contradictory, they are mutually exclusive along with the attachment, etc. which have them as their roots.

original: dper na gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag dang grang bas byas pa'i spu long byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag dang grang bas byas pa'i spu long byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the specific heat of fire and the specific cold of snow.

original: des na nyes pa thams cad dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du byas pa na de dang 'gal ba'i 'dod chags la sos pa nyes pa'i tshogs gnas rnyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na nyes pa thams cad dang 'gal ba'i bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du byas pa na de dang 'gal ba'i 'dod chags la sos pa nyes pa'i tshogs gnas rnyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when one has realized the vision of selflessness, which is the antidote to all faults, the collection of faults, such as attachment, which are incompatible with it, do not remain.

original: snang ba dang ldan pa'i yul phyogs su mun pa bzhin te /
analyzed: snang ba dang ldan pa'i yul phyogs su mun pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like darkness in a place where there is light.

original: des na bdag med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des na bdag med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the obscuration of the afflictions is eliminated because of selflessness,

original: sbyor ba ni gang na gnag dang 'gal ba'i dngos po yod pa de na de las gzhan gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang na gnag dang 'gal ba'i dngos po yod pa de na de las gzhan gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: the application is that where there is a thing which is incompatible with darkness, darkness does not remain there.

original: dper na sgron ma'i 'od dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs su mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma'i 'od dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs su mun pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the fact that there is no darkness in a place that is illuminated by a lamp.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du byas pa'i skyes bu la yang nyes pa'i tshogs dang 'gal ba bdag med pa mthong ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du byas pa'i skyes bu la yang nyes pa'i tshogs dang 'gal ba bdag med pa mthong ba yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And in the case of a person who has realized the direct perception of the insight into selflessness, the mass of faults is incompatible with the insight into selflessness. This is the observation of an intrinsic incompatibility.

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar bdag med pa mthong ba dang ldan pa'i sems la 'gal ba nyid kyis bdag tu lta ba skye ba'i go skabs med pa de bzhin du bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems la yang bdag med par lta ba skye ba'i go skabsüîΩmed de / @296a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar bdag med pa mthong ba dang ldan pa'i sems la 'gal ba nyid kyis bdag tu lta ba skye ba'i go skabs med pa de bzhin du bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems la yang bdag med par lta ba skye ba'i go skabs med de / @296a * //
translated: Just as the insight into selflessness is incompatible with the arising of the view of self, in the same way, the view of self is incompatible with the arising of the insight into selflessness.

original: 'gal ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the incompatibility is the same.

original: de lta yin dang bdag med pa mthong ba 'ga' yang mi srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bdag med pa mthong ba 'ga' yang mi srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then since the insight into selflessness would be impossible, the reason would not be established.

original: bdag med pa mthong ba srid pa de lta na yang 'di dag 'gal na yang shin tu gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba srid pa de lta na yang 'di dag 'gal na yang shin tu gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were possible to see selflessness, if these two were contradictory, still they would not be established as the thing that is to be refuted and the refuting agent.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang bzhin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang bzhin nam /
translated: They are like attachment and hatred,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag bzhin no //
translated: or like pleasure and pain.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la gtan du tha dad pa bsgrub par 'dod pa yin gyi dus de tsam zhig mngon sum du smra ba tsam ni ma yin pa des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la gtan du tha dad pa bsgrub par 'dod pa yin gyi dus de tsam zhig mngon sum du smra ba tsam ni ma yin pa des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is the complete separation of these two that is asserted, not just the mere nonsimultaneity of their perception, therefore the reason is not unestablished.

original: nyi ma re re dngos po mtha' dag la yod pa'i bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid du rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa yang ma nyams pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sgrub par byed pa mthong ste /
analyzed: nyi ma re re dngos po mtha' dag la yod pa'i bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid du rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa yang ma nyams pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sgrub par byed pa mthong ste /
translated: Also, the establishment of the nonexistence of self in all things by the inference of each individual thing is not impaired, because the proponent is seen to be under the influence of attachment and so on that have not been eliminated.

original: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, you may think that the reason is not established.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i rgyud la bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba mi srid pa yin na de'i tshe bdag med pa mthong ba skye ba'i go skabs med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i rgyud la bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba mi srid pa yin na de'i tshe bdag med pa mthong ba skye ba'i go skabs med par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were impossible for the thought of selflessness to arise in the mindstream of one who has not abandoned the afflictions, then there would be no opportunity for the arising of the view of selflessness.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad la bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du phyogs pa yod pa re zhig nyams su myong bas grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad la bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du phyogs pa yod pa re zhig nyams su myong bas grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: But since it is a fact of experience that the thought of selflessness can arise in everyone,

original: de nyid kyang goms pas 'dod pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba srid pa'i phyir tha mar gsal bar snang ba nyid dang / tshad mas dag pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid kyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar bdag med pa mthong ba skye ba mi srid pa yin /
analyzed: de nyid kyang goms pas 'dod pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba srid pa'i phyir tha mar gsal bar snang ba nyid dang / tshad mas dag pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid kyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ji ltar bdag med pa mthong ba skye ba mi srid pa yin /
translated: it is possible for it to reach its culmination, just as the thoughts of the desirous person can. Therefore, it is clear that the view of selflessness can arise, and since it apprehends an object that is established by valid cognition, it is a case of direct perception. So how could it be impossible for the view of selflessness to arise?

original: gzhan yang mun pa dang ldan pa'i yul du dus phyis snang bar 'gyur ba'i go skabs srid pa bzhin du 'dir yang ci'i phyir srid par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang mun pa dang ldan pa'i yul du dus phyis snang bar 'gyur ba'i go skabs srid pa bzhin du 'dir yang ci'i phyir srid par mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, just as it is possible for light to appear later in a place that is now dark, why wouldn‚Äôt it be possible here?

original: gang zhig de lta bur gyur pa'i mngon sum gyis shes pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig de lta bur gyur pa'i mngon sum gyis shes pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: What is the result of the knowledge of such direct perception?

original: 'dra bar de nyid sgom pa 'ba' zhig la srid pa ma yin no zhes de ltar yang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar de nyid sgom pa 'ba' zhig la srid pa ma yin no zhes de ltar yang brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible that it is only the meditation on that which is similar.

original: gang gi phyir mi srid pa'i rgyu 'di ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa la don du gnyer ba nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir sgom pa la sbyor ba med pa'i rgyu thams cad don du mi gnyer ba nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi srid pa'i rgyu 'di ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa la don du gnyer ba nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir sgom pa la sbyor ba med pa'i rgyu thams cad don du mi gnyer ba nyid yin nam /
translated: Because it is impossible, one who is endowed with such reasoning would not engage in the pursuit of the object. Therefore, the reason for not applying oneself to meditation is that one does not pursue the object.

original: don du gnyer ba yod na yang ngo bo nyid mi shes pa spong bar mi nus pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas rtag pa dang ldan pa mi 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba yod na yang ngo bo nyid mi shes pa spong bar mi nus pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pas rtag pa dang ldan pa mi 'jug pa'am /
translated: Even if one does pursue the object, because one cannot eliminate the unknown essential nature, one who does not know the essential nature of the object to be eliminated does not engage in the pursuit of the object.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo shes @296b pa yod na yang rtag pa spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams rtag par mthong ba na de spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa mi rtsol ba dang mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang rang dbang can ni rgyun chad par
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo shes @296b pa yod na yang rtag pa spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams rtag par mthong ba na de spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa mi rtsol ba dang mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang rang dbang can ni rgyun chad par
translated: Therefore, when faults are seen to be permanent, one does not strive to abandon them. If they are impermanent, then even if they are independent, it is impossible for their continuum to be severed.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir 'di dag rgyu nyid du rtogs na mi 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir 'di dag rgyu nyid du rtogs na mi 'jug pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if one realizes that they are causes, one does not engage in them.üîΩEven if one possesses their causes, one cannot abandon them, just as one cannot abandon the internal bases.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin na yang gzhi mi shes pa'i nang bzhin du spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rgyu rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i don du ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid yin na yang gzhi mi shes pa'i nang bzhin du spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rgyu rang gi ngo bo ma nges pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i don du ma grub pa'am /
translated: Therefore, since the cause of those is uncertain, it is not established as the object of meditation.

original: de'i rgyu yongs su shes pa yin du chug mod //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yongs su shes pa yin du chug mod //
translated: Even if one understands the cause of those,

original: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa ni gegs byar mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rgyu rtag pa'o snyam du rtogs nas de spang bar bya ba'i don du rtog pa sngon du gtang ba dag mi spro ba'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa ni gegs byar mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rgyu rtag pa'o snyam du rtogs nas de spang bar bya ba'i don du rtog pa sngon du gtang ba dag mi spro ba'am /
translated: since a complete cause cannot be obstructed, one realizes that its cause is permanent and one does not strive to abandon it.

original: de'i rgyu mi rtag pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mi rtag pa yin na yang /
translated: And even if its cause is impermanent,

original: rang bzhin ni spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams srog chags kyi chos nyid du rig nas 'bad pa mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams srog chags kyi chos nyid du rig nas 'bad pa mi byed pa'am /
translated: since its nature cannot be eliminated, one would know that faults are the nature of living beings and would not make an effort to eliminate them.

original: skyon rnams rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid yin na yang zang ba'i thabs mi srid pa'i phyir mi 'dug pa'am ste /
analyzed: skyon rnams rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid yin na yang zang ba'i thabs mi srid pa'i phyir mi 'dug pa'am ste /
translated: Or, even if faults are not the nature of living beings, since there is no way to eliminate them, one would not make an effort to eliminate them.

original: gang gi phyir thabs ma tshang ba'i thabs las byung ba nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩthabs yod na yang rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi shes pa ni nyams su len pa mi srid pa'i phyir de yongs su shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir nan tan du sgrub par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thabs ma tshang ba'i thabs las byung ba nyid yod pa ni ma yin no // thabs yod na yang rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi shes pa ni nyams su len pa mi srid pa'i phyir de yongs su shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir nan tan du sgrub par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because it is impossible for something to arise from a method that is incomplete.üîΩEven if there is a method, if one does not fully understand its nature, it is impossible to practice it, and therefore it is impossible to fully understand it.

original: yongs su shes na yang mchongs pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par mi gnas pa nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: yongs su shes na yang mchongs pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par mi gnas pa nyid kyis sam /
translated: Or, even if one fully understands it, since one does not remain in a special state, like jumping, one would not make an effort to practice it.

original: yang na skye ba gzhan mi srid pas bsgom pa shin tu rab kyi mthar phyin pa mi srid pa'i phyir mngon par brtson pa dang mi ldan pa'am /üîΩshin tu goms pa mthar phyin pa srid pa'i phyir gnyen po skyes pas nyes pa rnams zad pa de lta na yang zangs ma la sogs pa'i sra ba bzhin du nyes pa 'byung ba srid pa na yang 'bad pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod
analyzed: yang na skye ba gzhan mi srid pas bsgom pa shin tu rab kyi mthar phyin pa mi srid pa'i phyir mngon par brtson pa dang mi ldan pa'am / shin tu goms pa mthar phyin pa srid pa'i phyir gnyen po skyes pas nyes pa rnams zad pa de lta na yang zangs ma la sogs pa'i sra ba bzhin du nyes pa 'byung ba srid pa na yang 'bad pa rtsom par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod
translated: Or else, since other births are impossible, it is impossible to perfect the meditation of the supreme training.

original: par bya dgos te /
analyzed: par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to say that since the faults are exhausted by the arising of the antidote, even though it is possible that faults arise like the hardness of copper and so on, one does not begin to strive.

original: de la re zhig don du mi gnyer ba nyid ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig don du mi gnyer ba nyid ni ma grub ste /
translated: First, it is not established that they do not strive for the goal.

original: 'di ltar re zhig gang zhig skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i yid can 'khor ba las skrag pa na bdag nyid las de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir don du gnyer ba nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub du nges par 'gyur ba de dag
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig gang zhig skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i yid can 'khor ba las skrag pa na bdag nyid las de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir don du gnyer ba nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub du nges par 'gyur ba de dag
translated: Thus, first, when those whose minds are tormented by the suffering of birth and so on fear samsara, they definitely strive for the enlightenment of sravakas and so on in order to pacify that suffering.

original: ni 'khor ba las 'jig pa nyid bdag med pa sgom pa don du gnyer ba'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: ni 'khor ba las 'jig pa nyid bdag med pa sgom pa don du gnyer ba'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: The reason for seeking to meditate on selflessness is to destroy samsara.

original: gang dag rigs kyi khyad par las rang bzhin gyis gzhan la phan par byed pa la mngon par dga' ba /
analyzed: gang dag rigs kyi khyad par las rang bzhin gyis gzhan la phan par byed pa la mngon par dga' ba /
translated: Those who naturally delight in benefiting others due to the particular type of lineage they possess

original: 'gro ba 'du byed la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba mthong nas @297a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'du byed la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba mthong nas @297a * //
translated: see that beings are oppressed by the suffering of contaminated action and so forth.

original: snying rjes gzhan gyi dbang du gyur bas de'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ba rnams bdag la chags pa bsal nas /
analyzed: snying rjes gzhan gyi dbang du gyur bas de'i sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ba rnams bdag la chags pa bsal nas /
translated: Out of compassion, they are motivated by others' suffering and, having dispelled attachment to self,

original: 'khor ba thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pas bskyab par bya ba'i don du smon lam btab pa de dag sgom pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni snying rje nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad bdag nyid du khas blangs pas bskyab par bya ba'i don du smon lam btab pa de dag sgom pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni snying rje nyid yin te /
translated: vow to protect all beings in samsara, accepting them as their own self. The reason for engaging in meditation is compassion itself.

original: lkog tu gyur ba'i thabs las byung ba de 'chad pa ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur ba'i thabs las byung ba de 'chad pa ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to explain the means of attaining that which is hidden.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pas gzhan la phan pa byed pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pas gzhan la phan pa byed pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na ma yin te /
translated: What is the purpose of the wise benefiting others?

original: de nyid dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dgos pa yin te /
translated: That is the purpose,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic of that is desire.

original: rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the consequence is that there is no thought,

original: bdag la phan pa byed pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan ni kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la phan pa byed pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan ni kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason for the adherence to the benefit of the self is the imagined grasping of self.

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa ni dam pa'i skye bo mtha' dag gi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa ni dam pa'i skye bo mtha' dag gi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The benefit of others is the desire of all holy beings, and it is in conformity with its result.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag gi 'di sgom pa la 'jug pa don du gnyer ba mi srid pa bstan par brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag gi 'di sgom pa la 'jug pa don du gnyer ba mi srid pa bstan par brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, you have begun to teach that it is impossible to strive for the practice of that.

original: de'i phyir gal te rtog pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur na ci'i phyir de tsam gyis de de la 'jug pa don du mi gnyer bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rtog pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur na ci'i phyir de tsam gyis de de la 'jug pa don du mi gnyer bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if there is no thought, why would one not strive for that practice?

original: de lta bas na gzhan la phan par bya ba'i don du 'ga' yang 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan la phan par bya ba'i don du 'ga' yang 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, no one engages in it for the sake of benefiting others.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid brjod par bya la de la yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid brjod par bya la de la yang bshad zin to //
translated: The reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause there is no purpose.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover, through the repeated practice of a lack of compassion, one would come to delight in the suffering of others and to take pleasure in the suffering of others, without any cause.

original: gzhan yang brtse ba med pa ches shin tu goms pa las goms pa rgyu med pa kho nar gzhan gyi sdug phongs la mngon par dga' zhing gzhan sdug bsngal bas bde ba 'ba' zhig dmigs pa de bzhin du dgos pa gzhan med na yang snying rje goms paüîΩ'ga' zhig gzhan bde ba la mngon par dga' zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang brtse ba med pa ches shin tu goms pa las goms pa rgyu med pa kho nar gzhan gyi sdug phongs la mngon par dga' zhing gzhan sdug bsngal bas bde ba 'ba' zhig dmigs pa de bzhin du dgos pa gzhan med na yang snying rje goms pa 'ga' zhig gzhan bde ba la mngon par dga' zhing /
translated: In the same way, through the repeated practice of compassion, even without any other purpose, one would come to delight in the happiness of others and to take pleasure in the happiness of others.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ci'i phyir mi srid /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ci'i phyir mi srid /
translated: Why is it impossible to say that someone would come to delight in the happiness of others and to suffer from the suffering of others?

original: rang gi nyes pa'i ngo bo yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa'i ngo bo yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one does not understand the nature of one‚Äôs own faults.

original: gang gi phyir mngon par chags pa dang khong khro ba dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyas pa dang / phrag dog dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par chags pa dang khong khro ba dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyas pa dang / phrag dog dang /
translated: Because the hosts of afflictions and branch afflictions such as attachment, anger, delusion, pride, conceit, envy,

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i chogs rang gi rang bzhin rig pa nyid du skye ba dang 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i chogs rang gi rang bzhin rig pa nyid du skye ba dang 'jig pa yin no //
translated: avarice, and so on, arise and cease in the very awareness of their own nature.

original: de dag rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not permanent,

original: res 'ga' ba nyid du rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid du rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are known to be intermittent.

original: @297b de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: @297b de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, they are not causeless,

original: rgyu med pa ni ltos pa med pa nyid kyis yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni ltos pa med pa nyid kyis yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a cause-less thing is not tenable as a restriction of place, time, and nature, since it is independent.

original: 'di las kyang de dag gi rtag pa'i rgyu nyid spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang de dag gi rtag pa'i rgyu nyid spangs pa yin te /
translated: And here, their permanence as a cause is also rejected,üîΩbecause a permanent thing cannot be a cause.

original: de'i rgyu dag la sogs pa rtag tu nye ba nyid kyi phyir dang / khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa ni lhan cig byed pa gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir de las byung ba rnams rtag tu cig char skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dag la sogs pa rtag tu nye ba nyid kyi phyir dang / khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa ni lhan cig byed pa gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir de las byung ba rnams rtag tu cig char skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their causes and so on are always present, and because that which cannot be improved upon does not depend on other cooperating causes, it follows that what arises from them would always arise simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir shugs kyis 'di dag gi rgyu ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shugs kyis 'di dag gi rgyu ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, by implication, their causes are impermanent.

original: 'di dag gi rgyu mi rtag pa yang rigs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs kyi rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi rgyu mi rtag pa yang rigs pa'i rang bzhin yin te / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs kyi rgyu ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nature of the cause of these is also reasonable,üîΩbecause the cause of the mass of faults such as attachment is the error of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the error of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and because it is the basis of the error of self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù that is the cause of the mass of faults such as attachment.

original: srog chags kyi chos nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi chos nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of living beings,

original: chos can de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of that phenomenon itself is not established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di gang ga chos su 'gyur ba'i srog chags zhes bya ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di gang ga chos su 'gyur ba'i srog chags zhes bya ba'i chos can 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no such thing as a living being that is the basis of the phenomena called desire and so on.

original: 'di ni rkyen nyid 'di ba tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: 'di ni rkyen nyid 'di ba tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: This is just the way it is: the mere occurrence of conditions.

original: chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ni rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ni rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The conventions of phenomena and their bearers are just superimpositions of conceptual thought.

original: ci ste 'di dag sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis sam /
translated: But if you say that these are the nature of mind,

original: der skyes pas srog chags kyi chos nyid yin pa de lta na yang ma grub pa dang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: der skyes pas srog chags kyi chos nyid yin pa de lta na yang ma grub pa dang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: or that they are the nature of living beings because they are born from that, then they are still unestablished and indefinite.

original: 'di ltar yul dang yul can gyi dngos por 'dod na sems ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang yul can gyi dngos por 'dod na sems ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If you assert that they are the nature of object and subject, then you must definitely accept that mind is the nature of apprehending objects.

original: de lta ma yin na yul dang shes pa dag yul can gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul dang shes pa dag yul can gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, objects and consciousnesses would not be the nature of the subject.

original: don mi 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du khas len na yang des de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'i bdag nyid des don de gzung bar bya ba yin na zhes brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: don mi 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du khas len na yang des de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'i bdag nyid des don de gzung bar bya ba yin na zhes brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: If you accept that the nature of consciousness is not to apprehend objects, then you must say that it is the nature of consciousness to apprehend objects in accordance with its own nature.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar 'di ltar 'dzin par 'gyur gal te med pa'i rnam pas de 'dzin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar 'di ltar 'dzin par 'gyur gal te med pa'i rnam pas de 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be said to apprehend objects? If it apprehends objects in the form of nonexistence,

original: de de lta na yul dang yul can gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar ji ltar shes pa don yul byed pa de ltar don ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de de lta na yul dang yul can gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro // 'di ltar ji ltar shes pa don yul byed pa de ltar don ni ma yin la /
translated: then it would not be the case that there is an object and a subject.

original: don ji ltar yin pa de ltar yul du byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji ltar yin pa de ltar yul du byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, consciousness does not make an existent object its object, nor does it make a nonexistent object its object.

original: des na shes pa rnams yul med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shes pa rnams yul med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, consciousness would be without an object.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ma grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ma grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all things would be unestablished.

original: de lta bas na 'di'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ni yang dag pa'i yul gyi rnam par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ni yang dag pa'i yul gyi rnam par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, it is established that the nature of consciousness is to apprehend the form of a real object.

original: yul gyi @298a * //
analyzed: yul gyi @298a * //
translated: The object is not consciousness.

original: rang bzhin gyi yang dag par yang skad cig ma dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yang dag par yang skad cig ma dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: The nature of the mind is also real in the sense of being momentary, selfless, and so on.

original: des na sems kyi rang bzhin bdag med par 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi bdag 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sems kyi rang bzhin bdag med par 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi bdag 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the mind is to apprehend selflessness, not to apprehend a self.

original: gang yang rmongs pa la rnams la 'di'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni shugs kyis glo bur ba'i rkyen gyi stobs nyid kyis yin no zhes gnas kyi /
analyzed: gang yang rmongs pa la rnams la 'di'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni shugs kyis glo bur ba'i rkyen gyi stobs nyid kyis yin no zhes gnas kyi /
translated: The nature that appears to the ignorant is due to the power of adventitious conditions.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te dper na thag pa la sprul du shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te dper na thag pa la sprul du shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not natural, like the perception of a snake in a rope.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa'i nad tshogs shin tu che ba yin na 'dis ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i nus pa rtsa ba nas 'don par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa'i nad tshogs shin tu che ba yin na 'dis ni bdag med pa mthong ba'i nus pa rtsa ba nas 'don par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even if the mass of afflictions is very great, this [mind] is capable of uprooting the capacity to see selflessness,

original: glo bur pa'i rkyen gyis byas pa nyid kyis de ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur pa'i rkyen gyis byas pa nyid kyis de ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is created by adventitious conditions, and it is not innate.

original: bdag med pa'i shes pa ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma'i grogs dang bcas pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'dra na yang bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag gi //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i shes pa ni rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma'i grogs dang bcas pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'dra na yang bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag gi //
translated: The cognition of selflessness is the nature of the mind, and since it is powerful because it is accompanied by valid knowledge, it is similar to the view of self in being powerful.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni de'i ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni de'i ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the antidote to the view of self.

original: de ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the opposite of that.

original: gang dag gi ltar na phyi rol gyi don med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin pa'i de'i lugs kyis shes pa'i rang bzhin ni bdag med pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin gyi bdag tu lta ba'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na phyi rol gyi don med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin pa'i de'i lugs kyis shes pa'i rang bzhin ni bdag med pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin gyi bdag tu lta ba'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: According to the system that asserts that external objects do not exist, the nature of cognition is only the nature of apprehending selflessness, it is not the nature of the view of self.

original: bdag de ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because that self does not exist.

original: 'di ltar gal te des yul med pa'i phyir shes pa de 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod na de gdon mi za bar rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te des yul med pa'i phyir shes pa de 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod na de gdon mi za bar rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, if one does not accept that cognition is the nature of apprehending itself because its object does not exist, then one must certainly accept that it is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan du shes pa rnam par gzhag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du shes pa rnam par gzhag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, consciousness would not be established.

original: bdag de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig par bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig par bya ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: And that self is to be known as having the nature of duality, etc., by means of a self that does not exist, and not otherwise,

original: skyon snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previously mentioned faults would ensue.

original: de lta bas na 'di dag srog chags kyi chos nyid du ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag srog chags kyi chos nyid du ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, these are not established as the nature of living beings.

original: des skyes pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rang bzhin du nyid du brtags pa na spong ba mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des skyes pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rang bzhin du nyid du brtags pa na spong ba mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that it is impossible to eliminate that which is imagined to be the intrinsic reality of that which is called ‚Äúproduced‚Äù by merely that much,

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not certain.

original: 'di ltar thag pa la sprul du shes pa skye la yang de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa skye ba la ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar thag pa la sprul du shes pa skye la yang de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa skye ba la ldog pa yin no //
translated: For example, the knowledge that a rope is a snake arises, but that is reversed when correct knowledge arises.

original: zad pa'i thabs mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zad pa'i thabs mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the means of eliminating it is impossible,

original: rang gi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por goms pa zad pa'i thabs nyid du srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por goms pa zad pa'i thabs nyid du srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the means of eliminating it is possible, namely, the cultivation of the nature that is incompatible with its cause.

original: 'di ltar gang dag rang rgyu dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin can goms pa srid pa de dag ni shin tu rgyun chad pa srid pa @298b yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag rang rgyu dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin can goms pa srid pa de dag ni shin tu rgyun chad pa srid pa @298b yin te /
translated: Thus, it is possible to completely eliminate those things that are habituated to a nature that is incompatible with their own cause.

original: dper na 'byung ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, this is like the elements, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi zad pa'i thabs srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi zad pa'i thabs srid pa yin no //
translated: Since desire, etc. are like that, it is possible to eliminate them.

original: de yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that this is not known,üîΩbecause it is clearly ascertained that the nature of the cause is just the complete knowledge of the thing that is the opposite of that, which has the aspect of the object.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nyid las de las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam pa can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de ni de'i gnyen po yin no zhes gsal bar nges pa'i phyir 'di dag gi bdag med pa mthong ba srid pa khoüîΩna yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nyid las de las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam pa can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de ni de'i gnyen po yin no zhes gsal bar nges pa'i phyir 'di dag gi bdag med pa mthong ba srid pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is only possible to see selflessness in these things,

original: de las bzlog pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyen po yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyen po yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it has been shown that it is the antidote, since it has the aspect of the object that is the opposite of that.

original: mchongs pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyad du 'phags par rnam par mi gnas pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mchongs pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyad du 'phags par rnam par mi gnas pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not like jumping, etc., because it is not a special non-abiding.

original: shes rab la sogs pa rnams ni snga ma snga ma goms pa bsgom pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis ma zhig pa nyid kyi phyir phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bad pa ni snga na med pa'i khyad par byed pa'i lus len pa'i phyir dang / rten brten pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa rnams ni snga ma snga ma goms pa bsgom pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis ma zhig pa nyid kyi phyir phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bad pa ni snga na med pa'i khyad par byed pa'i lus len pa'i phyir dang / rten brten pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Wisdom, etc., are not destroyed by the very nature of the cultivation of the prior practice, and the effort of the later is to take up a body that has a special non-prior distinction, and because of the support and the supported,

original: rigs mthun pa snga ma'i mthu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa snga ma'i mthu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of the power of the prior homogeneous type.

original: mchongs pa la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchongs pa la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Jumping, etc., are not like that. This will be explained later.

original: skye ba gzhan mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that another birth is impossible,

original: sngar skye ba'i rgyun bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar skye ba'i rgyun bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the stream of birth has already been established.

original: zangs ma la sogs pa'i sra ba bzhin nyes pa rnams kyang skye ba srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zangs ma la sogs pa'i sra ba bzhin nyes pa rnams kyang skye ba srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that faults are possible in birth, like the hardness of copper, etc.,üîΩbecause of the power of the prior homogeneous type.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i bdag med par lta ba gtan du de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba rtag tu mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i bdag med par lta ba gtan du de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba rtag tu mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the view of selflessness, which is incompatible with that, becomes its nature forever, and it is always inseparable from it.

original: zangs la sogs pa'i sra ba dang 'gal ba'i me gang yin pa de res 'ga' nye ba'i phyir sra ba la sogs pa de yod pa nyid na yod pa ma yin pas yang de dang bral ba'i phyir de skye bar rigs kyi dri ma rnams ni de ltaüîΩbu ma yin no //
analyzed: zangs la sogs pa'i sra ba dang 'gal ba'i me gang yin pa de res 'ga' nye ba'i phyir sra ba la sogs pa de yod pa nyid na yod pa ma yin pas yang de dang bral ba'i phyir de skye bar rigs kyi dri ma rnams ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: The fire that is incompatible with the solidity of copper, etc., sometimes approaches, and so the solidity, etc., does not exist when it exists, and so it is reasonable that it arises again, separated from it. But the defilements are not like that.

original: yang na sra ba dang bral ba na yang thal ba la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar nyes pa rnams kyang skye bar srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na sra ba dang bral ba na yang thal ba la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar nyes pa rnams kyang skye bar srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, even if they were separated from solidity, it would not follow that they are like ashes, etc., because they are not ascertained. So it is not possible that the faults definitely arise again.

original: de ltar shing la sogs pa me dang 'brel ba las thal bar 'gyur ba de dang bral ba ni slar snga ma'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyes pa rnams kyang yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shing la sogs pa me dang 'brel ba las thal bar 'gyur ba de dang bral ba ni slar snga ma'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyes pa rnams kyang yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Just as wood, etc., becomes ashes from contact with fire, and when separated from it, it does not revert to its former nature, so it is with the faults. Therefore, it is not ascertained.

original: gzhan yang glo bur ba nyid kyis sngar nus pa med pa'i dri ma rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bdag med pa de la gnod par ga la nus /
analyzed: gzhan yang glo bur ba nyid kyis sngar nus pa med pa'i dri ma rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i bdag med pa de la gnod par ga la nus /
translated: Moreover, how could adventitious stains that previously had no power to harm that selflessness which is the nature of the mind be able to harm it?

original: rang bzhin ni 'bad rtsol med par bzlog par nus pa ma yin la /üîΩthob par bya ba dang spang par bya @299a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni 'bad rtsol med par bzlog par nus pa ma yin la / thob par bya ba dang spang par bya @299a * //
translated: The nature cannot be averted without effort.üîΩIt is not reasonable to strive to abandon that which is to be attained and that which is to be abandoned

original: ba'i dngos po gang gi yon tan dang skyon mthong ba med par yang rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i len pa yang spangs pa'i 'bad par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba'i dngos po gang gi yon tan dang skyon mthong ba med par yang rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i len pa yang spangs pa'i 'bad par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: without seeing the good qualities and faults of any entity.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu nyes pa dag la yon tan du mthong ba'am gnyen po la skyon du mthong ba srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi skyes bu nyes pa dag la yon tan du mthong ba'am gnyen po la skyon du mthong ba srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for a person who has understanding to see faults as good qualities or to see antidotes as faults.

original: phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are nonerroneous.

original: ldan pa len pa yang spang ba phyin ci log pa'i blo can rnams nyes pa med pa'i dngos po skyon can du 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ldan pa len pa yang spang ba phyin ci log pa'i blo can rnams nyes pa med pa'i dngos po skyon can du 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: Those who have the understanding of abandonment do not apprehend a nondefective entity as defective.

original: skyon can yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon can yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that one holds the faulty to be endowed with good qualities.

original: la lar bdag med par lta ba skyon can du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: la lar bdag med par lta ba skyon can du yang ma yin te /
translated: In some cases, the view of selflessness is not faulty,

original: nye bar mtshon pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with good qualities by virtue of being free from all that is to be illustrated.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gegs byed pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gegs byed pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is free from all stains such as attachment, there is no harm that obstructs the vision of the perfect truth.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas dkris pas byas pa'i lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba yang med cing skye ba dang 'brel ba ni na ba dang rga ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas dkris pas byas pa'i lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba yang med cing skye ba dang 'brel ba ni na ba dang rga ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is also no harm of the torment of body and mind that is produced by the entanglement of attachment and so on. And there is no connection with birth, such as sickness and aging,

original: skye ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are no afflictions that are the cause of birth.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba longs spyod pa bzhin du sun phyung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba yang med de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bde ba longs spyod pa bzhin du sun phyung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba yang med de /
translated: And there is no harm to be avoided, as there is in the case of the enjoyment of contaminated pleasures.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba'i rol gcig tu ches skye bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba'i rol gcig tu ches skye bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it does not produce the single taste of the bliss of tranquility.

original: de'i phyir 'di spang ba'i don du 'bad pa med par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di spang ba'i don du 'bad pa med par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to strive for its abandonment without striving.

original: 'on kyang gal te byed na mi spang ba'i don kho nar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te byed na mi spang ba'i don kho nar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one does so, it will be done only for the sake of non-abandonment.

original: blo ni rang bzhin gyis yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni rang bzhin gyis yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the mind naturally grasps the side of virtue.

original: nyes pa rnams blang ba'i don du 'bad pa byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams blang ba'i don du 'bad pa byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And one does not strive for the sake of taking up faults,

original: de dag ni nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa nyid kyi skyon can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa nyid kyi skyon can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are faulty in that they are the basis of all harms.

original: de lta bas na bdag med pa sgom pa srid pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag med pa sgom pa srid pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the meditation on selflessness is possible,

original: rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir de yang gsal bar snang ba'i 'bras bu can du mthong ste /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir de yang gsal bar snang ba'i 'bras bu can du mthong ste /
translated: and it is seen to have a clear result, because it goes to the furthest limit.

original: dper na 'dod pas gdungs pa 'dod pa goms par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pas gdungs pa 'dod pa goms par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of one who is tormented by desire and who cultivates desire.

original: 'di ltar 'khrul ba dang bcas pa'i gzhon nu ma mthong bas ya mtshan skyes so zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshig dang bsams pa'i rjes su byed pa'i lus kyi bya ba 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khrul ba dang bcas pa'i gzhon nu ma mthong bas ya mtshan skyes so zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshig dang bsams pa'i rjes su byed pa'i lus kyi bya ba 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚ÄúI am amazed because I have seen a young woman who is endowed with error‚Äù is an action of the body that conforms to such a statement and thought.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished nor is it indefinite.

original: gang gi phyir bdag med pa mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyis stobs dang ldan pa yin @299b la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag med pa mthong ba ni yang dag pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyis stobs dang ldan pa yin @299b la /
translated: Because the vision of selflessness is powerful, since it is the object of the real meaning,

original: bdag tu lta ba ni bzlog pa'i phyir bzlog pa yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni bzlog pa'i phyir bzlog pa yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po yin no //
translated: and because the vision of self is to be averted, since it is the object of the counteragent, it is the case that the two are mutually exclusive and a homogeneous and heterogeneous cause.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case with attachment and aversion.

original: gnyi ga yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa la rag las pas 'jug pa'i phyir de dag la 'gal ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa la rag las pas 'jug pa'i phyir de dag la 'gal ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because both are engaged in apprehending a non-existent object, there is no such thing as a discordant factor or an antidote that has a reason for apprehending a contradictory object.

original: phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pas byas pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pas byas pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no such thing as a distinction made by error or non-error,

original: gnyi ga yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are erroneous.

original: 'di dag 'gal ba yang grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag 'gal ba yang grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any such thing as a contradiction between them,

original: gnyi ga yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i skye gnas can yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i skye gnas can yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both have the same origin in the apprehension of self, and because they are cause and effect.

original: 'di ltar bdag la chags pa yod na de la gnod pa la zhe sdang 'byung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la chags pa yod na de la gnod pa la zhe sdang 'byung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when there is attachment to self, there is aversion to what is harmful to it, but not otherwise.

original: rgyu tha mi dad pa bdag gam rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag la /
analyzed: rgyu tha mi dad pa bdag gam rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dag la /
translated: There is no difference in the cause, whether it be self or the effect of a cause.

original: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The object that is harmed and the object that harms are not logical.

original: dper na bud shing gcig las byung ba'i me dang du ba bzhin nam /
analyzed: dper na bud shing gcig las byung ba'i me dang du ba bzhin nam /
translated: For example, it is like fire and smoke arising from the same fuel.

original: yang na bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bag chags bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bag chags bzhin te /
translated: Or it is like the grasping of ‚Äúmine‚Äù and the latent tendencies.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: cig car mi skye ba ni de'i nye bar len pa'i sems can cig car rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis 'phen par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car mi skye ba ni de'i nye bar len pa'i sems can cig car rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis 'phen par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not arise simultaneously because the mind that appropriates them cannot project two minds of the same type simultaneously.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ngag kyang phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ngag kyang phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, pleasure and pain are not mutually exclusive.

original: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni rnam pa gnyis te yid las byung ba dang / yul las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni rnam pa gnyis te yid las byung ba dang / yul las skyes pa'o //
translated: Thus, pleasure and pain are of two types: those that arise from the mind and those that arise from objects.

original: de la re zhig gang dag yid las byung ba dag ni sdang ba dang chags pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag yid las byung ba dag ni sdang ba dang chags pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa nyid kyis so //
translated: First, those that arise from the mind are established as the same in terms of being established and being pleasure because they are concomitant with attachment and aversion that are the opposites of attachment and aversion.

original: de bzhin du phyin ci log nyid dang / tha mi dad pa'i bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i skye gnas gcig pa can nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba'i srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyin ci log nyid dang / tha mi dad pa'i bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i skye gnas gcig pa can nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba'i srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the self is not contradictory with the self that is the nature of error, the self that is the nature of grasping, the self that is the same in terms of the origin of grasping the self, and the self that is the nature of cause and effect.

original: gang yang yul las skyes pa de dag kyang phan tshun rgyu tha dad par ma nges pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang yul las skyes pa de dag kyang phan tshun rgyu tha dad par ma nges pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, those that arise from objects are not contradictory because it is not ascertained that their causes are different.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na las bde ba 'byung ba de nyid las shin tu bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yang yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi rgyu dang tha dad par nges pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na las bde ba 'byung ba de nyid las shin tu bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yang yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi rgyu dang tha dad par nges pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because pleasure arises from that very thing from which pain arises, it is not ascertained that their causes are different.

original: de ltar bdag med par mthong ba dang cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag med par mthong ba dang cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, seeing selflessness and the opposite of that are not the same.

original: gzhan yang 'di gnyis gang yang yul gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba nyid kyi @300a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di gnyis gang yang yul gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba nyid kyi @300a * //
translated: Moreover, these two arise by the power of objects.

original: stobs mtshungs pa nyid yin gyi lam dang nyes pa bdag ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: stobs mtshungs pa nyid yin gyi lam dang nyes pa bdag ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The path is equal in strength to the faults, but the faults are not equal in strength to the path.

original: lam kho na yang dag pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lam kho na yang dag pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Only the path is the possessor of the object of the true meaning, and so it is strong. The faults are not.

original: gzhan yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni yun ring por mi gnas pa can yin gyi bdag med par da lta ba ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni yun ring por mi gnas pa can yin gyi bdag med par da lta ba ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, pleasure and pain do not last long, but the self does not exist in the present in that way.

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa de nyid kyis rang gi dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa de nyid kyis rang gi dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has been explained above that it is not separate from itself by its very nature.

original: de bas na 'khrul ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no error.

original: cig car ni skye ba'i rgyu ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: cig car ni skye ba'i rgyu ni bshad zin to //
translated: The cause of simultaneous arising has already been explained.

original: gang yang rjes su dpag pas dngos po ma lus pa gnas pa'i bdag med pa nges par gzung ba rnams la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba yin no zhes zer ba de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su dpag pas dngos po ma lus pa gnas pa'i bdag med pa nges par gzung ba rnams la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba yin no zhes zer ba de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable for those who assert that all things are devoid of self by inference to claim that desire and so on arise in them.

original: gang gi phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis bdag med pa'i dngos po mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa dang tshad mas grub pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyis kyang ma 'khrul ba'i bdag med par mthong
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis bdag med pa'i dngos po mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa dang tshad mas grub pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa nyid kyis kyang ma 'khrul ba'i bdag med par mthong
translated: Because the nonconceptual consciousness that perceives the reality of selflessness through the clear appearance that arises from meditation is a valid cognition, it is non mistaken.

original: ba de ni bdag tu lta ba rtsad nas gtan 'byin pas gnyen por brjod kyi thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba de ni bdag tu lta ba rtsad nas gtan 'byin pas gnyen por brjod kyi thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The view of self is completely eradicated by seeing selflessness, so that is called the antidote, but the view of self that arises from hearing and contemplation is not.

original: 'di ltar thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir dri ma rnams ni rtsa ba shin tu brtan pa'i phyir rim gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'phel bas sgrib pa na zad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir dri ma rnams ni rtsa ba shin tu brtan pa'i phyir rim gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'phel bas sgrib pa na zad pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the taints have been habituated since beginningless time, they are very stable and are gradually exhausted by increasing the opposing factor.

original: lan cig thos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lan cig thos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not exhausted by hearing once.

original: dper na grang ba'i reg pa med la reg pa tsam gyis ldog pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grang ba'i reg pa med la reg pa tsam gyis ldog pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cold sensation is not absent, but the mere sensation is not reversed.

original: gang gis 'khrul bar 'gyur ba thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i bdag med pa'i shes pa mngon du gyur ba na 'dod chags la sogs pas 'byung ba grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis 'khrul bar 'gyur ba thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i bdag med pa'i shes pa mngon du gyur ba na 'dod chags la sogs pas 'byung ba grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: When the knowledge of selflessness that arises from hearing and contemplation becomes manifest, the elements that are produced by attachment and so on are not established.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes nas mi sdug pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i stobs des bde bar gshegs pa rnams spang bar byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes nas mi sdug pa la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i stobs des bde bar gshegs pa rnams spang bar byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, when the entanglements of attachment and so on arise, the power of attention to foulness and so on causes the Sugatas to abandon them.

original: de nyid kyi 'di dag dbang du gyur pa nus pa nyams pa med par ma grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'di dag dbang du gyur pa nus pa nyams pa med par ma grub bo //
translated: They are not established as being under the control of those entanglements, since their power is not impaired.

original: 'di dag bdag med pa mthong ba dang 'gal na yang de nyid kyi phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
