analyzed: 'di dag bdag med pa mthong ba dang 'gal na yang de nyid kyi phyir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Even though they are incompatible with the vision of selflessness, they are still posited as such,

original: de mngon du phyogs na 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon du phyogs na 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they diminish when the vision of selflessness is manifest.

original: gang dag gang nye bar blangs pa las 'grib pa'i chos can de dag ni de shin tu 'phel ba med par rgyun 'chad pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gang nye bar blangs pa las 'grib pa'i chos can de dag ni de shin tu 'phel ba med par rgyun 'chad pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Those that diminish when something is appropriated are also interrupted when that increases.

original: ji ltar chu la sogs pa 'phel ba na me 'bar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la sogs pa 'phel ba na me 'bar ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as when water, etc. increase, the fire blazes.

original: nyes pa rnams kyang bdag med pa'i shes pa nye bar blangs @300b pa las 'grib pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de shin tu 'phel ba na ji ltar gnas pa rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyang bdag med pa'i shes pa nye bar blangs @300b pa las 'grib pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de shin tu 'phel ba na ji ltar gnas pa rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: And the faults are also subject to decrease when the knowledge of selflessness is taken up; so how can it be that when it is greatly increased, one will not find a state of abiding?

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not contradictory, because it exists in the similar instance.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs par bsgrubs nas shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs par bsgrubs nas shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus established the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions, in order to establish the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience, he says:

original: khyad par mngon sum byas pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyad par mngon sum byas pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the distinctive is actualized.

original: mngon sum du byas pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Actualized means actualization.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: bdag med par zhes bya bar go ste /
analyzed: bdag med par zhes bya bar go ste /
translated: It is said to be selflessness.

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the present topic.

original: de'i khyad par ni rnam pa mang du thabs mong pos dus mang po rnam pa thams cad kyis te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni rnam pa mang du thabs mong pos dus mang po rnam pa thams cad kyis te /
translated: And it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.

original: de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yon tan dang skyon dang shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yon tan dang skyon dang shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos la sogs pa bdag med pa mthong na yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos la sogs pa bdag med pa mthong na yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: And it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.

original: rnam pa de lta bu phyis goms pa'i khyad par med pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu phyis goms pa'i khyad par med pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.

original: sbyor bzhi gang zhig gus pas rgyun ma chad pa'i dus ring po'i khyad par gyis goms pa de ni gzung bar bya ba thag ring du 'jug pa bzhin du snang ba'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor bzhi gang zhig gus pas rgyun ma chad pa'i dus ring po'i khyad par gyis goms pa de ni gzung bar bya ba thag ring du 'jug pa bzhin du snang ba'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: And it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.

original: 'di lta ste dper na 'dod pas gdungs pa 'dod pa goms par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na 'dod pas gdungs pa 'dod pa goms par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: And it is complete because it is endowed with all the aspects.üîΩAnd it is complete because

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad la yod pa'i bdag med pa bsgom pa'i snying rje can yang ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gsum dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad la yod pa'i bdag med pa bsgom pa'i snying rje can yang ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gsum dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The one who has compassion for the selflessness that exists in all things in all modes also has the three special qualities as explained. This is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished,

original: snying rje can ni don du gnyer ba nyid kyis de ltar 'jug pa srid do zhes bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje can ni don du gnyer ba nyid kyis de ltar 'jug pa srid do zhes bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been established that the compassionate one engages in that way by the very fact of his striving.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it uncertain,

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad la yod pa'i bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad la yod pa'i bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni chos can yin la /
translated: because the mental consciousness that has the selflessness that exists in all things as its object is the subject.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gsum dang ldan pa'i goms pa dang 'brel pa'i rgyus gsal bar snang ba nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gsum dang ldan pa'i goms pa dang 'brel pa'i rgyus gsal bar snang ba nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: The appearance of clarity by the cause of being connected with cultivation that has the three special qualities as explained is the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'dis ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos la khyab ba grub te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'dis ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos la khyab ba grub te /
translated: This probandum is established as pervading the probandum,

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid ni rgyun gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid ni rgyun gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere appearance of clarity does not depend on another continuum.

original: de lta yin dang shugs las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis khyab pa grub pa yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir dngos po thams cad la yod pa'i bdag med pa la sogs pa'i yid kyi chos can la gsal @301a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang shugs las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis khyab pa grub pa yin te / gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad la yod pa'i bdag med pa la sogs pa'i yid kyi chos can la gsal @301a * //
translated: If that is so, then it is established by implication that omniscience is pervaded by it.

original: bar snang gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i thams cad mkhyen pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bar snang gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i thams cad mkhyen pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the mere appearance of clarity of the mental phenomenon of selflessness and so on that exists in all things is itself omniscience, it is not anything else.

original: 'di ltar bsgom pa la bsgom par bya ba'i dngos po'i gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis spyir khyab pa grub pa na shugs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis kyang khyab par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgom pa la bsgom par bya ba'i dngos po'i gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis spyir khyab pa grub pa na shugs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis kyang khyab par grub pa yin te /
translated: Thus, when the mere appearance of clarity of the object of meditation is established as pervading meditation in general, then it is established by implication that omniscience is also pervaded by it.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos can las gzhan la gsal bar snang ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos can las gzhan la gsal bar snang ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere appearance of clarity of anything other than the phenomenon in question is impossible.

original: 'dis ni 'dir yod par sgrub pa la skyon smras pa gang yin pa de dag gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dir yod par sgrub pa la skyon smras pa gang yin pa de dag gsal ba yin te /
translated: This clarifies the faults that have been stated in the proof of existence here.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang rab tu grags pa'i chos can yid la gsal bar snang ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de ltar rnam pa 'dis bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / khyad par mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang rab tu grags pa'i chos can yid la gsal bar snang ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de ltar rnam pa 'dis bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / khyad par mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because of the proof of the existence of omniscience, and because of the proof of the clarity of the well-known subject, and because of the proof by this mode, and because of the actualization of the distinction,

original: lus ngag yid gsum dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa'i bag chags rnams spangs pa sgrib pa gnyis spang bar grub po //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa'i bag chags rnams spangs pa sgrib pa gnyis spang bar grub po //
translated: the elimination of the two obscurations is established, which is the elimination of the habitual tendencies that pervade the characteristics incompatible with the three‚Äîbody, speech, and mind.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid grub po //
translated: Therefore, omniscience is established, being completely liberated from all obscurations.

original: gal te 'di snyam du spyir grub kyang bde bar gshegs pa ni ma grub po snyam du sems na /üîΩ'di yang / bde bar gshegs pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du spyir grub kyang bde bar gshegs pa ni ma grub po snyam du sems na / 'di yang / bde bar gshegs pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúAlthough this is established in general, the Sugata is not established,‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then this is also stated in the lines beginning with ‚ÄúThe Sugata himself is asserted.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di bde bar gshegs pa kho na yin par grub par 'dod de /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di bde bar gshegs pa kho na yin par grub par 'dod de /
translated: We accept that the Omniscience just explained is the Sugata alone,

original: ser skya la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not Kapila and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thog mar bdag med gsung phyir ro //
analyzed: thog mar bdag med gsung phyir ro //
translated: Because he first taught selflessness.

original: de skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: That is taught as follows:

original: gang gi phung po la sogs pa bstan pa'i don du dngos por thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad thog mar dngos po bdag med pa 'di yang sgrogs par grub pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par de nyid dang por chos thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i rab tu byed
analyzed: gang gi phung po la sogs pa bstan pa'i don du dngos por thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad thog mar dngos po bdag med pa 'di yang sgrogs par grub pa'i skyes bu'i khyad par de nyid dang por chos thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i rab tu byed
translated: The one who, for the sake of teaching the aggregates and so on, first proclaimed this selflessness of things, which is the selflessness of all things in all ways, is the one who is the special person who is the one who first proclaimed the selflessness of all things in all ways.

original: pa'i bdag med pa sgrogs pa'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las kho bo cag gis bde bar gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: pa'i bdag med pa sgrogs pa'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las kho bo cag gis bde bar gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: From the result of that proclamation, we call him the Sugata.

original: de'i nye bar bstan pa 'dis blang ba dang dor ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa bstan pa ma lus pa'i ye shes bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i nye bar bstan pa 'dis blang ba dang dor ba'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa bstan pa ma lus pa'i ye shes bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: By this teaching of his, he teaches the reality of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, together with the means, and he establishes the wisdom that is the means to that.

original: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'di thams cad mkhyen pa dang tshad mar grub pa yin pas des gsungs pa bsgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyar ba yin gyi srin pu'i grangs la sogs pa mkhyen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'di thams cad mkhyen pa dang tshad mar grub pa yin pas des gsungs pa bsgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyar ba yin gyi srin pu'i grangs la sogs pa mkhyen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because he possesses that transcendent wisdom, and because he is omniscient and authoritative, those who wish to practice what he taught should practice it, but not because he knows the number of rakshasas and so on.

original: 'on kyang srin pu'i grangs la sogs pa la yang de'i ye shes srid par sgrub par @301b bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang srin pu'i grangs la sogs pa la yang de'i ye shes srid par sgrub par @301b bya ba yin gyi /
translated: However, it is established that it is possible for him to know the number of rakshasas and so on.

original: de kho na nyid bstan pa ma lus pa mkhyen pa ni gtso bor yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bstan pa ma lus pa mkhyen pa ni gtso bor yin te /
translated: It is primary that he knows all the teachings on reality.

original: 'di ltar gsung rab la theg pa gsum gyi yul can bstan na yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bden pa bstan pa ni tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / thabs sna tshogs kyis bden pa bzhi gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir dang / tshad mas mi slu ba'i bdag med ston pa pos bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes gang la grub pa'i ston pa po de nyid snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'gal ba ston pas cha shas la yang ye shes kyis 'di'i ma lus pa'i ye shes
analyzed: 'di ltar gsung rab la theg pa gsum gyi yul can bstan na yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bden pa bstan pa ni tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / thabs sna tshogs kyis bden pa bzhi gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir dang / tshad mas mi slu ba'i bdag med ston pa pos bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ye shes gang la grub pa'i ston pa po de nyid snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'gal ba ston pas cha shas la yang ye shes kyis 'di'i ma lus pa'i ye shes
translated: The Teacher who has the wisdom that knows the reality of selflessness is also the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows everything without exception, because he is the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows everything without exception, since he is the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows the reality of selflessness.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /üîΩrnam pa thams cad mi shes pa ston pa'i nus pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ma lus pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te / rnam pa thams cad mi shes pa ston pa'i nus pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ma lus pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to be inferred.üîΩBecause he is the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows the reality of selflessness, he is the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows everything without exception, because he is the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows the reality of selflessness, since he is the Teacher who has the wisdom that knows the reality of selflessness.

original: skyon dang yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad mi shes pa dang de ston pa la mi mkhas pa ni de ltar ston par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad mi shes pa dang de ston pa la mi mkhas pa ni de ltar ston par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: One who does not know all the aspects of faults and qualities and is not skilled in teaching them does not teach in this way.

original: rig byed las mkhyen nas ston par mdzad do zhes kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed las mkhyen nas ston par mdzad do zhes kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that he taught after learning from the Vedas,

original: de ni skyes bus byas pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyes bus byas pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because it has already been established that they were composed by a person.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das ni ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mu stegs byed mtha' dag gi spyi bor bzhugs so zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das ni ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mu stegs byed mtha' dag gi spyi bor bzhugs so zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the BhagavƒÅn is the one who sits at the head of all tƒ´rthikas because he possesses a special exalted wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig gzhan dang mtshungs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig gzhan dang mtshungs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the BhagavƒÅn, who possesses the special exalted wisdom as it has been explained, is not the same as others,

original: tshad mas mi slu ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshad mas mi slu ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúbecause he is not deceived by valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no reason at all to establish that he possesses a special exalted wisdom,

original: gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba ni tshig / ces bya ba'i 'bras bu nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba ni tshig / ces bya ba'i 'bras bu nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur la /
translated: The result itself is the reason.

original: de yang 'di dag ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i don ston par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di las de dag shes pa khyad du 'phags pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'di dag ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i don ston par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di las de dag shes pa khyad du 'phags pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since they teach a meaning that is contradicted by valid cognition, how could they be understood to be superior knowledge?

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung yang tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung yang tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The statements of the Sugata are also contradicted by valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs /üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa dang ni rjes mthun thabs / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúconnection‚Äù and so on.

original: 'brel pa ni tshig rnams don gcig la sdud pas phan tshun 'brel pa yin gyi se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag bzhin du ma 'brel pa ma yin no //üîΩrjes mthun ni sgrub par nus pa nyid kyi bdag med pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan @302a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni tshig rnams don gcig la sdud pas phan tshun 'brel pa yin gyi se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag bzhin du ma 'brel pa ma yin no // rjes mthun ni sgrub par nus pa nyid kyi bdag med pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan @302a * //
translated: Connection is the mutual connection of words by their inclusion in a single meaning. It is not the case that they are unconnected, like the words ‚Äúten pomegranates‚Äù and so on.

original: nyid kyi thabs nye bar bstan pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi thabs nye bar bstan pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúaccord‚Äù refers to that which teaches the method of the characteristics of what is to be accomplished, such as the meditation on selflessness.

original: dug zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'jog po'i gtsug gi rgyan gyi man ngag bzhin du thabs des sgrub par mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dug zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'jog po'i gtsug gi rgyan gyi man ngag bzhin du thabs des sgrub par mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that one cannot accomplish it by that method, like the instruction on the crest jewel of V·πõtra for pacifying poison.

original: skyes bu'i don ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The purpose of a person is characterized by high rebirth and the auspicious.

original: de rjod par byed pa yin gyi bya rog gi so brtags pa bzhin du skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu med pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa yin gyi bya rog gi so brtags pa bzhin du skyes bu'i don gyi 'bras bu med pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is that which expresses it, not like the examination of a crow‚Äôs teeth, which has no result for the purpose of a person.

original: 'on te 'di thams cad ser skya la sogs pa'i tshig dag la yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di thams cad ser skya la sogs pa'i tshig dag la yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt all of this also found in the words of Kapila and so on?

original: mthong don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe purpose of seeing . . .‚Äù

original: mthong ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul dang yul ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod  pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul dang yul ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod  pa'i tshad ma gnyis kyis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis so //
translated: Seeing is the two: direct perception and inference. The two valid knowledges that are asserted to be the objects and non-objects of direct perception and inference are direct perception and inference.

original: gnod pa med pa ni ji ltar bstan pa'i don de ltar yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ni ji ltar bstan pa'i don de ltar yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-deceptive is because it exists in that way, the meaning that is taught.

original: 'di ltar mngon pa la sogs pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / blo'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po mngon sum nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni rnam pa gzhan du mi srid pa mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyang mngon sum ma yin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon pa la sogs pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / blo'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po mngon sum nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni rnam pa gzhan du mi srid pa mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyang mngon sum ma yin pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the five aggregates of the nature of cognition, such as the Abhidharma, pleasure and pain, the apprehension of signs, attachment, etc., are accepted as direct perception, but those that are not accepted as direct perception, such as the nonexistence of what is impossible, are not direct perception.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la 'du ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / rdzas dang / las dang / spyi dang ldan pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la 'du ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / rdzas dang / las dang / spyi dang ldan pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the pleasure of union, etc., in regard to form, sound, etc., which are accepted as direct perception by others, and the possession of substance, action, and universals, etc.,

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid mngon par 'dod pa rnams de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid mngon par 'dod pa rnams de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: are just like that, so too the objects of inference that engage by the power of fact are accepted as just that.

original: dper na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the four noble truths.

original: yul ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyang yul ma yin pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyang yul ma yin pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: And those that are not objects of knowledge are not objects of knowledge.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bdag la sogs pa rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bdag la sogs pa rnams lta bu'o //
translated: Just like the self, etc., which are accepted as objects of inference based on the power of other things.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni ma mthong ba la yang rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang chos ma yin pa de las byung bar bstan nas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba bdag med par lta ba nyid ga nyen por ston gyi ser skya la sogs pa'i
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni ma mthong ba la yang rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no // de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang chos ma yin pa de las byung bar bstan nas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba dang 'gal ba bdag med par lta ba nyid ga nyen por ston gyi ser skya la sogs pa'i
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they do not change in the absence of perception.

original: bstan bcos bzhin du de'i rgyu dang mi 'gal ba khrus dang me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa nye bar ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos bzhin du de'i rgyu dang mi 'gal ba khrus dang me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa nye bar ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, having shown that desire, etc., are not real entities, in order to eliminate them, he teaches the antidote to their cause, the view of self, which is the view of selflessness. He does not teach, like the treatises of Kapila, etc., a cause that is not incompatible with that, such as bathing and fire oblations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis @302b rnam par dag pa'i gser bzhin du 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags nas gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis @302b rnam par dag pa'i gser bzhin du 'di ni mkhas pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags nas gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúLike refined gold, the wise should accept this after thorough examination.‚Äù

original: sreg dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sreg dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúBurned, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gser sbyangs pas dri ma med pa ste skyon dang bral ba yongs su rtogs na bsregs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar gser sbyangs pas dri ma med pa ste skyon dang bral ba yongs su rtogs na bsregs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: Just as refined gold, which is stainless, i.e., free from faults, is not changed by burning, etc., when it is thoroughly examined,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rin po che yang bsregs pa dang 'dra bar mngon sum gyis dang / bdar ba lta bur dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang / bcad pa'i dpas mtshon pa'i lung la ltos pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rin po che yang bsregs pa dang 'dra bar mngon sum gyis dang / bdar ba lta bur dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang / bcad pa'i dpas mtshon pa'i lung la ltos pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: the precious speech of the BhagavƒÅn is also not changed by burning, i.e., direct perception, or by smelting, i.e., inference that engages by the power of the thing itself, or by cutting, i.e., inference that depends on scripture.

original: des na rtogs pa sngon du btang ba rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i lung nyid las 'jug par rigs kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa sngon du btang ba rnams rnam pa de lta bu'i lung nyid las 'jug par rigs kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is proper that those who have previously realized the scriptures should enter in this way, but not by any other means.

original: 'dir rin po che dang chos mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rin po che dang chos mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the similarity of the jewel, he says:üîΩThe light of the sun of the Jina's teaching

original: blo gros ngan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros ngan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: destroys the blindness of those with poor intellects.

original: blo ngan pa nyid ni mun pa yin te ;
analyzed: blo ngan pa nyid ni mun pa yin te ;
translated: The poor intellects are the darkness,

original: long bar byed pas so //
analyzed: long bar byed pas so //
translated: because they are blinded.

original: de 'joms pa ni 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: de 'joms pa ni 'jig pa ste /
translated: The destruction of that is the destruction.

original: de la rjes su mthun pa 'byung ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o /
analyzed: de la rjes su mthun pa 'byung ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o /
translated: That which is favorable to that is so called.

original: sdig can rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sdig can rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The sinful are those who are not meritorious.

original: 'das ma thag tu gsal bar bshad //
analyzed: 'das ma thag tu gsal bar bshad //
translated: Immediately after that, it is clearly explained.

original: ces bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'o //
translated: The result of the reason is the arising of the words as they are explained.

original: rgyal ba sangs rgyas sogs skyes bu //
analyzed: rgyal ba sangs rgyas sogs skyes bu //
translated: The Victorious One, the Buddha, and so forth, are the persons.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so forth means:

original: mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúhe is the one who subdued the demons‚Äù and so on is as follows:

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das bdud ba tul ba ni khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pa las khyad par du grub pa na yang bden par smra ba khyed cag gi khyad par bzung ba
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das bdud ba tul ba ni khyu mchog dang sdong ris la sogs pa las khyad par du grub pa na yang bden par smra ba khyed cag gi khyad par bzung ba
translated: Since the BhagavƒÅn possesses the special exalted wisdom as explained, when he is established as superior to the likes of the bull and the lion, it is not right for you realists to claim that he is not superior.

original: ma yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don te /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don te /
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: 'di snyam du rtsis la sogs pa phyogs gcig gis don la mi slu ba'i phyir kho bo cag gis gnyi ga yang khyad par med par brjod pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rtsis la sogs pa phyogs gcig gis don la mi slu ba'i phyir kho bo cag gis gnyi ga yang khyad par med par brjod pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWe say that both are not different because of being nondeceptive in one respect, such as in calculation and so on,‚ÄùüîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

analyzed: yi ge'i phyi mo rig tsam gyis //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / yi ge'i phyi mo ni grub pa'i dngos po'i 'bras bu can no //

original: gtan tshigs gang gis gcig nyid la //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gis gcig nyid la //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
