original: des na gtan tshigs gang zhig gis //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs gang zhig gis //
translated: Therefore, by what reason

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: de'i gtan tshigs dngos med phyir //üîΩ@303a * // zhes bya ba ni gal te /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs dngos med phyir // @303a * // zhes bya ba ni gal te /
translated: Because of the nonexistence of the reason

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don can don thams cad khyab pa'i 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa rnams ston pa po yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam yod pa de lta na yang dngos po dang 'brel pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po gtan tshigs kyi don med pa'i
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don can don thams cad khyab pa'i 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa rnams ston pa po yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam yod pa de lta na yang dngos po dang 'brel pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po gtan tshigs kyi don med pa'i
translated: If it is said that the mere sound exists because it is the revealer of the meaning of all things, which is pervaded by the unmistaken meaning, then even so, the reason for the connection with the thing is the nonexistence of the thing, the meaning of the reason.

original: phyir gtan tshigs kyis 'di ser skya la sogs pa gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir gtan tshigs kyis 'di ser skya la sogs pa gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason does not exist for others such as Kapila.

original: dngos po kho na dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir dngos po go bar byed pa yin gyi sgra tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po kho na dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir dngos po go bar byed pa yin gyi sgra tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Only a thing is the reason for understanding a thing because of the connection with the thing, not mere sound.

original: rgyal ba kun mkhyen du sgrub la //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun mkhyen du sgrub la //
translated: The omniscience of the Victor is established

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rgyal ba kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyal ba kun mkhyen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The omniscience of the Victor and so on.

original: ma khros pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang bral te de dag ni rtse ba kho nas gzhan rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma khros pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang bral te de dag ni rtse ba kho nas gzhan rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot angry‚Äù means free from anger. They engage in play only in order to take care of others.

original: khyed cag ltar sdang ba dang nga rgyal ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed cag ltar sdang ba dang nga rgyal ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like you, who are angry, proud, and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni des nye bar bstan pa'i 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa sun phyung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni des nye bar bstan pa'i 'gyur ba smra ba la sogs pa sun phyung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro // de dag rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the refutation of the assertion that they speak in order to teach.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir non-abiding‚Äù and so on.

original: 'brel ba grub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel ba grub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe establishment of the connection‚Äù and so on.

original: 'brel pa grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pas grub pa de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pas grub pa de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe establishment of the connection‚Äù means the connection that is established by the power of things, which is the nature of that, the characteristic of its arising. This is the meaning of ‚Äúconnection.‚Äù

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhich‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: gang zhig shes bya gzhal bya nyid ;üîΩ/ ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig shes bya gzhal bya nyid ; / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is an object of knowledge and an object of appraisal‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscience‚Äù and so on.

original: don gzhan sgrub pas don gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par 'dod pas dngos sam brgyud pas 'gal ba nyid bsgrubs pa las 'gal ba rtogs par bya'i mi 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan sgrub pas don gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par 'dod pas dngos sam brgyud pas 'gal ba nyid bsgrubs pa las 'gal ba rtogs par bya'i mi 'gal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Since you assert that the negation of one thing is established by establishing another thing, you should understand contradiction by establishing either direct or indirect contradiction, but not noncontradiction.

original: de lta ma yin pa gang yang rung ba zhig bsgrubs pas thams cad bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa gang yang rung ba zhig bsgrubs pas thams cad bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if you establish any one of them, all would be negated.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig dngos sam brgyud pas 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig dngos sam brgyud pas 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscience‚Äù and so on are not in any way directly or indirectly contradictory.

original: 'di ltar nges par dpyad pa na dngos po rnams kyi 'gal ba ni rnam pa gnyis kho nar gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges par dpyad pa na dngos po rnams kyi 'gal ba ni rnam pa gnyis kho nar gnas te /
translated: When analyzed in this way, the contradiction of things is only of two types.

original: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'am rim dang rim ma yin pa dag lta bur phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'am rim dang rim ma yin pa dag lta bur phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: For example, like entity and non-entity, or gradual and non-gradual, they are mutually exclusive, having the characteristic of being incompatible.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dper na me dang grang ba'i reg pa de dag bzhin du lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dper na me dang grang ba'i reg pa de dag bzhin du lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Or, in another way, like fire and cold touch, they are incompatible, having the characteristic of not coexisting.

original: de la re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shes bya nyid la sogs pa dang lhan cig @303b 'gal ba dang po srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shes bya nyid la sogs pa dang lhan cig @303b 'gal ba dang po srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, first, omniscience is not possible as incompatible with the knowable, etc.

original: shes bya min sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bya min sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚Äúnot knowable, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par bcad pa med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho na phan tshun 'gal te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par bcad pa med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho na phan tshun 'gal te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Those that are mutually exclusive, having the characteristic of being incompatible, are only those that are invariably concomitant, as was previously explained.

original: shes bya la sos pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par bcad nas gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya la sos pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par bcad nas gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Omniscience is not incompatible with the knowable, etc., because it does not exist by having eliminated the knowable, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: shes bya ma yin pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas so //
analyzed: shes bya ma yin pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas so //
translated: Having eliminated the non-object of knowledge, etc.

original: 'gal ba gnyis pa yang srid pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis pa yang srid pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second contradiction is also impossible, as is taught by

original: la lar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid /
analyzed: la lar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid /
translated: ‚ÄúIn some places, omniscience,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: gang zhig rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba na gang nye ba las mi 'byung ba med de de dag kho na lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba na gang nye ba las mi 'byung ba med de de dag kho na lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin la /
translated: When something arises without a cause being incomplete, there is nothing that does not arise from what is near. Those are the characteristics of the contradiction of non-co-existence.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa nyid la sogs pa yod pa na ldog pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa 'di sngar ma tshang ba med par 'jug par mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa nyid la sogs pa yod pa na ldog pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba thams cad mkhyen pa 'di sngar ma tshang ba med par 'jug par mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And because existence, etc. exist, it is called ‚Äúreversal.‚Äù This omniscience is not seen to previously engage without incompleteness.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'jug ce na /üîΩrang bzhin rang rig med pa na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'jug ce na / rang bzhin rang rig med pa na //
translated: Why does it not engage?üîΩ‚ÄúBecause of the absence of a nature and self-awareness,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.‚Äù

original: gal te yod pa nyid dang shes bya nyid dang shes bya nyid yod pa na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ldog pa yin no zhes khyed kyi khas len pa de lta na ni yod pa la sogs pa nye ba las sngar 'di'i med pa nyid dang rang rigüîΩpas kyang shes par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces khas blangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid dang shes bya nyid dang shes bya nyid yod pa na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ldog pa yin no zhes khyed kyi khas len pa de lta na ni yod pa la sogs pa nye ba las sngar 'di'i med pa nyid dang rang rig pas kyang shes par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces khas blangs par 'gyur la /
translated: If you accept that if something exists, if it is an object of knowledge, and if it is an object of knowledge that exists, then omniscience is impossible, then you would be accepting that prior to the existence of something such as existence, it does not exist and that it is not an object of reflexive awareness.

original: de lta yin dang med pa nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa dang shes bya ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa ma yin pa na thams cad mkhyen pa'i skye ba ste 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar sngar 'jug cing phyir ldog pa zhes bya par
analyzed: de lta yin dang med pa nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa dang shes bya ma yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa ma yin pa na thams cad mkhyen pa'i skye ba ste 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar sngar 'jug cing phyir ldog pa zhes bya par
translated: If that were the case, since it would not be an object of reflexive awareness because it would not exist and would not be an object of knowledge, then omniscience would not arise. Therefore how could it be said that it previously engaged and later disengaged?

original: 'gyur / rang bzhin med pa'i skye ba srid pa ma yin la mi dmigs pa la yod par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yang med de /
analyzed: 'gyur / rang bzhin med pa'i skye ba srid pa ma yin la mi dmigs pa la yod par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yang med de /
translated: The arising of that which lacks intrinsic existence is not possible, and there is no reason to posit that which is not observed as existent.

original: dngos po yod pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for positing the existence of things is not consciousness.

original: de lta bas na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he thinks that he contradicts his own words.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'dis sngar 'jug par khas len na de'i tshe 'bad pa med par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'dis sngar 'jug par khas len na de'i tshe 'bad pa med par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if he accepts that it operates previously, then omniscience is established without effort.

original: des na de spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to abandon it.

original: de lta ma yin na rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were not so, he would contradict his own words. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: de ltar sngar 'jug yod pa na //
analyzed: de ltar sngar 'jug yod pa na //
translated: If it operates previously,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: sngar 'jug pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa khas len na zhes lhag @304a * //
analyzed: sngar 'jug pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa khas len na zhes lhag @304a * //
translated: If one accepts that the omniscience operates previously, then the rest is clear.

original: ma'o ; / yang ci ste /
analyzed: ma'o ; / yang ci ste /
translated: Again, if one thinks:

original: shes bya la sogs mi 'gal mod //
analyzed: shes bya la sogs mi 'gal mod //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no contradiction with respect to the object of knowledge, etc.üîΩEven so, one becomes accustomed to the nonexistence of omniscience.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa med par goms par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang thams cad mkhyen pa med par goms par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: He says:

original: 'gal ba med pa bsgrubs pa yis //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa bsgrubs pa yis //
translated: By establishing the noncontradiction,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: gal te yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes bya nyid la sogs pa mi 'gal na yang smra ba nyid dang ni 'gal ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes bya nyid la sogs pa mi 'gal na yang smra ba nyid dang ni 'gal ba kho na ste /
translated: If omniscience were not incompatible with being an object of knowledge, etc., it would be incompatible with speech alone,

original: brgyud nas de'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyud nas de'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cause, discursive thought, is not compatible with omniscience.

original: 'di ltar ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig tu mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pas tshig gi rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig tu mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i rigs pas tshig gi rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable to say that one does not speak without discursive thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad brjod pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad brjod pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Discursive thought is the cause of speech, but all discursive thought does not grasp the nature of things as it is, because it is similar to expression.

original: de ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the domain of nonconceptual consciousness.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yod pa ma yin pas smra ba po 'di brjod par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid las rgyu mi dmigs pas ldog pa
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yod pa ma yin pas smra ba po 'di brjod par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid las rgyu mi dmigs pas ldog pa
translated: This reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you state

original: nges so zhes grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nges so zhes grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Is not established for you.

original: smra bar brjod pa'i gtan tshigs 'di yang /üîΩgang zhig shes bya gzhal bya nyid //
analyzed: smra bar brjod pa'i gtan tshigs 'di yang / gang zhig shes bya gzhal bya nyid //
translated: This reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.üîΩThis reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.

original: dngos po yod nyid sogs zhes bya ba 'dir sogs kyi sgras 'phar ba kho na'o snyam du gang sems pa 'di de 'dir sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu nas 'dir yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par
analyzed: dngos po yod nyid sogs zhes bya ba 'dir sogs kyi sgras 'phar ba kho na'o snyam du gang sems pa 'di de 'dir sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu nas 'dir yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par
translated: This reason that you stateüîΩIs not established for you.

original: byed de // kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du gyur ba nyid kyis smra ba yin no zhes khas len pa /
analyzed: byed de // kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du gyur ba nyid kyis smra ba yin no zhes khas len pa /
translated: Some believe that the Lord speaks through the direct perception of conceptual thought.

original: gzhan dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'jug pa ni rnam par rtog pa med na yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis so zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'jug pa ni rnam par rtog pa med na yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis so zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Others, however, claim that the speech of the Lord is due to the power of his former vow, even though it is devoid of conceptual thought.

original: de la gzhung lugs dang po la gal te rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs su thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin par sgrub par byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la gzhung lugs dang po la gal te rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs su thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin par sgrub par byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa nyid de /
translated: In this regard, if the first philosophical position is established, i.e. that the Lord is not omniscient in the state of conceptual thought, then that is precisely the establishment of what is already established for us;

original: de dag gis de'i gnas skabs na bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag gis de'i gnas skabs na bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: for they themselves accept that the Lord is not omniscient in that state.

original: ci ste rtog pa med pa'i gnas skabs na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub par 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rtog pa med pa'i gnas skabs na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub par 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if the second philosophical position is established, i.e. that the Lord is not omniscient in the state devoid of conceptual thought, then the reason is unestablished.

original: de'i tshe kun nas slong par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med @304b pa'i phyir gnas skabs de ni tshig 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun nas slong par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med @304b pa'i phyir gnas skabs de ni tshig 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, because there is no thought that instigates it, that occasion is not the occasion for the application of words.üîΩIf it is not the case that it is not a valid cognition because it is not omniscient at the time of conceptual thought,

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smra ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin na ma zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smra ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin na ma zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: then anticipating the qualm, ‚ÄúIn that case, it is not a valid cognition because it is not omniscient at the time of nonconceptual cognition,‚Äù he says,

original: de lta yin na'ang de la ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta yin na'ang de la ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even though that is so, it is notüîΩthe case that it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te de'i gnas skabs na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i gnas skabs na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not omniscient at the time of conceptual thought, even though that is so, it is not the case that it is not a valid cognition.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is projected by omniscience.

original: de nyid kyi phyi 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir rgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pas rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba yang yin
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyi 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir rgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pas rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba yang yin
translated: Because it is produced by the power of omniscient knowledge, it is like an inference that is related to a thing, and therefore it is a valid cognition.

original: no // 'di nyid la dper brjod pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: no // 'di nyid la dper brjod pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: An example is stated:

original: 'ga' zhig dro ba nyams myong na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde don myong ba las byung phyir //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dro ba nyams myong na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de don myong ba las byung phyir //
translated: When someone experiences heat,üîΩhe infers a fireüîΩbecause he remembers its invariable concomitance.

original: zhes bya ba ni dro ba de'i don nyams su myong ba'i phyir brgyud nas rnam par rtog pa byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dro ba de'i don nyams su myong ba'i phyir brgyud nas rnam par rtog pa byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that because he experiences the object of that heat, it is said that the inference arises from that.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni dro ba nyams su myong ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni dro ba nyams su myong ba'i tshig las so //
translated: From that means from the words that experience the heat.

original: 'di snyam du gal te thams cad mkhyen pa la rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yod na de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te thams cad mkhyen pa la rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yod na de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the omniscient one has a conceptual consciousness, then he would be mistaken.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyis rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'jug pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyis rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'jug pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that conceptualization is mistaken because it engages its object by conceiving its own appearance as meaningless to be meaningful,

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: that is not so.

original: gal te sgro btags pa de dang de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid ngo bo rnam par phye nas mi shes pa yin na de'i tshe 'khur par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgro btags pa de dang de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid ngo bo rnam par phye nas mi shes pa yin na de'i tshe 'khur par 'gyur na /
translated: If the superimposition of that were not known to be an entity that is the nature of reality, then it would be a burden.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i yul sgro btags pa ni sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kho nar nges la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i yul sgro btags pa ni sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kho nar nges la /
translated: In that case, the object of conceptualization, the superimposition, would definitely be only the nature of a superimposition.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid kyi logs shig tu de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid du gzigs pa na ji ltar phyin ci log ces bya /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid kyi logs shig tu de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid du gzigs pa na ji ltar phyin ci log ces bya /
translated: When the nature of reality is seen as the nature of reality apart from external things that are the object of nonconceptual consciousness, how could it be called mistaken?

original: gal te phyin ci log ma yin na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na sgro 'dogs par byed ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log ma yin na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na sgro 'dogs par byed ce na ma yin te /
translated: If it is not mistaken, how could it be superimposition when it is in the state of conceptualization?

original: sgra 'jug pa'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he knows the method of using words.

original: gang gi sgro btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan sgra kun nas slod par byed ba ma mthong ba la sgro btags pa las gzhan sgra'i don yang mi dmigs so //üîΩde bas na sgra 'jug pa'i thabs mkhyen pa 'gro ba la thugs brtse bas de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud @305a * //
analyzed: gang gi sgro btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan sgra kun nas slod par byed ba ma mthong ba la sgro btags pa las gzhan sgra'i don yang mi dmigs so // de bas na sgra 'jug pa'i thabs mkhyen pa 'gro ba la thugs brtse bas de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud @305a * //
translated: Since he does not see any other meaning of the word apart from the conceptual differentiation that is superimposed, he does not apprehend any meaning of the word apart from the superimposition.

original: pa gzhan la ma bstan par bzhugs pa mi spyod pa na de bstan par bzhed nas sgra 'jug pa'i thabs sgro btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang sgro gdags par bya ba'i brjod bya dgod par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa gzhan la ma bstan par bzhugs pa mi spyod pa na de bstan par bzhed nas sgra 'jug pa'i thabs sgro btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang sgro gdags par bya ba'i brjod bya dgod par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who knows the method of using words, out of compassion for the world, who has understood reality just as it is, who abides without engaging in activity because he has not taught it to others, when he wishes to teach it, he sets forth the conceptual differentiation that is the superimposition and the verbal expression that is to be superimposed, in order to make known the method of using words.

original: 'di yang phyir rgol ba bgags par byas nas len 'debs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang phyir rgol ba bgags par byas nas len 'debs par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, he does this after having refuted the opponent's position.

original: kho bo cag gis ni 'dir skabs su bab pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni 'dir skabs su bab pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: We have stated this in the present context.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang ldan pa nyid rjes su dpog pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smra ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang ldan pa nyid rjes su dpog pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is also unreasonable to infer the presence of attachment from speech,

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang tshig 'jug pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang tshig 'jug pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because speech is possible in other circumstances.

original: gang gi phyir g-yo ba dang brjod pa la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kho na'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir g-yo ba dang brjod pa la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kho na'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Because movement, speech, and so on are not exclusively the effects of attachment and so on,

original: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the general causes of the desire to speak.

original: brjod par 'dod pa nyid de yang snying rjes 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang srid pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa nyid de yang snying rjes 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang srid pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The desire to speak is also possible in the absence of attachment, due to compassion. Therefore, it is mistaken.

original: snying rje de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snying rje de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that compassion itself is attachment,

original: mi byed pa ni cung zad mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi byed pa ni cung zad mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: then it is not that you do not accept non-action at all.

original: 'on kyang rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gir lta bas 'phangs pa zad pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i yul can gyi sems kyi mngon par zhen pa'i 'dod chags yin par brjod la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gir lta bas 'phangs pa zad pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i yul can gyi sems kyi mngon par zhen pa'i 'dod chags yin par brjod la /
translated: But it is said that attachment is the manifest adherence of the mind to a thing that is perishable, which is projected by the view of permanence, pleasure, self, and mine.

original: de la sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gi la gnod pa la sdang ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: de la sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gi la gnod pa la sdang ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Hatred is the aversion to the harm of self and mine, which is preceded by the view of self and mine.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni gti mug go //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ni gti mug go //
translated: Delusion is the grasping of self and mine.

original: snying rje ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: snying rje ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Compassion is not like that.

original: de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa yang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyis goms pa'i stobs kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa yang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyis goms pa'i stobs kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from the power of habit, merely through seeing the particular suffering, even without the grasping of self.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la chos la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa 'byung bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la chos la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i byams pa la sogs pa 'byung bar bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained in the treatise that love, etc., which have the dharmas, etc., as their objects, arise for those who are free from attachment.

original: 'di snyam du thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa mngon du phyogs pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa mngon du phyogs pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that the mere presence of a consciousness that is the subject of all is the proof, then it would be a proof of what is already established.

original: 'di ltar dngos po mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid shes pa'i nus pa nyid sgrub par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid shes pa'i nus pa nyid sgrub par 'dod de /
translated: For, you assert that the very capacity to know the reality of all things is the proof.

original: des na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin la //
analyzed: des na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin la //
translated: Therefore, it is not a proof of what is already established.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.üîΩFor, you assert that mere verbal capacity is the reason.

original: tshig tsam gyi nus pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na //üîΩdngos po mtha' dag shes pa yi //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyi nus pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na // dngos po mtha' dag shes pa yi //
translated: If you think this,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe capacity to know all things,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyogs gnyi ga la yang gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga la yang gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because in both positions there is no valid knowledge that contradicts the opposite of the probandum of the reason,

original: bzlog pa the tshom za ba nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma @305b nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa the tshom za ba nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma @305b nges pa yin no //
translated: the reason is uncertain because the opposite is doubtful.

original: gang gi ltar na rnam par mi byed na yang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na rnam par mi byed na yang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la /
translated: In response to the position that even though the BhagavƒÅn does not engage in action, his speech engages,

original: 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di ltar 'khor lo dbyig pas bskor ba'i bya ba dang bral nas yang snga ma'i shugs kyi dbang gis 'khor ba de ltar bcom ldan 'das la rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i shes pa can du gnas na'ang sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi shugs
analyzed: 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar 'khor lo dbyig pas bskor ba'i bya ba dang bral nas yang snga ma'i shugs kyi dbang gis 'khor ba de ltar bcom ldan 'das la rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i shes pa can du gnas na'ang sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi shugs
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúThe wheel would not be set in motion,‚Äù and so on.

original: kyi dbang gis bstan pa 'jug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: kyi dbang gis bstan pa 'jug pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as a wheel that is separated from the action of being set in motion by a potter continues to turn due to the force of its previous momentum, in the same way, even though the BhagavƒÅn abides in a state of mind that is free from all conceptualization, his teaching continues to engage due to the force of his previous accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: blo bzang ni bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: blo bzang ni bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Sugata is the one who has a good mind.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba kha cig gis khas len pa de la ma grub pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsal la rab tu nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba kha cig gis khas len pa de la ma grub pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi skyon gsal la rab tu nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: The fault of the reason being unestablished is clear and certain for those who assert that the BhagavƒÅn is consciousness only.

original: 'di snyam du gzhung 'di la thams cad rang gi ngo bo snang ba nyams su myong ba tsam yin pa'i phyir don dam par smra ba 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzhung 'di la thams cad rang gi ngo bo snang ba nyams su myong ba tsam yin pa'i phyir don dam par smra ba 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: One might think, In this treatise, since everything is merely the experience of the appearance of one's own entity, there is no one who speaks about the ultimate.

original: 'on kyang mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis gzhan la mi smra ba na yang de lta bur snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa la bdag po'i rkyen gyi ngo bos gnas pa na 'jig rten smra ba nyid mngon par zhen la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis gzhan la mi smra ba na yang de lta bur snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa la bdag po'i rkyen gyi ngo bos gnas pa na 'jig rten smra ba nyid mngon par zhen la /
translated: However, due to the power of manifest clinging, even though one does not speak to others, when the consciousness that appears in that way arises, it abides by the nature of the dominant condition, and one manifestly clings to worldly speech.

original: 'jig rten pas rtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i smra ba po de nyid gtan tshigs su 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas rtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i smra ba po de nyid gtan tshigs su 'dod do //
translated: The one who speaks with manifest clinging, understood by the worldly, is asserted as the reason.

original: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' la grags pa'i gtan tshigs sa ma chos can byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' la grags pa'i gtan tshigs sa ma chos can byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the reason renowned in the philosophical tenet systems is not made into the subject.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Then what is it?

original: 'jig rten grags pa kho na yin pa des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa kho na yin pa des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Since it is renowned only in the world, one might think, The reason is not established. Anticipating that qualm, [the treatise] states:

original: gang yang 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'dir yang snga ma bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is worldly‚Äù and so on.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Here, as before, the reason is indeterminate because there is doubt about the reversal of the discordant side.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi 'dir rnam par shes par smra ba'i tshul ma grub pa smras pa gang yin pa de sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi 'dir rnam par shes par smra ba'i tshul ma grub pa smras pa gang yin pa de sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù and so on state the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs claim that the Vij√±aptika system is unestablished.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa gang yin pa de kho na sgrub pa'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa gang yin pa de kho na sgrub pa'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is stated with certainty for both parties is either an establishment or a refutation.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that either is unestablished or doubtful for either party.

original: de yang sgrub par byed pa ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: de yang sgrub par byed pa ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is because the establishment depends on the other party.

original: tshad mas mi mthad  pa'i rnam par shes pa smra ba'i gzhung de la ji ltar ma grub par ston /
analyzed: tshad mas mi mthad  pa'i rnam par shes pa smra ba'i gzhung de la ji ltar ma grub par ston /
translated: How is the Vij√±aptika treatise, which is not established by valid cognition, taught to be unestablished?

original: rang gi 'dod pa tsam gyis grub pa dang ma grub pa yongs su brtags pa la sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa tsam gyis grub pa dang ma grub pa yongs su brtags pa la sun 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the refutation is based on a mere wish, or on an examination of whether or not something is established.

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: What is it based on?

original: tshad ma'i stobs kyis bsgrub pa'i grub pa dang ma grub pa @306a * //üîΩdag las ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i stobs kyis bsgrub pa'i grub pa dang ma grub pa @306a * // dag las ma yin no //
translated: It is based on the establishment or nonestablishment by the power of valid cognition.üîΩIt is not based on the establishment or nonestablishment by the power of the mode of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshul ni tshad ma'i stobs las grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshul ni tshad ma'i stobs las grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the mode of consciousness is not established by the power of valid cognition,

original: 'di rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: because it has already been extensively explained,

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed do //
translated: we respond: ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /üîΩres 'ga' smra ba nyid rang dbang du bsgrub par 'dod pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te / res 'ga' smra ba nyid rang dbang du bsgrub par 'dod pa yin nam /
translated: There are two alternatives here.üîΩSometimes you want to prove that the speaker is independent.

original: thal bsgrub par byed pa yin grang /
analyzed: thal bsgrub par byed pa yin grang /
translated: Or sometimes you want to prove the absurd consequence.

original: de la phyogs dang po la rten khyad par gyis ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la rten khyad par gyis ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa yin no //
translated: In the first case, the reason is not established because the basis is not established, due to the difference in the position.

original: ci ste rten spyir brjod par 'dod pa de lta na yang ji srid du phyir rgol ba la smra ba nyid tshad mas ma bsgrubs pa de srid du the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rten spyir brjod par 'dod pa de lta na yang ji srid du phyir rgol ba la smra ba nyid tshad mas ma bsgrubs pa de srid du the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But even if you do assert that the basis is generally known, as long as you have not established the statement itself by means of a valid cognition for the opponent, then it is not established because of doubt.üîΩIt is only that which is ascertained for both parties that is a proof.

original: gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is the correct method.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni smra ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the statement.

original: de bas na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong bas khyod kyis thal bar bsgrub pa khas blang bar bya dgos la /üîΩthal ba sgrub pa de la yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyi lung tsam las gzhan la rab tu grags pa'i chos de nyid phan tshun 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong bas khyod kyis thal bar bsgrub pa khas blang bar bya dgos la / thal ba sgrub pa de la yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyi lung tsam las gzhan la rab tu grags pa'i chos de nyid phan tshun 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since this fault would ensue, you must accept the reductio.

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid du gsal bar bya ba yin gyi //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid du gsal bar bya ba yin gyi //
translated: And in that reductio, in order to show that the very thing that is renowned to others is contradictory, you must state the proof, which is merely scripture that is delightful when not analyzed.

original: 'di tshad mas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tshad mas bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that this is established by a valid cognition.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no need for that.

original: gzhan yang smra ba nyid lung tsam gyis grub pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgnyi ga la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang smra ba nyid lung tsam gyis grub pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir / gnyi ga la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, speech is not established by mere scripture.üîΩTherefore, the reason is not established for both parties.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud pa ni gzhan gyis smras pa las bzlog pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud pa ni gzhan gyis smras pa las bzlog pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary beginning with ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is stated for the opposite meaning of what the opponent said.

original: de ni su zhig rtogs mi byed //
analyzed: de ni su zhig rtogs mi byed //
translated: Who would not understand that?

original: ces bya ba ni srid pa nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni srid pa nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is ‚Äúin existence.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir de'i srid pa nyid grub pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir de'i srid pa nyid grub pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that existence is established because the harm-doer is not observed.

original: re zhig 'di zhog rig byed smra ba'i mthar gnas pa'i rigs pa ngan pa gang yin pa de mdzes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ngo mtshar med kyi /
analyzed: re zhig 'di zhog rig byed smra ba'i mthar gnas pa'i rigs pa ngan pa gang yin pa de mdzes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ngo mtshar med kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúPut that aside for now. The bad reasoning of the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka is not beautiful,‚Äù this is not surprising.

original: 'on kyang khyed kyis brjod pa'i rigs pa bzang po yang rten gyi rkyen gyis mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed kyis brjod pa'i rigs pa bzang po yang rten gyi rkyen gyis mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: However, even your good reasoning is not beautiful due to the condition of its basis.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: du ba me la mi 'khrul pa //
analyzed: du ba me la mi 'khrul pa //
translated: Smoke is not confused with fire.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúSmoke is not confused about fire‚Äù and so on.

original: du ba ni me dang 'brel bar skye ba nyid kyis de la mi 'khrul ba nyid du gnag rdzi'i bar du shin tu grags pa nyid la /
analyzed: du ba ni me dang 'brel bar skye ba nyid kyis de la mi 'khrul ba nyid du gnag rdzi'i bar du shin tu grags pa nyid la /
translated: Smoke is not confused about fire because it arises in connection with fire. This is very well known even to cowherders.

original: de yang khyed kyis 'gro ba thams cad dngos po nyid la sogs pas don dam par gcig nyid du brjod pa na me la mi 'khrul ba nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang khyed kyis 'gro ba thams cad dngos po nyid la sogs pas don dam par gcig nyid du brjod pa na me la mi 'khrul ba nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, when you say that all things are ultimately one, in terms of entity and so on, you cannot demonstrate that it is not confused about fire.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis @306b dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis don dam par du ba chu la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis @306b dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis don dam par du ba chu la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, according to your system, in reality smoke would also engage with water, due to the nature of entities.

original: 'di snyam du chu de la yang du ba bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis me yang yod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa nyid do snyam du sems na /üîΩde la yang ni me yod na //
analyzed: 'di snyam du chu de la yang du ba bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis me yang yod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa nyid do snyam du sems na / de la yang ni me yod na //
translated: If you think that just as there is smoke there, fire also exists there by the nature of entities, and therefore there is no confusion,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If fire exists there,

original: de la yang ni chu'o //
analyzed: de la yang ni chu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to water.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid kyi me yod par khas len par byed na de'i tshe me bsgrub par bya ba chu la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid kyi me yod par khas len par byed na de'i tshe me bsgrub par bya ba chu la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that fire exists in the nature of water, then the object to be established, water, would not be the discordant side.

original: de lta yin dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa ci la brten pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa ci la brten pa yin /
translated: If that were so, then because there would be no discordant side, the evidence, such as smoke, would not be based on the reversal of the discordant side.

original: gal te don dam par chu la mi gnas so zhes bya bar grub na ci'i phyir de'i ngo bor dmigs pa dang btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bur snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te don dam par chu la mi gnas so zhes bya bar grub na ci'i phyir de'i ngo bor dmigs pa dang btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bur snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is established that fire does not exist in water ultimately, why would a cognition that perceives its nature and appears as the effect characterized by boiling and burning not arise?

original: gal te mi 'dra ba yang yod do zhe na /üîΩbdag gi dngos po mi 'dra na'ang //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dra ba yang yod do zhe na / bdag gi dngos po mi 'dra na'ang //
translated: If you say that there is also a difference,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúeven if the nature of the self is different,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di sangs rgyas par smra ba brtag par dpyad zin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: 'di sangs rgyas par smra ba brtag par dpyad zin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Since the Buddhist proponents have already been analyzed in the examination,

original: re zhig 'di ni gzhag go //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni gzhag go //
translated: for now, this is set aside.

original: gang gis tshad ma gcig gis ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang gis tshad ma gcig gis ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: If you say that a single valid cognition

original: dngos po mtha' dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIf all things . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i blo la don thams cad yongs su shes par khas len par 'gyur na de'i tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i blo la don thams cad yongs su shes par khas len par 'gyur na de'i tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the eye consciousness and so on cognize all objects, then the previously explained error would follow.

original: 'di ltar dngos po mtha' dag la yod pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid ma lus pa goms par rab kyi mtha' las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa don thams cad kyi spyod yul can gyi gsal bar snang ba
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po mtha' dag la yod pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid ma lus pa goms par rab kyi mtha' las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa don thams cad kyi spyod yul can gyi gsal bar snang ba
translated: In that case, the reality that is the characteristic of all things, such as impermanence, would be completely familiar to the mental consciousness that arises from the final stage of the supreme mundane state, and it would appear clearly to the mind.

original: dang / mi slu ba nyid dag gi phyir mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pas cig car dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: dang / mi slu ba nyid dag gi phyir mngon sum nyid du khas blangs pas cig car dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen par 'dod kyi /
translated: Because it is nondeceptive, it would be accepted as direct perception. Therefore, because it would simultaneously apprehend all things, it would be asserted to be omniscience,

original: mig la sogs pa'i blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blo ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the eye consciousness and so on.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa don thams cad kyi yul can nyid du grub pa ma yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa don thams cad kyi yul can nyid du grub pa ma yin no zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the mental consciousness is not established as the subject of all objects.

original: gang gi phyir khyod kyang dran pa'i shes pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul can du brjod pa yin la de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod kyang dran pa'i shes pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul can du brjod pa yin la de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'o //
translated: Because you also say that the consciousness of memory is the subject of form, sound, and so on, and that is only mental consciousness.

original: rmi lam na yang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba shin tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir 'di bsnyon par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba shin tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir 'di bsnyon par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Because the appearance of form and so on in dreams is very well known, this cannot be denied.

original: des na khyad par du 'phags pa ni rang gi don mi spong ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir kho bo cung zad mi 'dod par 'gyur pa ni @307a * //
analyzed: des na khyad par du 'phags pa ni rang gi don mi spong ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir kho bo cung zad mi 'dod par 'gyur pa ni @307a * //
translated: Therefore, since we assert that the superiority of the mental consciousness is due to not abandoning its own object, we do not accept anything at all.

original: med do // rnam par shes par smra ba dag gi ltar na dbang po'i blos thams cad mkhyen par 'dod pa de'i ltar na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: med do // rnam par shes par smra ba dag gi ltar na dbang po'i blos thams cad mkhyen par 'dod pa de'i ltar na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: According to the Vij√±aptika, the omniscience of the mental faculty is asserted, and even then there is no fault.

original: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags spangs pa na blo thams cad la 'jug pa nyid kyis khyab bdag nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags spangs pa na blo thams cad la 'jug pa nyid kyis khyab bdag nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the latent potentialities of negative propensities are abandoned, since it engages all awarenesses, it is asserted to be the sovereign.

original: blo rnams kyi nges pa'i rgyu ni gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kho na yin te /
analyzed: blo rnams kyi nges pa'i rgyu ni gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kho na yin te /
translated: The cause of the determination of awarenesses is only the latent potentialities of negative propensities.

original: de spangs pa na de dag gi nges pa'i don gyi yul can nyid du gal 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de spangs pa na de dag gi nges pa'i don gyi yul can nyid du gal 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that when those are abandoned, it is impossible for them to be the objects of the meaning of determination,

original: yang na rnam dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na rnam dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then again, it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are pure,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu tha dad pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad par nges pa'i phyir dngos po la lar 'ga' zhig gi tshe mthong ba thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad par nges pa'i phyir dngos po la lar 'ga' zhig gi tshe mthong ba thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe de lta bu'i ngo bor nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since the natures of things are ascertained to be different due to their different causes, when something is seen at one time in one thing, it is not ascertained to be of that nature at all times and in all things.

original: la la dag skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu chung bar dmigs zhes te /
analyzed: la la dag skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu chung bar dmigs zhes te /
translated: Some observe that emblic myrobalan fruit is small,

original: de tsam gyis yul thams cad du rgyu'i bye brag srid na de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa dang ldan pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis de lta bu'i rnam pas gzung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis yul thams cad du rgyu'i bye brag srid na de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa dang ldan pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis de lta bu'i rnam pas gzung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the particular cause of all objects existed in that way, then it would be reasonable to apprehend them in that way, because of possessing the realization of just that. But it is not reasonable to apprehend them in that way, merely because one does not see them.üîΩTherefore, there is no contradiction in saying that some who have eyes opened by the special practice of yoga see all objects.üîΩThe verse says, ‚ÄúBy the valid cognition of the type of that . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe verse says, ‚ÄúBy the valid cognition of the type of that . . .‚Äù
